text: This place pretty wack. Came here after a really long morning to relax and get something to eat. I ordered the mother-shucker burger or whatever it's called. SPECIFICALLY said I wanted it well done and the whole thing was pink and disgusting. I didn't send it back, I just didn't wanna deal with it. But biting into it made me just feel so disgusted. Picture is taken when I brought it back in the leftover box. Also, the waiter was really really annoying. Like he wouldn't stop being nosy and asking us about the food like "are you going to want boxes later?" "Do you want dessert??" Chill bro
Do not ever go too crab corner...go only to shucks..best oysters for the money...incredible. ....omg and best service

Not cool. I have been here several times now and decided to take my daughter here for breakfast. Apparently they don't allow kids in here before 4pm because of some health code?? That's a little concerning... So I guess the only time to bring my 4 year old here is later in the day when it's full of drunks and smokers? I've only came here for drinks because the one time I ordered food, my burger didn't taste right and made me sick. Service has never impressed me, and I will Not be coming back!!

Great spot, good price and daily specials. They make some of their own sauces; the house made dressing is good. The ceviche is better than most in Vegas... They do it with some honey Dijon  sauce and salsa; bomb, if ur down for different flavor combos.

If you don't go here,you are missing a real treat. They have many many customers, therefore fresh seafood. Oysters are small but seem to be fresh and delicious. Shrimp ceviche to die for. Crab fantastic, clams delicious, fish and chips great.
They won't honor gift cards from anyone, and must process you credit card twice for anything over $100.00 dollars. Manager is very belligerent. No help at all. Wrote Corporate they don't care either.

Whoa move over Joe's Crab Shack, Shuck's has been discovered. The first time I came here I wasn't sure about how the food would taste, but I am glad that I tried it anyway. I tried the lobster bites and the crab dip both delicious. 

The second time I came here I saw a couple that ordered this big shell of seafood which was the clam bake. So my bf and I ordered it since it seemed like it would be enough food to eat. Of course it was...it has clams, crab, corn, potatoes, and sausage! MmMmM just the sound of it makes my mouth water.  

Totally worth the place to go to eat some seafood and watch some games. Great location, clean, and friendly staff!

My friend and I wanted to try a new place and didn't want to travel far from flamingo and 215 area. We enlisted Yelp to help us find a place to dine at. Shucks came to mind. After reading all the reviews this seemed to be THE place the be! so we decided to give it at shot. 

When you walk in you see is the bar, we looked for a hostess but there's a sign to seat yourself. On the right hand side is the bar with some high top tables to sit at and on the left there are tables and booths restaurant style. We decided to sit at a booth with a large table because we were planning on eating a lot of food. We were greeted by the waiter and he gave us some time to look at the menu. 

There is a pretty good selection of seafood and other items such as sandwiches and pasta to choose from. My friend and I went for the seafood. We ordered 1/2 a dozen raw oysters on the shell, 1/2 lb of black mussels, 1/2 lb of manila clams, 1 lb of snow crab legs, garlic french fries, and a crab and spinach dip. seasonings for the seafood we choose lemon and garlic. 

The food didn't take too long to come out except for our garlic fries. First, came the crab and spinach dip. Consistency was different than what I'm used to. It was a little runny and had a strong sea food taste from the crab. I'm used to this dip being a little thicker and more creamy.  We had to add some hot sauce, salt and pepper to the appetizer so it wouldn't taste as bland. The chips that came with it were almost a cross between a tortilla and a pita bread. 
Next came the oysters. Those were delicious. White meat not cloudy and didn't smell fishy. Then the rest of our food arrived.

 Everything smelled so GOOD and mouth watering but when we started slurping and eating everything our noses deceived us. The food smelled so tasty and aromatic but it did not taste the same way. Weird right? I guess we are so used to eating at Hot 'n' Juicy. We finished our meal and I totally didn't even notice that our garlic fries never came out. We flagged down the waiter and asked them if they forgot it? He went to check and said the cooks forgot but it seemed like he forgot to ring it in. 

The fries came out about 5 minutes later super oily and shiny with some sort of garlic white powder on top of them. I didn't even want to eat it. I tried one and the moment I bit into it I felt like an oil bubble bursted into my mouth.

This place is nice and clean but the service was a little poor. They only had 2 table sitting in that area with 2 servers serving as well.  The price is good for what you get especially since it is seafood. 

So if you are looking for something close in the area with mediocore seafood. This will be the spot.

If I could give this place negative stars I would, I have lived in Vegas for over a decade and never received service like this. Went in on June 14, 2017 @ 5:30 pm the male bartender on shift should be fired. He ignored me and my GF and attended to only regulars after ordering a beer, and not once asking for refills. After ordering dinner we didn't receive our order untill 45 min later (which was a salad, a wrap, a French fries) and in "to-go" bags when we never requested it. By that time a kind females bartender came on and asked him about us and our order seeing why it was "to-go" since we were at the bar where we ordered. The male bartender lied and said he never took our order. How a 50 year old bartender lies and acts like  a child is still beyond my belief. 
He did comp my beer because I gambled a little but his attitude and demeanor was atrocious and will be going on ever social media platform to complain about this experience. I have worked in customer service for years and don't expect red carpet service but to lie and be ignored for nothing is beyond my belief. I am more upset taking my time to write this but I could not bare this horrible service be unnoticed, I'd expect this from MC Donald's. Sorry but this place can go SHUCK itself.
I love this on saturday mornings with a hangover. The food is good and the crowd is family. I wish the oysters were bigger
Love this place. Great breakfast for $4.99. I always get the crescent breakfast sandwich which is delicious.
Cheap quality bar food at a high price.  Service is hit or miss.  Place is ugly.  Will suffice if you are in a late night munchie bind. 2.3 stars

I'll start by saying I'm not a HUGE seafood fan, but the wife is, so we went to Shuck's (conveniently located about a minute or so from our house). 

At first it looks like most of the 24 hour gaming/dining establishments in the area, but I wasn't really expected a fancy sit-down place, so I don't mark it down for appearance. 

It should also be noted that this is a Chicago Bears bar for the Sunday NFL games, so any of our Chicago implants here in Vegas might find some joy in hanging out with other Chicagoans.

I got the Chicken Club and some waffle fries which was very good and very filling and pretty cheap (about $8.95). My wife got the 2 and a half pound bucket of Snow Crab Legs which seems expensive ($32) but the meat was pletinful and very good and like I said, I don't eat too much seafood. 

They bring out all the proper equipment for breaking your legs and wet-naps for cleaning up afterward. So points there for being thorough. 

The waitress was not super attentive, and it seemed like they had just one woman working the entire restaurant and bar area. I know it was a Tuesday night, but there were a lot of people in there, you'd think they'd have a second server. 

All in all, Shuck's is who I thought they were (that's a Bears/Dennis Green reference for you football fans). 

It's a good place to go if you're looking for a better than average meal at a reasonable price (with the exception of the crab bucket). We'll go again, just probably not every night.

Shucks..a bit disappointed, last night I took family for the first time hoping to have the same experience as we did for about 10 times. The Clam Bake was the reason we always go on a Sat to have the $5 off, found that it wasn't anymore...crabs was an added option and you had to pay extra for it. It was still tasty but we should have gone to a buffet for the price we paid...It was still tasty though...Sadly..Shucks is now not on the top of my list..for value as the prices went up immensely...

For a restaurant/bar type dive, I think this place is great! I always have great and friendly service whether I'm sitting at the bar or in the restaurant side. I personally am not a huge fan of seafood but I enjoyed most of what they have to offer. The bacon wrapped shrimp was good just not very much for an appetizer! The prices are very cheap in my opinion. This is my favorite dive in the area based on food and atmosphere!

Just discovered this place today. Haven't had oysters since leaving Washington state. Food was great, oysters were fresh, oyster shooters were delicious. Only downside was the service. Waiter was pretty slow.

We love this place for BREAKFAST of all things.  They have a great menu and the food and service are always impeccable.  By far one of the best sit-down breakfast spots in Vegas.  There's never a line, even on Sundays, most likely because it's still a best-kept secret.  When a friend told me what great breakfasts they served, I was shocked because it's definitely not the first place I would think of for Sunday breakfast.  Chicken fried steak and eggs for $4.99....simply awesome!!!

We were looking for a bar near home that serves food. I checked Yelp for this non-descript looking place with a cute name that I'd seen whenever I'd been to the shopping sector across the street. I was surprised to see all the good reviews, so we gave it a whirl. I just had a few beers (nice selection on tap) and the fried oysters. Delicious! Even the cole slaw was great. Everything about the place was SO much better than the boring old big chain corporate places with homogeneously stodgy fare. Everything except, that is, the smoking. I recently quit smoking so can appreciate that smokers enjoy smoking indoors, but I now find it rather unpleasant and have no idea how my friends put up with my stinkiness for so long (I must be really, really cool or something). Anyhow (I think I've just digressed...sorry!), the smoking is the only drawback I've found to this place. 
Excellent quality food at a very reasonable price with good service, good atmosphere, and plenty of booze...what more could a cool girl like me ask for?! Looking forward to my next visit.

Well, I dine out tree to four times a week, this place is alright, quality of food is ok,  and so is the menu.  If you are looking for an enironment to hang out with friends this place will be ideal not for a quiet night out.  Place is clean, and the food quality is your tipical tavern food for the most part.  I ordered some Rockerfeller oysters they never arrived.

OMG... Ok. ... so if you love oysters this is definitely the place to eat at. I ordered 2 dozen Oysters. ..an order of garlic fries...that were so delicious they were to die for. If you like to drink... the bartender definitely hooks it up with a very generous amount of liquor...so this place hands down is a MUST eat at. Jackie and Ashley were awesome with the customer service which is rare in Vegas. I will definitely become a regular because of the great customer friendly service both the girls gave and the awesome taste of the fresh quality of the oysters. By the way they serve em up 24 hours and on Thursday oysters are $1 each ....yes... one dollar each oyster on thursdays.

I really enjoy getting seafood here and watching games at the bar.  I usually order off of their "special" menu that presents a better deal than just ordering off their regular menu.  Shimp and crab legs.  Fresh and delicious.

If you are looking for good sea food at good prices, this is NOT the place for you. This place was disappointing.  The clam bake lacked...everything and costs a lot. Had I not added crab, I'm not sure what I would've eaten. The waffle fries were good, but you can get very similar ones at your nearest fast food restaurant. The service was slow and awkward. I'll probably go home and have a bowl of cereal...if you have a hankering for sea food, going to this place will surely take it away from you. We will never go back.

A group of 5 of us tried this and we were pleasantly surprised. Nothing fancy to look at and a bit smokey in the bar area but in the restaurant not bad. The food was really good and in large servings. We had jambalaya that was pretty spicy but good, seafood tacos, steak and shrimp, linguini and clams and a shrimp, crab and lobster Louie. Not a complaint in this group of critical eaters. Even two of us went back for breakfast and enjoyed it completely. A definite do again. Service was fast and friendly.

This place....good as fuck. 

Well hell, the shit is open 24 Hours and late night like past 2am there aren't any Vegas weirdos being weird. The bar tender is cooooooool and make drinks all tasty n shit. He also doesn't try to talk your goddamn head off like some places. The man does his job and does it with awesomeness and that's it. Seafood be good as fuck man, like shit where else can you have oysters, catfish, gumbo and shit at that hour? No where. Plus it's on a good side of town so get that ass up in there and get me a drink, I'll be on the way.

Truly, this place is our favorite everyday local eatery! 
A little background for a moment: I DO NOT eat fish. In fact, I hate fish. Closest thing I'll eat is popcorn shrimp lol. While I must say the popcorn shrimp is fantastic at Shucks, if I didn't want that or chicken tenders-which are also some of the best I've had- I found the rest of the menu (non fish items) to be mediocre. My husband on the other hand LOVES fish and crab, especially crab. He fell in love with the prices, quality, and large options available on the menu immediately while I was- sad to say- a harder sell. 

Recently they added new menu items and seem to have revamped the current menu as well with it and now I'm asking him to go to Shucks! I'm addicted to the chicken mac and cheese. It's always so fresh and tastey. And I also am very fond of the fried chicken sandwich and BBQ chicken salad. We can go out to eat quite often sometimes and with the recent new menu we're finding ourselves here pretty regularly. The staff is beginning to know us (can't imagine why! Lol) and we always get great service despite coming in at various times of the day and night. Sitting at the bar or dining room has never hindered service or quality for us. 

The atmosphere is a little dive-y but comfortable, casual, and not intimidating. I can't say much regarding their cocktails as we have only tried two: the Adios Shucker and Crab Walk. We always order one or both of those so you can say we like them a lot. 

PS- DESSERT TRAY. That is all.

Place is a bar with seating on the side, typical dinner tables and booths. Seafood was definitely frozen, not fresh, but prepared fine. Lots of specials, cheap drafts, if you go mid week when its not busy it is a pleasant enough atmosphere. Service was on par, its also a bar so expect a waitress who is doing multiple things at once.
Gf loved her shrimp pasta.
Probably wouldn't return, try someplace better next time

I stumbled upon this location while searching for a late night restaurant for my after wedding dinner for 30 people! From the initial phone call they were so very accommodating, I was actually skeptical because they were so nice!! Everything was AMAZING - from the service to the food! This is definitely a place we will be frequenting, all of my guests were surprised at the quality of the food for the price. Thank you Shucks for making my special night that much better!

I was huge fan of Shucks however, I was informed this morning that Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar on N Durango is openly discriminating against military combat veterans and wounded warriors by denying them service and throwing them out of the establishment.  The Shucks management at this establishment openly calls out and accuses veteran customers as representing "Stolen Valor" and immediately kicks them out of the place while the veterans are enjoying their meals or beverages that they paid for.  This behavior will not be tolerated by Veterans and Military action groups in Las Vegas NV nor anywhere else around the country.  Believe me veterans actions groups are going to be outraged at this company.  So in my opinion, if you are a military family member, active duty, National Guard, Reserves, a veteran or a wonder warrior consider boycotting all Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar establishments and I recommend you stay away from them!  Shucks Sucks!
Food was fantastic!.. We had so much to eat! Love my seafood.. Staff was friendly. The women's restroom are disgusting! There's vomit on the doors! Never will I ever return because of that reason.
The best place ever! The beer selection is awesome, the food is great, and the service is wonderful. It's close to my house and I go often. Nikki is my favorite!!!

I want to like this place, but the service is so hit and miss. I've been there twice, when it's not even that busy, and my drink glass if empty forever. I'd have to go out of my way to ask for a refill. 

Likewise the food is pretty darn good for the price, but again the consistency is hit/miss. For instance I had a great sirloin on a prior visit, but on subsequent tries they never could cook it right. I ordered medium rare and it came out well done, as did the recook the second time. I just ate my vegetables and called it a night. (They did take it off my bill though.) 

Also noticed that the last time was very smokey, while the previous visits were not bothersome at all. This probably has something to do with the ventilation system at the time. 

They do have great hamburgers though, which are hard to screw up. So I might try them again.

This is the best late place I've been to for food in Vegas. My wife and I had just left The Ainsworth Lounge at Hard Rock Hotel and we were very hungry and it was around 1am. My wife and I really had a taste for some sushi but any kind of seafood would do. We started yelping trying to find the closest place to our home and low and behold Shucks had great reviews the only problem was that they didn't sell Sushi, we figured lets try it anyways because oysters would suffice.

We arrive at Shucks park there were more than 8 cars in the parking lot and they had a two sets of double doors. We'd walked through the first set of doors and found that we had to ring a doorbell to get into this establishment. That was a bummer because after ringing the doorbell and waiting literally waiting about a minute I told my wife lets go, I can be very impatient and I thought that at the Sedona the kitchen was open 24hrs but to my surprise it wasn't. After arriving at the Sedona finding out that the kitchen is no longer 24hrs the bartender at the Sedona suggested that we go back to Shucks. We gladly took his advice and returned. 

Arriving back at Shucks we rang the doorbell and we were in less than 10 seconds.

Worst experience of my life!! Wouldn't waste my TIME on these people or place that's been closed at other locations . 

Nuff said!?

Kind of skeptical when I went here with the parents. The food was pretty good. Fried food done at its best and the Caesar dressing had a lot of lemon juice in it which is my favorite. Our order kind of lagged but I have nothing else to complain about...It's 24 hours and its not denny's
My new favorite restaurant! Been here 3 times in the last two weeks and then never let us down will keep coming back! Fast service and delicious food at a great price!

WTF ARE YALL SELLING???!!! Like seriously. Miss me with these under the ocean floor, rotten belly, steroid-like dungeon oysters. I cut these big ass things in half and the stomach oozed some nasty yellow and green 2 second later super unbearably funky smelling slime! Almost instantly threw up! Yeah, this ones a HELL TO THE NAH for me Randy!

I went down to pick up an order to go, the food was not ready when expected so I took a seat at the bar and ordered a glass of wine. Very local atmosphere but customers and bartenders were telling dirty jokes with the language to match. It was enough to make me uncomfortable.....The food was OK but I will not return. Not a family friendly place.
A little smokey at times, but the food is good and service is great.  Definitely a neighborhood favorite!

When I first moved to the area, my roommate and I decided to go out for dinner.  He prefers chains.  I don't.  We settled on Shuck's.  Shuck's is a local chain consisting of three restaurants.  They have tremendous seafood, as well as sandwiches and meat.  

I have been multiple times and I always am drawn to the clam chowder.  I also love the clam bake, and my favorite salad is the Shuck's Salad, consisting of Mesclun, a crableg, shrimp, and seared tuna.

Service is attentive and friendly.  If you are lucky enough to get Sonny, she is an amazing waitress.

Ive been here twice in the last 3 weeks and ordered catfish both times.  Love the cornmeal crust.  Light and crispy and perfectly seasoned.  Fries are solid, just not a lot of them and I didnt try the coleslaw.  Service was attentive and friendly.  I'll be back for more catfish!

Been going here for the past year and it's always been a great time. I'm in the industry so I only show up on the graveyard shift. Larry is always attentive and offers great recomendations. Im a fan of his and the bar for sure!
I love this place! Crab anytime of the day for a good price. They're menu items are delicious and drinks are pretty good. I go here more than anywhere else!
Yummy chicken fingers and fries!! Good service and cheap prices. Can't go wrong for a late night meal :)

If I could give no stars I would!! This was the worst experience EVER!! Being in the service industry I usually put up with a lot and give the bartender a break but he was seriously the worst bartender in the world!! As soon as we walked in we were completely ignored and treated like nothing. There were only 9 people in the bar including us, so not busy what so ever. We looked over the menu for a few minutes ordered a salad and sandwich and seriously waited over 40 minutes for our food!!!!! The couple that came in after us ate and left by time we received our food! Instead of telling us our food was taking awhile or checking in on us the bartender completely ignored us and wouldn't even refill our drink, he dodged us wouldn't make eye contact. When we received our food it was luke warm and tasteless but we decided to eat it cause we were starving. When I asked if the food usually takes 40 minutes he said yeah at night it always does if we're busy...THERE WERE 9 PEOPLE IN THE BAR!!!! YOU'RE NOT BUSY!! He rolled his eyes and acted like I was asking a stupid question. I asked for the check and he said he took care of it, but at this point I would of rather paid the check and stiffed him. Don't act like a douche bag and then expect the world cause you decided to take care of something because you should of at the beginning. You're graveyard bartender is a prick and shouldn't treat locals like shit in a local bar! Seriously I will tell everyone not to come here!!

Centennial Hills is a gastronomical wasteland.As a result with few decent places to chose from, Shucks becomes a standout. Keep it simple and basic. Their soup especially the Lobster Bisque is quite good. So is the clam chowder. Burgers are good too. I also am fond of the quesadilla.Entrees are a bit pricey so I would not recommend them. Salads especially the black and bleu.This Salad with bleu cheese crumbles and plenty of slices of steak, prepared the way you like it, perhaps is the best menu choice.

Worst customer service ever. I been to this place a few tines and have always been treated like crap. Last night was it for me. The bartender/waiter was rude and cursing at us from across the way because we asked for hot butter. Dont know why a place wld want to turn away money. When we have done nothing wrong. And was completely ignored the whole time. He checked on everyone around us and just walked past us like we were not there at all from the moment we walked in the door.
Definitely my favorite sea food place! Their new menu is just amazing. The crew is nice, the food is good! We love coming here!

The food is okay. My biggest complaint is the fact that the restaurant and bar area are attached. There is supposed to be no smoking since its considered a family establishment. But I went there at around 8:00 for dinner people at the bar were smoking and the staff said nothing. It totally ruined my experience and I wreaked of cigarettes when I left. 
However, if you're a smoker you might really like the place.

Super high quality shellfish.  The oysters were fantastic, cold peel and eat shrimp was perfect (including the temp, not too cold), and the bacon wrapped shrimp with a glaze was out of this world.  The food comes out fast so order in waves so you have time to enjoy your cold beer!

Food was horrible my husbands fish wasn't all the way done. Oryster shots was horrible for the price not worth it. This is my first and last time going to shucks tavern on Durango. Not to mention we kept having to wave down there server

Absolutely LOVE this place. I go here every Tuesday night. The wait staff is pretty good. They have their on and off days (sometimes seem annoyed to serve you and other times they love you), but the food is CHEAP and SSUUPPEERR good! The buffalo chicken fingers and fires are to die for. I literally look forward to it ALL WEEK LONG. Can't wait to go back.
Great place for late night food. It's to only place in the area for good seafood & drinks after work. Larry the graveyard bartender makes us feel welcome we will be back again for sure.

Absolutely great place!  Open 24 hours, so even when I'm working strange hours I can always stop in for a beer.  It's got video poker if that's your thing but I usually come with work friends to decompress.  Not only is it one of the very few 24/7 places out here in this neighborhood, it's FANTASTIC!  Usually have to choose one or the other.  Never knew it existed until a friend showed me, and I've been missing out!  Service is friendly and helpful, the barkeeps are familiar with even infrequent customers, and the food is bomb.  Try the seafood chowder!  It's incredibly delicious!

We started of with the $5 apps. The crab dip was good  decent amount of crab flavor and creamy, the clam strips were bigger then the stuff you get at long john silver, and the calamari was solid.  The oyster po boy was alright about  4 oysters in a hoagie roll , lettuce ,tom and tartar sauce no wow factor just alright. I would come back prices reasonable.

This is my second time coming here and both times have been great service. I'll keep it simple and only do this time's review. 

You seat yourself. And it is a bit dark here. (I like coming for breakfast though so its kinda funky being dark) 

Our waiter was the same both times. Super tall nice guy. 

He let us order breakfast (it was ending in ten minutes I believe)

He's very nice. My other half ordered steak and eggs. Our waiter asked how he would like it cooked and he said "scrambled" (not realizing he meant the steak) we all laughed. He's got a good sense of humor. Not afraid to joke. 


And the food is great and cheap! Two people we paid like $16 for two breakfasts! Yesterday at cracked egg (which I love) we paid $40

Came here on a Thursday night to have a bite to eat.  I guess the football game had just ended and this place was a ghost town.  I thought it would still be full of people having drinks and hanging out, but I guess I was wrong.  

We seated ourselves over by the bar area and it took a couple minutes for the server to come over and take our order.  We ordered a couple beers and the fish tacos, steak salad and a cup of seafood bisque.

The seafood bisque was super salty!  I wanted to take it home and mix it with canned soup to dilute it.  

The fried fish tacos were actually pretty large and filling, and the flavor was good being not too dry and not too fishy.

The steak salad was good except for having too much bleu cheese.  Luckily we asked for the dressing on the side or else the flavor would have been too overwhelming.  The steak was seared and cooked almost like tartare which we liked.  But the rest of the salad was unremarkable in my opinion.

Next time I will come back to try oysters in some form, be it raw or rockefellar.  Maybe during a football game where they have discounts on food and drinks.

This place is fantastic! I frequent this spot because I LOVE seafood, and it's a cool little place to unwind after a long day. I always bring a friend or two, sit at the bar, have some beer/ wine and order a bunch of oysters 

The great thing is that they also have a bunch of delicious crab, lobster, mussels, shrimp, etc. Yay! I always get to try something new when I'm here.

Great palce to come for Raw Oysters and a cold beer, especially on a Sunday for NFL games! The Clam bake is large and will surely satisify your craving for shell fish! 

Laid back atmosphere-- nothing too fancy, yet not a hole in the wall either.

My fiancé and I love this place along with most of our family... peel and eat shrimp are awesome ...let alone the price ...we love to come for there breakfast when we are too lazy to cook... brought my niece for breakfast for her b day n she loved it !! We also love the fact that it's smoke free and kid friendly as a mater of fact me and my fiancé are heading there for dinner once she's off work :)
Great menu and delicious food. Nice atmosphere. We like coming here for a relaxing meal. my wife LOVES the coconut shrimp, I love the fresh fish choices. All the food comes hot and tasty.

BEWARE THE GRAVEYARD MENU.  Typically I have a great meal and time at shucks. living close by I have been there quite a few times. Last night a buddy and I shared some fried clam strips and peel and eat shrimp. When the clams arrived the first thing I thought was "what the hell is this?" I have never seen clams that were almost 5 inches long. Was very unsettling, but I thought to myself, "who am I? I don't know if maybe these are different from every other clam I've eaten, so what the heck" tasted OK, were very chewy, I still wasn't convinced these were actual clams, but kept eating.  About 5 hours later I woke up with stomach cramps, proceeded to vomit all of the food I had eaten, and dry heaved for another hour or so while I began to become feverish. I lost a day of work and needless to say they have lost a customer.

The plus side of the story is that my buddy did not get sick, I checked with him but apparently he did some heavy drinking afterwards so not sure if that affected his toxicity levels.

Best bar food ever.
Reason for 4 and not 5 stars is it depends upon the staff.
If Darby is bartending, the drinks will never be empty and the food will not sit in the window drying out. The man knows his sh*t and cares about his patrons.
We all know this, so if the parking lot is packed he's probably working.. if it's empty you may wanna think twice lol.  I will sometimes call to see who's working.
Cooks vary from 4star restaurant awesome to "dude really? did you even rinse these oysters before you shucked them?'... but for the most part food is awesome, low priced and I love coming here.
Best place to get your fix for crab, always friendly welcome

The only reason I don't give them 1 star was because the food is decent (especially the breakfast) but as far a service goes for the dinning room it's terrible. The servers are not welcoming at all and act like we are impeding on their day. This place used to be a great place to bring the kids for meals, but not anymore. They only have 2 high chair for the entire restaurant and when you bring kids in somewhere its best to serve them first (drinks and all). Everyone at my table got drinks and my almost 2 year old was the last one served. Not happy with the experience at all!!

Tough to review this place

The service has always been terrible. The food quality always amazing.

Dark and dingy is it a seafood place , a dive bar , late night hang out, or gaming spot.

The staff is always running around looking like it's their first day on the job. I have been seated and waited twenty minutes before acknowledged. And that was because i passed out from hunger

The waiter seemed stressed and didn't want our table or order. The manager seemed perplexed by it all and the ambiance was loud and fun. It's unfortunate that it always seemed like amateur hour because the food is so darn good

Don't think I have ever had a bad meal. The peel and eat shrimp is to die for. 

The happy hour seemed to change from my visits. One time I was allowed to order food Togo one time I wasn't on happy hour. The drinks are comped if your playing the machines which is nice and the bar staff had always been friendly. 

For the area and late night food it is some of the best around. If you can have a few beers ( if you can get them ) and not stress about service you will enjoy yourseld

Recently moved to NW Las Vegas and have been checking out the neighborhood restaurants and taverns. Shucks quickly became a favorite after we had 2 dinners, a lunch, and several breakfasts. Joenna is our restaurant favorite server and ???our favorite bartender. (So sorry we don't know...gorgeous with long dark hair in ponytail..........worked until 3:30 or 4 pm today ( NCAA Gonzaga v S. Carolina [april 1]. 

Went to Shucks to see game and enjoy the atmosphere. So disappointing......the food and the later bar service. Food: ordered basic cheese nachos. Had to ask for guacamole and sour cream that came with them. $7.95 Nachos were soggy and stale. We just thought that was a lesson to us not to order appetizers. Later, ordered the $25.95 "build your own order". Being shrimp lovers, We ordered cocktail shrimp, popcorn shrimp, coconut shrimp and the peel and eat shrimp. (We had previously ordered the coconut shrimp and popcorn shrimp as entrees during another visit.)

Wow, how disappointing. 10 small popcorn shrimp supposedly equaled 1/2 pound. The cocktail shrimp were the same as the peel and eat.....mushy and miserable. We sent them back, requesting more coconut or popcorn shrimp. Frankly, I believe the cook peeled 4 of the shrimp we sent back and deep fried them...no resemblance to the first portion of coconut shrimp. Truly angered me. 

Additionally, we sat at the bar with empty glasses waiting for someone (of the 3 bar staff) to notice. We are well dressed, well behaved adults, and the bar was not very busy. 

We left. Will we go back? Can't tell you...we're home watching Oregon win, in comfort.
This place used to be good. Now quality is horrible. Let's go. Step it up. Went there excited left there disappointed. 1 star

Great spot to just stop in and get some pretty good food at any time of the day. Beer is nice and cold and they have great specials.  If you sign up for their email listings they will send you the weekly specials with free play.  Great food, great service.

i expected a lot better food considering the other reviews. I ordered the fried oysters and the fish and chips. Both were bad, bad, bad. The oysters were not pan fried, rather deep fried and cooked so hard they literally broke into pieces under the fork. The color was way too dark meaning they were overcooked. The fish was cooked so hard I needed to work the knife hard to cut it open and it split in pieces. The breading was not fluffy like one expects from a beer bar. It was a rock hard shell. I believe they just took frozen factory  made fish planks and threw them into the oil. The fish was billed as cod but it was so dry and stringy I couldn't tell what it was. True, one could say, "what would you expect from an oyster bar in the middle of a the Las Vegas desert?"  Well. I'd expect at least to find good tarter sauce. Nope, it was like cheap mayonnaise with pickle relish thrown in. 

The mark of a good place is their pride in food and service. Insult was added to injury when I complained about the quality to my waiter, Gregory. I stated my dissatisfaction in an obtuse manner just to see what effect it would have. I told him that now I have something to write about. He said,"what?" I said, "how bad the food is here." Without a comment, he turned to take my credit card to the register. I paid for the meal at full price. I was never asked any questions nor introduced to the manager. I will never go there again and recommend against this place to anyone else.

Went there with friends for lunch. Two of us ordered coconut shrimp. When it came the coconut was burned. It was a big disappoint. The others were not that happy with their food either. Shucks has been removed as a lunch spot for us.

Great chicken fingers and there 75 cents a piece  on Monday.  Loved them

The beer is great too
The Oyster bake (Rockafeller)   is the ONLY way oysters should be ate. 100% perfection life will nvr be the same
This place is awesome! The wait staff is very attentive and friendly! The food is tasty and the prices are very reasonable! I have absolutely zero complaints!

This is my go-to spot for cheap, convenient shellfish.  I'd highly recommend one of the enormous clambakes that comes with snow and dungeness crab, corn, potatoes, and clams which are served in an embarassingly huge clam shell bowl.  Before going, make sure you print  coupons off their website for $5 off the clambake or 6 free oysters (if you spend $20).  

I'm also a fan because they're not stingy with the whiskey.  Their drink prices may be higher than some other nearby spots, but you can get some stroonnng drinks.

Beware: If you hate the Cowboys, this place is not for you.

Love this place. The lobster fingers are beyond good. The beer is cold and the drinks actually have alcohol. I'd say this place has delectable breakfast, lunch and dinner. The slots are lucky and the staff are friendly.

My husband and I eat at Shucks at least 1-2 times each week. We have had many breakfasts, lunches, and dinners at Shucks. The breakfast menu is not only fantastic, but it is no more expensive than having fast food. They are great about allowing substitutions such as egg whites for eggs and cottage cheese or tomatoes instead of potatoes. They even allow my husband to have seared ahi on his Eggs Benedict instead of ham for a small extra charge.

We love the ahi wraps and fish tacos for lunch! Also, pay attention to the daily specials as you walk in the door because there are some really great deals.

We also sometimes just order a selection of appetizers and share them. They have great appetizers and we really love the calamari.

Of course, the drinks are great too! I recently discovered their Maui Mosa and I am definitely a fan.

We have never had any issues with service and it is nice to see familiar staff every time we go.

We will continue to be regular customers at Shucks!

My husband loves oysters. So we gave it a try. Not a ton of tables. So this can be tricky if going in with little ones and can't sit at the bar. The food was really good. It came out quickly and was yummy.

Nickolas was our server when we sat in the bar area a few nights ago! He was great! The food was good too, and very reasonably priced. Got a huge bowl of clam chowder for $3.99 and my friend got two giant glasses of vodka press for $10!! Can't beat that really!! The garbage salad with dill dressing was the bomb and clams in white wine sauce was super good too. Didn't care much for the tuna tartare but oh well everything else was great!!

For $3.95 the breakfasts here can't be beaten.  There's around 12 selections... and they're all $3.95!

Everything arrives hot and cooked to order.  Coffee ($2.50) is good and not oily (a pet peeve of mine, I must admit)... although you'll smile that your drink cost more than half what your breakfast cost!

For lunch / dinner, the clam chowder and the fish and chips didn't disappoint.  Again, hot food prepared well.  It's hard to argue with simple dishes done well!

It's kinda smoky smelling when you first walk in through the door -- the lingering ghost of pre-ban times -- but don't let that put you off to trying this place out.  We used to be a fan of Joey's for FnC, but this place has really won us over by serving better tasting fare.
Great food. Horrible service.  The hostess is unfriendly and tonight we had the worst waiter.  I will be back but only for the food.
Great food great service. The shrimp nachos are phenomenal. The back and blue salad is also great.

We were kinda of skeptical since it's seafood in Vegas, but this place did not disappoint. We will be back soon for more. There is so many different options to choose from that 1 night of eating wasn't enough.

Went for the oysters--- weren't looking for a special---- they were great! 18 bucks for a dozen--- 
Sever cold l, good flavor, spicy horseradish! Will definitely return---- 
Bacon wrapped shrimp was so-so-- kinda chewy-- but now horrible-- probly won't get that next time--- but the oysters made up for it!

We went to Shucks for the first time yesterday for breakfast.The food was delicious! My husband had the crab and lobster omelette and it was sooooo good! The prices are great and the service was great! We will definitely be going back :)

My favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas hands down. The service is consistent and friendly, the food is very reasonably priced, and the portions are neither overwhelming or leaving you wanting. We have breakfast at Shuck's 2-3 times a week and we LOVE it. It's the best way to start your day.

My boyfriend and I discovered the little gem a few months ago.  We went the first time and it simply wasn't memorable.  The 2nd time with my parents was better.  But somehow the 3rd time we tried it we just fell in LOVE.  Its down the street from us so that makes it even better.  My man loves crab legs and theirs are amazing!  We come here about 2-3 times a month.  Yes its that good.  We simply order the same thing because hey if its not broken...(you know the rest)
Start off with the chips and salsa.  For the main course: 1 pound of crab legs seasoned with lemon pepper.  
The servers are awesome!  We pretty much have the same server each time.  Hey Vivian girl!

Other honorable mentions: crawfish, chicken tenders.

This is hands down the most underrated breakfast spot in town. I'm a regular customer and would highly recommend Shucks for breakfast. You can literally have a great meal for $5. Service is always good and quick which makes it even better.

Excellent food! It was our first time eating here last night. We sat in the dining area, so I cannot comment on the bar. The server was nice and kept checking on us, and filled my tea before it was even half empty. The place was nice and clean and smelled great! Our food didn't take too long to come out, and we tried lots of seafood! Between the scallops, clams, mussels, oysters, and calamari, we couldn't decide what was best! This is our new favorite place, and will definitely be back with our whole family!! Whoever the cook was last night is an excellent chef! Thank you Shucks!

We used to go to Shucks pretty regular but the service got pretty iffy so we took a break. We decided to give it a try this past Tuesday night. We brought our 15 year old Grandson with us. We walked in, the sign said to seat yourself which we did. 1st a young girl walked out of the kitchen looked at us & giggled & went back in. a couple seconds later another young girl walked out of the kitchen looks at us giggles & goes back in. Now that we are a little weirded out another young lady walks to our table & tells us sorry we can't allow kids in here because they are having an issue with the health department because of smoking in their restaurant. Well it was nice of them  to embarrass us, would of been helpful if they either put a sign on the door or where you walk in near the sign that says seat your self. we could have done without the 2 immature girls giggling at us. Won't be going there or recommending this place anytime soon.

I was a bit disappointed last Thursday night with my visit.  I hadnt been here for 4 years, use to come about 1 time a month late night.  Always quite but the food was a bit pricy for the quality.  I always ordered a steak - not a seafood lover like my ex.  Lately they have had a full lot quite a bit and thought why not try it again.  Really geared for sports and gaming with less expensive food gimics to bring you in.  Not impressed.  Service had gone down and clientle too.  Not anywhere to bring the family.   If you like gambling and sports its the place to go.  Shell fish my friend said is worth the price but not the drive.

Came here after an evening of ice skating. It was a Friday night and still relatively quiet. The place is pretty cute (themed) and the bar area is roomy so I imagine there would still be a good amount of space even if it had been crowded. My friend and I had gotten a coupon off the restaurant's site ($27.95 for dinner for two). The food was pretty good; however, our server was kind of a jerk (making sarcastic comments and being condescending). He was also a bit slow and forgetful even though there were only a handful of full tables and a few other servers working. So even with a good dinner, the uncomfortable service is making me question if I'd go back.

Great food, but the place is so dirty that I may not come back.  When they bus the tables, all they do is wipe down the tables.  The menus were sticky and filthy....the ketchup, malt vinegar and hot sauce bottles were filthy.  It's a hide turn off when the menu is so nasty.  It's too bad too, because the food is great.  Too bad the place is so dirty.  It wasn't just our table either.  I looked at other tables and they all had filthy condiment bottles.  It's an easy fix by management.  I hope they consider stepping up their cleanliness. 
Thanks 
Brandon 
(702) 787-5803
Bgat72@gmail

I appreciate the response from Schucks, and I will give it another shot. Like I said, the food was great. 
Thanks

Everyone who comes here gets crabs!

Shuck's Tavern II on Flamingo is the perfect place to go for delicious crab legs and seafood.  The portions are generous, the service is quick, and the prices are very reasonable.  

I would give this place 5 stars if it were only a seafood restaurant, but it is not.  There are many other options on the menu, and most are forgettable.  The Chicken Caesar wrap was awful, and should not be ordered.  The wrap was soggy with a bland dressing, and chewy chicken. 

You wouldn't go to a pizza place and order a filet would you?  Stick to the delicious ocean fare at this tavern, and a few cold beers, and you can't go wrong.

This is a Dallas Cowboys bar, you have been warned.

I love this place and I come here all the time; excellent seafood!  It's open 24hrs, so its convenient when you want seafood at 3am!  They have a large selection of seafood here, everything from shrimp platters to crab legs, oysters, mussels, wraps tacos, clam bakes, gumbo and pastas.  The prices are very reasonable too.  The bartenders are awesome.  The atmosphere here is very chill/low key.  Great place to grab some beer and seafood with friends.  They also have great deals on breakfast; I think the breakfast is priced around $4.  Its definitely worth checking out!  Its kind of hidden though; its near the corner of elkhorn/durango; across from Smiths.  You'll have to drive around to the back to park.

I would not come back here. The service was friendly and timely, but other than that, this place is not notable.

-drinks were average and rather expensive for what was served ($6 for a well drink at 3pm on a Sunday afternoon?)
-oysters (we ordered a half dozen) smelled fishy and didn't taste fresh
-crab cakes were average and $10 for only 2 small ones

My fiancé and I decided to try Shucks the other night.  We pass by it all the time but had never been there before. Overall, it wasn't bad. The service was good, the beer was good, and the atmosphere was good. My fiancé had clams and New England clam chowder and she loved them both. As for me, I had the Texas oysters. There are supposed to be prepared with tequila, lime, and Tabasco. Sounds pretty awesome, right? Well they had no flavor. I also had the crawfish appetizer. They were pretty good and came in quite a big portion for an appetizer. Since we both like seafood, we'll probably be back. I'll stick to crab legs for next time
Great place, good Oysters, and calamari, the lobster roll is decent, but the seafood louie salad dressing is awesome.

My family and I went here earlier today. My mom is allergic to my cat (oops) and can't stay in the apartment for over 30 mins, so I couldn't cook her the elaborate Thanksgiving meal we had hoped for. Thankfully, Shuck's was open and they even had a special menu for the day and $1 oyster specials. The waitresses were SO sweet and kind. I kind of felt like the devil for going to a restaurant on Thanksgiving day but if I had to, I think Shuck's was the best choice.

The Thanksgiving menu was pretty generous, for $11 you got a ton of food and a piece of pie (pecan or pumpkin). The food was solid/good, I'd say their seafood is better than their Thanksgiving fare. Regardless, the fact that they were even open made me super, super grateful, because I don't know what else we would have done!

only gets one star because service was horrible. Food is fairly good. I walked in with my husband and sat at the bar. We were there for late night and we were asked by the guy bartender to move to the corner if we weren't drinking. I wanted to leave right away like who does that? Then he sat 2 girls in our spot and they didnt even have a drink!! none the less he completely ignored us and I swore I would not return to this place

What a Big Disappointment today My husband and went to Shucks for lunch and we haven't been there for awhile I ordered a spicy Maria and for 9.00 give me a break. it wasn't anything special No celery like it was advertised three olives though and it wasn't spicy. My husband had gumbo it looked like gravy other than gumbo He did get two small crab legs and only two shrimp it was so soupy and it was bland and for him to put Tabasco I knew it wasn't good What a Bad lunch.

This place is AMAZING with late night orders to go!! My hubby works late and I had him go by TWICE this past week on his way home. (I'm sending him again tonight!! ) A lot of times when you order to go (especially late at night)...you know your food isn't very fresh but this place cares about their food and you can tell!! 
Their Seafood Louis is so yummy! The lobster, crab meat and shrimp are fresh and the Louis Dressing is fantastic. The Coconut Shrimp was served with a coconut dipping sauce...it's delicious!
If you want yummy seafood late at night...you should check this place out!!

This is just up the street where I live!  Went  to Thursday $1.00 Oysters and had 2 dozens!!!  What a great price, 2 dz for $24.00!  It was good oysters (not great but for the price you are paying for, it's a great deal!) and decided to order appetizer (the mussels) which was good and a great amount!  I ordered the 1/2lb Dungess crab and it was not lacking any meat and for the price of $8.95 for half pound, I think it's a great deal!  It's a lot less expensive then Joe's Crab Shack and it was gooooddddd!

Overall I will definitely go back as a regular.  It was very slow on a Thursday, given it was $1.00 Oyster night but I don't mind it not being bust because our food came out in a timely manner!  This will replace Joe's Crab Shack!  Price was great and food was good!

My family and I always eat at the other shucks location and the food and service is great. We came here because we were on this side of town and I don't know if it has a different owner or what but the service was horrible and the food was worse then bad. I hate to leave such a negative review but I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
No smoking. Yes gaming. No douchey signs about gaming to sit at the bar!  Crab legs? Oh, boy! I might have found the perfect bar.

The wife and I have lived in this area for 2 years and never gave this place a chance.  Now we really wish we have come here before now.  There is a nice bar and the dining area is separate enough to really enjoy either side of the house.  I would not hesitate to bring my kid here.  I had the shrimp po boy and the wife had steamed crab and fried shrimp.  All of our food was very good and the service was great.  Good key lime pie too.
Love the oysters here they also have a really good shrimp platter I loved the coconut shrimp has a good friendly atmosphere one of my favorite places to go watch the football game
1 of my Favorite spots to grab dinner after work - Great daily specials as well as Happy Hour deals & a Very friendly staff on Any nite of the week

Hey Josh. We came back again after 3 years and we are so glad we did.!! Seriously we love the food there so much that we want to come almost everyday but we can't. We have had 3 times now the Spanish waiter with the glasses. He is fantastic and he's off sun Monday so we come in when he's there. I know I gave u a bad review before and that stuff really did happen maybe 4 years ago now but we came back and I swear, you have the best Dungeness I have ever had anywhere. We will keep coming back and I recommend u to anyone who will listen.

Shucks is the best restuarant in Centennial Hills. Its not fine dining but good old fashion food. Daily food specials. I like the Friday $5 crawfish & calamari. Warning it is cheaper to buy a pitcher of beer than 1 glass . P.S. i am a regular here!
I lived near this place for 3 years but finally made the trip there a few weeks ago.  I Love it.  Great food.  Plus it's a Bears place.  I'll be there when the football season starts.

Stopped in tonight at my local spot. It is Saturday. There was a full bar and only one bartender on shift. I never had to ask for a drink and neither did anyone else, Brooke is a rockstar ... 21 people at the bar and a full lounge . All Pistons firing ! Great food and even better service !
Great place to blow off steam, have some great beer, and great food.  This place is legitimate. Great for watching games too!

I would have given this place 5 stars except for the graveyard bartender on SUNDAYs is by far the worst bartender I have ever encountered and I work in the industry.  Don't got there after midnight on Sundays unless you want to spend the rest of your night wondering if your food or drinks will ever come.. He does seem to be really good at avoiding you when you need him though.. It's too bad because we're regulars there and he's served us several times and we still haven't had a good experience with him..

Any other day this place is AWESOME the other bartenders are great! Food is great! Atmosphere is great as so are the prices!

My 2nd favorite Shuck's.  Although, I like the feel of the Centennial location better, the crowd on Flamingo is a little more diverse.  You never know if there's a party, sports league, rowdy bunch, or whatever else makes for good people watching.

Still great fresh seafood and cold beers.  Gotta love locals joints!

My favorite Shuck's location!
Sometimes you just need some raw oysters and a cold pale ale!  
I've eaten at all Shuck's and never had questionable freshness on the seafood.

Great little menu in a local bar.

First time here...having just moved to Nevada(vegas) it's still odd to see gaming in so many locations! What got me the most was the smoking in the bar...haven't seen that in a restaurant area in years. It wasn't too bad but noticeable.

The beer and mixed drinks were tasty. The beer was cheap at 2$ for a 16 oz special. We ordered tuna tartare to start and wanted 10 more...it was that good. Very fresh and big chunks of raw tuna with avocado and balsamic was amazing. 

We had 1 1/2 lbs of mixed crab legs which were flavorful and meaty. We had a side of onion rings and they were just ok. 

Overall I can see us heading back for more. On a side note it was very chilly inside. Take a jacket!

This is the 2nd Shucks I've been to. The first one is the one located in Centennial area & I've had their breakfast croissant sandwich before which is my favorite!!! YUMMY! This location I went to, to meet a friend. I found that there are a lot of senior citizens that hang out @ this place. They chose to sit @ the bar drinking, gambling & eating dinner. Probably not a place for young people to hang out at. Bartenders were nice. Could have been a little more efficient of keeping the drinks filled & plates cleared away. It wasn't really that busy when I was there. Dinning area was dead, seems the bar area is the place to hang out. Ran into two weirdos while there. One guy who seemed to be a frequent flyer who appeared hyper on meth. & another odd old man asking for my permission & another lady's permission to sit at the bar...really? Odd.... I won a little money on the video poker machine but gave back my winnings....lol My sandwich was tasty.
Good Food, Good Drinks, Great Service!  It's not always easy to find a gaming bar that is smoke free - this is a great neighborhood spot where you won't leave smelling like smoke.
Extremely fast service. Nice environment. Had the spinach and crab dip it was amazing!

Went there last night to bring home a seafood bucket.... Had crab legs, Mussels and Shrimp.... Crab legs were of the smaller variety but really very tasty as were the Mussels and Shrimp... Good neighborhood place to go!

Love this place!

It's a little over a mile from our house so when I feel like hanging out, getting some late night snackin and some beer, this is always my first choice. 

Their prices are cheap.
The oysters are fresh.

I have even gone to Big Al's at the Orleans and I was served with foamy oysters. Eww!
Great, go on Sat/Sun wine is half price and you cannot beat their pasta dishes.   Great late night all the fish are fresh and you get the benefit of a great sport's bar at no charge.

I came in at 1am with my husband and there was no wait. We ordered 1 dozen oysters, a half pound of crab legs, an oyster shooter, and stuffed shrimp. Everything was delicious! I was really surprised lol I read some bad reviews and was soooo worried but we had a great experience. Our server and bartender had a great attitude and was super nice. I will definitely be back  we paid $44 for everything not including tip. What a great price!

Got what we ordered, food was prepared correctly and delivered promptly. Nice to go somewhere with good food and good service. Oysters shooters are pretty good, really good. I ordered the Shucks Shooter, comes with a shot oh vodka.

Ever since we moved to Las Vegas, I have been meaning to try this place. We finally took the plunge and went in on a weeknight for some oysters and seafood. The place was packed which is always a good sign. 

They have a great menu selection and it was difficult to decide what to order. There were a number of options that I wanted to try. I settled on 6 oysters to start and was told that they were from Louisiana. I love oysters, but had never had any from Louisiana so my interests were peaked. They arrived and they were meaty and large. However, the taste was underwhelming. The last few almost tasted badly. Not sure if my taste-buds are just adverse for Lousiana oysters or if the quality was not there (the oysters were on special that night), either way, I will not be ordering next time I go back which is disapointing for an oyster bar. I wish they had a better selection for oysters.

I got a salad with crab meat, shrimp, and ahi tuna. The salad was great! The dressing was tasty and the quality of seafood was delicious. My husband ordered the salmon and he was pleased with his meal, as well.

Customer service could use some improvement. Everyone was friendly, but they were slow with greating us and getting us the check. I noticed other customers were frustrated with the slow service, as well. We will definitely be back and my review may go up depending on how the customer service is the next time we go to this spot.
Awesome Food and Great service always! The Buffalo Shrimp Wrap is super delicious! Try it or you're missing out!
This place is awesome. With friends or solo mission it's the place to be. Nice, clean and friendly environment. The food makes this cheat day worth every last calorie. Check them out .

Came to happy hour with all of our family and I wasnt very impressed , the 3.00 margaritas were disgusting. The service was super slow. Im pretty sure my sister in laws mom got sick from eating the oysters there. She tried one and sent it back but was sick the rest of the evening. She told the waiter she could tell they werent fresh. I had the ceviche it was ok but nothing special. I definitely will not be recommending this restaurant in the future.
It took them 1hr to cook our food. Mind you there were less than 10people in the place. They suck!

We've been here a couple of times and really like the food. We took my husband's parents here Thursday night Jan. 23 2014 and the service was just AWFUL.! Despite there being several bartenders (we sat at the bar) we had to ask each time we wanted another drink as our glasses sat there empty. We ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell to split and when the guy brought them out and asked who wanted them we told them we were splitting them. His response was "how are we going to do this?" Seriously?!? Give us another plate dude! I hate telling people how to do their own job. We were left without napkins and had to get up to get our own from other tables more than once. Then we were charged for our Father's drink because he only bet $20 in the machine. 

The food was good (even though I ate a couple oysters without crackers because it took a long time to get the bartender's attention to ask for them.) The crab cakes were previously frozen so not so good. I'm giving more than one star because the food was pretty good but overall we were pretty shocks at how incompetent and bad the service was.

I've been to the Shucks on Flamingo on several occasions for breakfast.  On a recent visit visit I tried the baby Mother-Shucker burger.  It was delicious.  But enough about the other location

Stopped in at this location with the GF to grab a bite.  I found it to be pretty mellow given it was a football Sunday.  Some of the propaganda on the wall indicated this is a Bears bar.  I figure since the Bears played later in the day, this place was probably rocking.

This location is clean, spacious and everyone working was friendly enough.

Looking at the menu, I was reminded of the MOTHER-SHUCKER.  It was so delicious the last time I had it.  I asked myself several times, do I go big or do I go small?  I figured I was hungry enough to give the big one a shot.

According to the Sucks menu the Mother-Shucker is described as, "a full one-pound patty stuffed with bacon bits and american cheese. topped with lettuce,tomato, pickle planks, grilled mushrooms, melted swiss cheese, fried onion straws and our secret "mother shucken" sauce. served on a giant toasted bun. cooked to order."

I was given a choice of fries, waffle fries, onion rings or garlic fries.  I picked the garlic fries.

When the meal arrived.  The burger looked outstanding.  I had ordered medium well, but it looked like it was cooked just plain old medium. I am not hating, I can do either.

So satisfying was the burger, I did not have to at all the rest of the day.  I may or may not have been on the verge of meat sweats.

The garlic fries were all garlic and a nice compliment to meal. As was the Honey Brown beer.  The beer came out super cold and remained cool as I devoured the burger.

Not sure if I will ever put my body through Mother-Shucker experience again, but I will absolutely pay Shucks another visit.

Shucks was the pick of a particular day about a week ago, with promises of a $3.95 breakfast after a good morning of training.  While en route, my buddy placed a call while on the move  to confirm the ever so tempting price of a less then $5.00 dollar breakfast.  The phone call confirmed that it was a dollar more BUT still under a finski.  Upon arrival, ST&OB was found to be very mellow at eleven something in the morning.  FYI...The breakfast special runs until 1:00PM.  I ordered up a chicken fried steak, with two eggs (over medium) served with home fries (wanted/ordered cheese, didn't get) with sourdough toast.  The food came out pipping hot  and tasted like a $8.00 breakfast.....Hell, it tasted like a $12.00 breakfast.  The service was friendly and the establishment was clean.  Absolutely an opton to vist again if in the area.
Very good food and great service, definitely my favorite little getaway :) didn't get the name of the waitress but she had a red bow ;)

Coming from the Northeast, you learn what is and isn't a good a New England Clam Chowder. Shucks is near the top of my favorite list in clam chowder. It's thick, creamy, and most importantly, it's meaty and there's a good amount of potatoes. I can say that their $5.95 bowl of chowder beats all of the $8 to $12 bowls that some fancy seafood places might charge. 
I also had the Crab Alfredo. Creamy and a lot of crab meat. It was really filling. Looking at the menu, there are a lot of combos and other dishes too. I can not wait to come back and try more. 
Just a note before you pack the family in the car to come here: you must be 21 to enter and the bar allows smoking, the dining area is completely non-smoking.

Fridays is the best day to come here- they offer daily specials, but Friday's choices are by far the best value. You can pick orders of crawfish, mussels, crab cocktail, or crab & spinach dip for a flat $5 each. And did I mention martinis are half off ($10 each down to $5)? And they don't halve the portions for the specials, we're talking gigantic, full orders, for minimal money.

CRAB COCKTAIL: It's crab, the portion isn't huge but it's fresh and tasty, and you can't beat $5 (regularly ~$10?). Order one per person, or whoever gets their hands on it first is going to eat the whole thing.
MUSSELS: Large portion, white wine sauce. Not the best sauce, but again, you can't beat the value for the price/portion. Easily a meal for one, and sided with a piece of their addictively-good garlic cheese bread.
CRAWFISH: Available depending on the season, also sided with the bread. Not nearly as good as other places in town, though it isn't the easiest dish to find in the first place. Wouldn't get again, but it's not necessarily bad.
MARTINITS: The "dirty shucker" is a classic dirty martini, done well but the Chocolate Salted Pretzel is the stuff of legends. See Lisa H's review for more coverage, but it's something you have to try at least once. Fridays, for $5, is the best night to do so.

Service was friendly, and the bar is lined with TVs, making it a good spot to watch the game. Draft domestics were ~$4 while bottled specialty beers were about $5. In addition to all this money-saving awesomeness, Shucks is open 24/7!
Love this place!!! As a Bears fan I love havering a place to go and watch he game with other local bears fans!! The food is always awesome and they have the freshest oysters!!!

We decided for shucks after searching happy hour places in our neighborhood and their happy hour menu sounded great.

So glad we have a 24 hour eatery just around the corner.  Don't know why we haven't become regulars.  

Little did we know that the happy hour only got better after midnight! Darn it!  So definitely ask for their midnight menu. You can order a burger and fries for under $4 and oysters are $1, as well as under $4 breakfast.

On this trip we ordered the clam strips ($5) the waffle fries ($1.95), peel and each shrimp($5) and the portions were good sized and very tasty. 

I will say the missing star is for the initial lack of service we received upon entering.  There is no signage of "wait to be seated" or "seat yourself" so we waited a bit and the bartenders just glanced at us a couple of times but still no direction. 

Our server was not the greatest but I guess its past everyone's bed time. He never offered to refill our drinks but the gentleman who took over was very pleasant so we had a great ending to our late night snack!

Best champagne oyster shooters I've had. Karina at the bar was awesome! Service, drinks, and food were all great plus hey had our soccers games on! In a great location and easy access from the freeway.

I give them 2 stars for the great service and hospitality of the bartenders and servers, ON THE OTHER HAND THE FOOD it's mediocre whith no flavor what so ever . Ceviche was decent everything else insipid.
Delicious seafood. They offer a variety of things from seafood to burgers. Great place for a family dinner and reasonably priced. Service was great. I will be returning when visiting Las Vegas.

The service as well as the food is very good. A little overpriced. However, they have daily specials that are a pretty good deal. I'm not sure where they get there oysters from but they are very tiny. I just spent 2 weeks in New Orleans and ate at Acme's Oyster house four times. The oysters were 3 to 4 times larger at Acme. I think that if Shucks is going to serve such small oysters they should either give you extra (like Acme does when there's are small) or discount them. Just my humble opinion.

Just gross. Went there for breakfast because it was near me. The food was very poor quality and the restaurant area smelled like cigarettes smoke. My boyfriend didn't like it either. Go to The Cracked Egg, The Egg & I or Jamm's instead. TRUST me!!!

My boyfriend and I came here around 1 a.m. on a Thursday (Vegas hours, totally normal) to quench his newfound appetite for oysters. A quick search on Yelp brought us to Shucks just in time for the Thursday special - $1 oysters. They also had a late night menu available, with typical bar fare (burgers, wings, calamari, chicken strips) for about $5. We ordered a dozen oysters to share, and he had a half pound of peel and eat shrimp. As far as the oysters, I suppose you get what you pay for. Granted... it's July, we're smack dab in the middle of a desert, and they were a dollar; but these definitely weren't the freshest oysters I've ever had. Boyf mowed through his shrimp pretty quickly and seemed satisfied. 

This place is kind of a cross between a dive bar and a generic Applebee's-esque chain. It was open, clean, and not at all smoky; a big plus in my book. The bartender was prompt and to the point, but didn't go out of his way to make small talk. They had a great double IPA from Utah on tap, and he was nice enough to comp our drinks even though I was only sporadically playing 25 cent hands of video blackjack. 

Bottom line: for the price, it was decent, but I'll take Boiling Crab or Hot N Juicy any day.

Nothing screams great place to hang out more than good food, good beer and good friends. 

Since I'm somewhat new to town, I joined a Kickball league. Yeah, laugh all you want, but every week I get to hang out with cool people and play a "sport"....but afterwards, we all come to Shucks. 

The drink prices are very reasonable, the food is solid. Try the Cuban wrap. Fricking amazing. 

The servers are really great. I recommend Ashley. She is the coolest. 

Also , this is a BIG Cowboys bar, so if you actually like that team, come here and hang out. I'm a Jets fan, but who cares. I like a good time, and I know I can find it here. 

P.S. The booths are very comfortable. The bathrooms are clean. And again, try the Cuban Wrap.

Oh my gosh!!! This place is a definite No Go!! I have been 3 times. I give them at least that, and every time it was something different. The first time the food was cold. Not only mine, but the guy next to me had a case of for sure food poisoning if he would eaten his. The second time, I was treated like crap,(ignored, talked down too) I guess-it was because I wasn't a (Regular). And tonight, I was humiliated by the bartender. I was looking for a machine, after eating in the restaurant, I circled the bar 3-4 times. I passed a lady that was not gambling but sitting in front of 3 machines with her friends, she said "I'm leaving" I said, I don't want to run you off". She said I been here long enough, I lost a lot. So I sat down just putting my money in, and from across the bar the female bartender yelled "We have a waiting list for these machines. I had no idea! I could not believe how rude she was!! I get it, people were waiting. But I didn't know. If I was her boss, I would have fired her on the spot. You don't treat people like that. Three strikes! Their out. Awful place!

Generous portion...Seared ahi- tdf!!  Seafood bisque awesome too. Love this place.last time I had crab Louie salad, also awesome. Went here for st. Patricks and it was hoppin!!! Today, around 2pm not busy, a good time to drop in and check it out

UPDATE:
Met some friends here for drinks and the drinks/food were great and the server was super nice! We gambled and guess what.. he comped a few of our drinks! Isn't that how it should be?! Thanks Brooks! 


LAST REVIEW:
Came here last night w a friend.  Ordered the "create your own" with 4!items.. got the calamari which was not good. No flavor and some pieces had undercooked breading on them. The oysters (he said were great! I don't eat them), coconut shrimp and ceviche that we both loved! Also got a bowl of poke to share (which was sooooo good! He got a French connection (courvoisier and grand marnier) and an energy drink. I got a michelada (good flavor) and a ginger ale. 
We Both lost $20 in the machine.. and didn't even get my soda comped.. hmmm. That's unheard of.
5 stars for the food. 
2 stars for the service. Although he was pleasant to us (minus not comping anything) the way he talked to some of the customers wasn't nice. "You need menus?" "Then come get em"

Went here for Thanksgiving dinner. It was empty of course but who eats seafood on Thanksgiving anyway, besides for my family? They had a special turkey dish to accomodate those who wanted a traditional meal.

I ordered & shared the clam bake which consisted of dungenous & snow crab, manila clams, sausage, potatoes, & corn for about $25. It was definitely worth it but I've tasted better clam bakes before.

Our waiter was pretty slow. He forgot to put in our order for oysters. Apparently this restaurant is known for their oysters so I wanted to try some atleast but that didn't happen. He also didn't give us utensils. We pretty much had to wave him down if we wanted something. Pretty bad considering we were basically the only table there.

Great place. Love the flat iron steak. For price for the quality, plus it's always tasty and cooked to the right temp. The scallop appetizer is a steal, especially the Asian one with rice and vegetables. It's really entrée sized.  The lamb chop t-bones are always my favorite. You get 3 per order.

We really liked coming here! My husband is a huge fan of seafood. He got the swordfish special and I got fish and chips. We also got mussels as an appetizer. The swordfish was amazing! I am jealous I didn't get it. The fish and chips were good. The mussels were very good and there were a ton of them! We will be returning. The service was a little slow when we were there, that's the reason for the four-star review.
Always great tunes playing...the 5 for $5 Friday is awesome! The bar always spins up a quality beve!

This is one of my favorite spots to come late at night, after work, for great food. Their oysters are amazing and I usually get those,  but this time I had their crab legs and you can't go wrong either way! My friend had one of the best burgers I've ever had, it had blue cheese on it, I forgot the name of it. Affordable drinks and great food at all hours, what more can you ask for!?

Took my boyfriend here after having not been here in years. Still how I remember it, and always wonderful. Has a strong cigarette smell though so if that bothers you maybe go elsewhere... but what do you expect. I recommend breakfast especially!

Food was decent. Ordered shrimp combo platter which was great. What turned me off was the smoke from the bar. The bar wasn't separated from the eating area and we could smell all the smoke. Sorry, but that doesn't make any meal worth coming back.

We ordered a side of crab legs and I ordered a steak.  The waiter brought me steak and crab legs.  When I told him I only ordered the steak because we had gotten the crab legs on the side he said okay and grabbed the crab legs off my plate.  Is it just me or was that a little weird.  I have been plenty of other places that have said oh okay well just go ahead and have them but I will take them off your ticket.  I have never had anyone just reach over and take food off my plate that was not related to me or dating me.  And on top of it all not very good food.  Will not be going back.

I met with my trainer at Fitlabs down the street on Friday.  He told me I should eat oysters once a week.  I drove directly from the gym to Shucks Tavern and Oyster Bar to remedy the situation immediately.

I had the barbecued oysters.  They were good and served so hot the shells were kind of burning my fingers.  I loved the oysters but I thought I'd like to see a little less sauce so you can taste the oyster.  Next time I will try the regular oysters and compare.  Very good.  I am going to target Thursdays for the Oysters.

Fridays they have a happy hour and so I ordered fried calamari and some fries and some iced tea.  My bill with tip was right at $20.  

It was good food but it would be a lot more fun with the friends in tow!

So I come into this place all the time. The bartenders are usually amazing but IVE had two bad experiences in a row now. Last night we stopped in late to grab a few drinks and some food. Sat around for 10 minutes before the rude bartender came over with her mouth full of food to ask what we wanted. 
The food was decent as usual but the bartender never refilled our cocktails and never even came back to see how the food was.
Then this morning, I was craving some breakfast and a Bloody Mary so I sat at the bar per usual and waited 15 minutes then left. The bartender never even came out... 
Really turned me off to this place!

Tonight was not a great night at this Shucks as the Cigar smoke got to us as soon as we walked in the door. We went to a booth but still had to move farther back. The fish fry was not as good as a normal Friday as the fish was very Greasy and the cole slaw so dry that even the waiter agreed but did nothing to correct it. Going to stay away as this was our Friday nite fish spot but we are going to try some other places.
