I am giving this place one star due to fact that on arriving there was a sign stating no one under 21 was allowed in the building despite the profile on Yelp stating the opposite.
Love everything about  the place!  Alway have the best service,food, and drinks. Special  thank u to brooke and all the staff members.

Great seafood. Love their fried oysters. Great food choices, casual, eat at the bar if you want. Classic rock plays, come as you are. Food served in paper lined baskets. Everything I've ever ordered was delicious. Sports on all the tv's, video poker machines at the bar. Casual ambiance, friendly staff.

I like this spot. It's real chill and reasonably priced. I've been on 2 occasions and I'm sure I'll be back. If I had to say something I don't like about this place is it would be so much better if they offered a happy hour on drinks instead of just on the gaming then it would certainly be one of my go to hang-outs. Still good spot however.
I love this place. This place is one of the rear why I moved back to Vegas from Philadelphia. You can get any kind of food at any time of the day. I live their fried shrimp and fried scallops.

So, this is a bar. For anyone that might be confused (we were). We thought we'd found a cool local seafood joint, but no. They even have a kids menu. But it's one small room, half is a bar and half is booths. The "bar" is smoking, dining area is non, but there's absolutely nothing dividing the two. So you'll be breathing in smoke while you eat. Not good for kids at all. This is not a family place.

Hmmm..I don't know why this place is so underrated.Went around 1am last night for the 1.00 oysters (Which are no longer $1.00 they are now $1.50)Anyways I was a little skeptical about the place due to the reviews but I'm so glad I went anyways.Oysters were on point super fresh didn't experience any sand or what not.They had half off draft beer which was even more awesome!!Didn't get the bartender name but he was awesome as well.Beer was super cold, oysters were fresh bartender never left us thirsty (And he's a raider fan)The bar/restaurant was very clean.Definitely coming back

I am really a fan of Shucks!
Came here on random occasions for some time and always enjoyed the food. 
Recently, I had some friends in town and after one breakfast at Shucks, they made it their home base. This years, I have been there 5 times for a meal and some drinks. Now, on a first name basis with several servers, my gf and I are trying every sandwich and breakfast item. If you a fan of Fries, you are in luck, they are among the best!! Waffle and regular!!

Check it out, it's a good join, neat specials and very, very awesome staff!!
(I don't work there, but I would)

I was craving oysters on a Thursday night. Went to Shuck's because it was nearby my house and had dollar oysters special on Thursdays which is all they had going. Came in, sat down and I asked if they still had dollar oysters. Sadly, waitress informed us that it's $1.50 now. I looked at the menu and it's actually cheaper by 5 cents if you order a dozen from the menu. Had the oysters here before and it was hit or miss, some were way too small. Food price is overinflated. Food is just meh, for the price not worth it. Much rather go to seafood buffet or oyster bar at palace station at least you're getting your money's worth for way much more delicious seafood. Never again will I come here.

HORRIBLE SERVICE by Trainai. I've been going there for years. Unfortunately, the service continues to get worse. It's as if no one is watching employees in the restaurant section! Dinner and bar service are good. I'm specifically referring to breakfast. Trainai doesn't seem to care about her tables/patrons at all! The only time you get a smile or a thank you as when she's dropping off the check because it's close to tip time. Last time we went we could see in to the kitchen and saw that our food sat there for over five minutes before she picked it up. The restaurant was not busy. She was near the beverage station joking with other employees and texting. They have a small table at the back of the restaurant where they wrap utensils in napkins. She spent a great deal of the time we were there sitting at that table, while ignoring us for the most part. She was talking to other employees, texting and even leaning ON the napkins. Gross! At one point she coughed on them and continued as if it was nothing. So disgusting!!!!! Another time she was leaning over it while she was texting and literally had her armpits on the napkins. Gross!! If it weren't for her lack of caring about her patrons, this place would be a four star or even a five star because of the value. 

The food is good and even the prices have gone up quite a bit in the last couple years, it is still a great value! Cool place to hang out and have drinks and watch games, especially if you're a Bears fan! Check out the specials posted on the wall as you walk in! Just do yourself a favor and don't sit in her section.

Went to try this place with my husband. First off the air conditioner was out on a 110 degree day. Not really their fault. But their bartender was serving drinks to everyone and never even offered water. I had to ask. We were gambling and ordered drinks. Had to pay for them. Unusual in Vegas but ok. What wasn't ok was the shots we ordered and waited 10 minutes for only to get water with a drop of liquor. This place cost way too much for the horrible service we received. Not going back.
Fresh seafood,,Tasty food,,Great Bloody Marys...Good prices...Clean place

Although I've only checked in twice,  the boyfriend and I have dined here a few more times than that,  and we've never been disappointed.  We're always aware that during certain time of the year, certain seafood will not be in season. 

Friday's special: 1/2 price Martinis and $5 appetizers (crab cocktail,  crab spinach dip,  mussels,  calamari, & crawfish)

Tonight, the linings of my stomach was calling for seafood and beer, and Shucks had both! Once we arrived, there was a bit of a crowd, but it seemed everyone was enjoying their food that the noise level was amazingly low. 

We sat ourselves,  and our server,  Ash, immediately greeted us and started with our drinks.  She was super sweet and attentive!  I was craving everything on the menu that Ash let me order one thing at a time and was quick with the service!  Loved her for it! 

So we ended the night with two beers, two $5 specials (mussels and crab spinach dip),  Texas oysters (not spicy at all), and 1/2 lb snow crabs legs (not fully in season).  The mussels was Ahh-mazing! I wish the crab spinach dip came with more crab :/ and the Texas oysters was suppose to be topped with lemon,  tequila, and tabasco ... I didn't taste any of it :/ Shouldve just gone with the 1/2 dozen of oysters and asked for extra lemon and Tabasco. At least the will be a next time! :D

I really don't get some of the low ratings that other users have posted. If you're looking for good quality Pub Food (Burgers, Sandwiches, Breakfasts, etc) served 24 hours a day, Shucks is Awesome. I haven't tried out their crab and oyster special nights but I've heard from friends they are pretty decent value.  I mostly go on the graveyard shift and they have some ridiculously low priced specials on Graveyard. Big Burger and Fries for $4, Omelets $4, and quite a few other options. The food is consistently good and high quality. The graveyard bartender ( I think his name is Larry) is super friendly, always has a menu ready for me, knows what I like to drink, and remembers my name and what I had eaten the time before even though it's sometimes a month or so between visits.

In Summary, Shucks is on my short list of places to stop for food late at night when I want something decent, I don't want to pay an arm and a leg, and just want to get in and out in a reasonable amount of time.

Jason
This place is great BUT if the bartender Doug shows up, LEAVE! He is the rudest a$$hole I've ever seen and doesn't care about you or anything else!
their breakfast rocks , cant beat the price , dont let the secret out !

Newcastle on tap, of course I'm there!  My father loves this place so it is always in the plan to have dinner there when he is here.  We always start with oysters on the half shell which are always good and hot wings which are pretty good too.  For dinner I always get the crab cakes and side salad.   The crabcakes are yummy!  The side salad is top notch as well.  My hubby loves there alfredo and the kids like the food a lot too.  We have tried just about everything and it's all good.  Love the Clam Bake and Ahi tacos.  If you are a seafood lover, try this and you will not be disappointed!

Good sandwiches and steak and ribs....I just can't stop..they have it all and it's ALL GOOD!
This is strictly a BREAKFAST review.  For the price, you can't beat it in the area (Centennial Hills).  The service is a little shoddy, but overall a great deal to recharge on a Sunday morning

By the owner of Beanos comes... Shucks.  After being a regular at Beanos, I thought that I knew what to expect: Hole in the wall, decent food.

Wasn't expecting a large, regular late-night crowd, friendly crowd, and a varied, delicious sea-food menu available at all hours along with some very affordable breakfast deals!  

It's now high on my list of late-night dining simply for the quality of food: for example - excellent garden omelet for four bucks that comes with the usual toast and poattoes.  But the tomatoes are simmered, the spinach is plentiful, the mushrooms are roasted before being tossed into the eggs.  It's worth the ten minute drive up the 95 for me.  

The seafood is fresh and plentiful - they don't skimp on the portions!

A new review- would love to give Shucks on Durango a 5 Star rating because the bartenders are awesome.  Unfortunately the clientele are cigarette smoking, foul mouth POS's. It's a shame when you can't sit at the bar with your wife and talk to your favorite bar tender without hearing blatant sex talk. Not appropriate ! I know it's a bar but use some common sense. And yes, Josh, you know who they are.
I would consider this place a dive. Bar is not stocked at all. No top shelf. Old timers and locals. Bad food. Place was dead. Would not return.
I really like this place. so calm with delicious dishes!

Was here last night with my sister. We wanted a quick bite. I liked the decor of this place and definitely feeling the food here! We ordered the calamari which was cooked to perfection! And we ordered the Rockefeller oysters which were delicioso! And the mussels, reminded me of hot and juicy. We also ordered a couple drinks. And all of this was $50. I was very pleased with the pricing here. Well done. Definitely coming back here or bringing a friend !

The New England Chowder was not too thick but deliciously flavored, so was the crab spinach dip w super thin tortillas, and the oyster PO boys were good too...albeit, more oysters wouldn't have hurt:)  my new favorite place!
Incredible seafood, FRESH!  Great Prices.  Crab Lovers this is the spot.

I was served a cold $8.95 seafood Benedict and it was served 10 minutes after my family's meals. When I spoke to the server and then manager, they were extremely disrespectful and defensive. I've been coming here for years and have never had such a terrible experience. How sad.

I live in the area and wanted somewhere different to get some food, drinks, and play a little keno. 
Reviews were not very good but, I was pleasantly surprised. Service was perfect. We were greeted as soon as we sat down, asked by numerous bartenders if we needed anything, and very friendly. We happen to go on $1 oyster night which was a plus. The oysters were very nice sized but, a bit gritty. I had the gumbo which was no compare to Oyster Bar quality but, still good. I'd definitely return.

Went here on a Friday night. A bowl pf peel n eat shrimp was $5. Not bad. Good service, but the food was ok. Oysters were fresh but really small. The appetizer we ordered, spinach artichoke dip, was weirdly colored blue almost. The chips it came with tasted a bit burnt. The drinks we ordered weren't bad, but they weren't good either. Overall, we will come here for the small but fresh oysters. But most likely that would be it.

Shucks to me, as a Stand alone restaurant is one of the very few left in this great city of Las Vegas with quality and standards above the rest. 
Always amazing service and food.
The quality of food to price ratio is crazy. Really inexpensive for what you get.
I rather eat here than most places on the strip.
I'm very lucky too,that I live close to this spot..
Don't think of it as just gaming bar food . (Won't mention any names)If you just come for the food you won't be Disappointed.  
Specially the great sandwiches and burgers. 
Ohh...and keep your eye on the great specials on the door as you enter.
Great service awesome food shows the games on Sundays prices are average would recommend here forsure !
Generous big plate with huge coconut shrimp is so worth it! I love Fresh crab meat Louie salad with toast. SoooOoo good. All the food is so good. Oysters so fresh too!

I have been pissed at this place for a while but decided to give it a chance tonight.  Kind of let bygones be bygones.  The reason I was pissed is that during the football season I called them to see if they were showing the Chargers game.  They said yes.  So we drove there and before we parked I went in and asked them again and they said yes.  So we went in (in our Chargers shirts) and sat at the end of the sports bar next to someone else in a Chargers jersey and told the female bartender what we wanted to watch and she said no problem.  We ordered beers and after a while noticed that the Chargers game should have already started.  So we mentioned it to the bartender and she went to check and came back and told us the owner would only let her put the Bears game on (there are a milllion tv screens in there and it shouldn't have been a problem to have our little end of the bar watching the Chargers).  So by the time we fpund another sports bar we missed more than the first quarter of the game.  Seems to me I did enough checking and they should have stood by their promises.

Anyway.... we tried the place again for the food.  It was only OK.  We had calamari appitizer which was OK but I would have liked cocktail sauce instead of marinara for dipping.  Ordered the Shucks salad which had crab, a few shrimp and a decent size peice of seared tuna on it.  The tuna was only so-so but the crab and shrimp was good.  My guy had a bowl of the seafood bisque.  He asked if they had any sourdough bread to go with it and they brought him two pieces of sourdough toast like you would have with breakfast.  Seems to me a seafood place should have some good crusty bread, don't you think?  Do not order the ice tea.  It is not brewed, we had to send it back.

The food is great but I agree with the rest of these reviews, the service is awful. I got scallops which were great, but the service was not there, at all. If I go back I'll be sure to avoid the older filipino woman!

Food was great,service was horrible! My fiancé and I went during a very slow. It was only us and one other table in there so there's no excuse for the way the service was I had to get up three times to ask for our check! The food was delicious just wish they would hire better servers!

One star because they won't let you say no stars.  I'm usually a good fan of shucks but tonight when I had company in town we sent back three orders :fried oysters were burnt, fish n chips were not cooked completely and then the mussels were overcooked. We never saw a manager  and never received a proper apology waiter seemed to think it was funny with each plate that was sent back.  I was throughly disappointed and will not return

I was kind of nervous about going to this place, but I love seafood. I had read a lot of bad reviews about the service. I was pleasantly surprised. It was seat yourself, but there was someone there right away to ask for a drink order. We were only there for a quick lunch, so it was just sodas. Good to know that they have $3 margaritas.  We just ordered the crab cake stuffed shrimp and the clam strips, a cup of clam chowder and a cup of seafood bisque.

The clam chowder was really good, being from MA, I'm kind of picky. My husband really liked the seafood bisque, not what I think of bisque, but tasty and had some seafood in it. The crab cake stuffed shrimp were kind of tiny, but the taste was good, and the clam strips were more like real clams than I have seen anywhere else on the west side of the country.

Overall, it was all really good. Anthony, our server, was excellent. I even knocked over my whole diet coke and didn't get an attitude. I will definitely go back!

a seafood joint less than 2 minutes from my house in a neighborhood filled with chain restaurants and their kitchen is open 24/7 with daily and graveyard specials?
this pescetarian is as happy as a clam at high tide!  =D

i must admit, i had low expectations of shucks on my first visit.
i'd read all of the reviews, some by people i trust implicitly, so i was willing to give it a try, at the very least.
i was pleasantly surprised as the food was delicious and the service was friendly and accommodating.
i ordered the scallop sliders which are prepared on hawaiian sweet rolls!
imho, sliders should really only ever be served on hawaiian sweet rolls.
the scallops were tender and flavorful and the wasabi sauce has a nice little punch!
crunchy waffle fries on the side were yummy as well.

shucks has quickly become my neighborhood spot.
i've since ordered several different items and i've never been disappointed.
the mahi mahi is one of my favorite items on their menu.....prepared perfectly tender and flaky, served with wild rice and cooked veggies that are still crisp.

two of my biggest pet peeves: 
1. overcooked fish
2. soggy cooked vegetables
you won't find either of those here.

the prices are already extremely reasonable but the daily specials are where it's at.
tuesdays - $3 tacos
wednesdays - b1g1 sandwiches and wraps
thursdays - $1 oysters

i'm so glad i gave shucks a chance and even happier that they exceeded my expectations in every way.
i'm totally a fan!

We went there for my dad's birthday (11 people) and it was the worst seafood we have ever had. It tasted like everything was previously frozen!

The calamari was overcooked, too chewy, the shrimp were slimy and smelly, and the crabcakes taste like they were previously frozen. The clams were overcooked and were sent back. 
The service was good but the food was terrible.

5 Stars! Not cause its a super duper fine dining place... but because it was great in food and experience. Yeah sure it's nothing to go Ape over, but I got everything I expected from this kind of place. Had some oyster shooters. Yum. Louisiana oysters... YUM YUM.

One thing I DO have to say is, they had the BEST snow crab I've ever had. The texture was good. Not mushy or cakey. Not super salty or watered down like the stuff you might find at buffets. And it had an awesome sweetness to it. I enjoyed it more than the lobster. And I love lobster over crab!

Great food. Check.
Good drinks... check...
...totally worth what you pay for.

I left the place like a fatty.

If you don't want crawfish but have a seafood craving.. go here.

It might not satisfy everyone... but this place now tops Hot & Juicy and Boiling Crab for me!

Way back in the days when use to play my adult rec hockey games at the Las Vegas Ice Center over ten years ago or more.. Shucks was one of the team drinking spots after the games since literally right across the street. I only have found memories of the place. The beers reasonable price, laid back atmosphere, lots of televisions all around the bar area and dining area, and nice little diversity of food not just normal bar food. Since no longer play at the Las Vegas Ice Center not often drive around that area. Talk about bringing the throwback on St Patty Day. 

St Patty Day went out with my roommates for some drinks and food. We tried to do traditional Irish bar but really if looking for laid back atmosphere not the best idea. Shucks was close by our second miss. It wound up being ideal spot get our celebration on. The place was not crowded but few people in the spirit with full on green outfits and partying. Not crazy that we could have conversation without yelling at one another. 

Guess Friday they have this "FIVE for $5" from 8am-midnight on appetizers. So we got the calamari and crab & spinach dip start. The calamari was solid nothing that blow you away. It had nice breading, great seasoning, nice portion size (usually see specials make it smaller but our waiter told us normal size portion), and both dipping sauces was great. The crab and spinach was just ok for me. I could have done without. It great deal because we ordered two of the five items. 

My entree I ordered the oyster po boy. It was solid. The bread was on point. Nice crusty on the outside. The oysters they use nice size ones not huge or small. Just right cause last thing want small ones all dried out or big ones moist in the middle. The dressing along with the lettuce, tomato, and am sure missing couple other items. It all came together really nice. If looking for solid sandwich the po boy great choice.
Great price for the breakfast deal $4.99 chicken steak & eggs, friendly staff good food and price. Music is little loud. But it is a bar, what can you say right ??
Wow seafood is great !oysters specials on thursday wonderfull .service was great found my new home!

We have been coming here for years.  The food is delicious and reasonable, the atmosphere is relaxed, the service is above attentive and most importantly, it's a great family environmental including with small children. We went for breakfast AND dinner the recent thanksgiving as we were looking to maximize kid time.  There is a terrific kid menu and the portions for the whole menu are ample. The $5.00 appetizer menu is awesome.  Service always fast and cordial/warm, we have bought many friends along and they are grateful for the intro.  Its our regular place!  thanks to Victor and all the wonderful staff!

Eh, not sure if I like this place or not. 

Thursday oysters for 1.50 were good. Large and cold. Too much cocktail sauce served with them. The other specials looked enticing but questionable. 

My drink was weak and pricy. 

No smoking in it. Bar or restaurant? Confusing.

Customer service was just ok. I like my bartenders  with a smile.. A little flirty too.
I liked the ambience of this place. It was very casual, but the food was terrible. I really dislike writing negative reviews, but this is a place I will never eat at again.

Feel duped by suspicious raving reviews.   Oysters were ok, prefer colder.  Atmosphere makes chili's or outback seem glamorous.  Service was mediocre at best.  Worst part was coincidently the most important, the food.  My wife ordered a bucket that cost around $20 and consisted of 9 counted shrimp and 12 clams that were drowned in butter and water.  I ordered a $25 dollar seafood platter that had seafood that rivaled long John silver's complete with store bought crab cakes.  Same price or more expensive than way better local joints with better seafood in town.  Other reviews must be friends of the owners.  For price, quality, and ambiance, giving two stars is fair, if not generous.

My friend and I went here strictly because it was rated 4 stars on Yelp and is right next to his house.   We all know when something is rated 4 stars on Yelp that it is truly trust worthy and this place is no different.  The clam strips that I shared with my friend were some of the best that I have had yet and I am from New England.  My taste for seafood is pretty hard to please.  The service was great from the 3 different people that approached our table and they genuinely seemed to care.  Thats always a plus.  My main meal that I enjoyed was Fish and Chips and it was prepared wonderfully.  The only downfall is that this place is a Chicago Bear's bar, but it can be overlooked to enjoy such good food.  :)

I LOVE THIS PLACE! The food is great. The specials are wonderful. Haven't tried their drinks yet besides beer. Service is pretty good as well. This is going to become my new favorite spot.

Thursdays = $1 oysters! Other specials I remember:

Tuesdays = $3 tacos (the mahi mahi is the best! Chicken and steak was good as well)

Sundays = 1/2 off wine bottles

Those are the days I have gone so far. Ordered the clam bake on thursday and it was a decent portion. Flavor of it was great (picture posted) Also they have a burger special BOGO FREE with fries and $2 for draft - the burger was cooked perfectly with bacon, mushrooms, and cheese. Also had raw oysters and rockafeller (a bit small, but good flavor). Calamari was yummy. Shrimp ceviche was PHENOMENAL!

Reason for missing the 5th star.. well, parking was small and food takes a little while.

After reading such great reviews from you awesome yelpers, I knew I had to give this place a try. I looked at their menu and got so excited that I had to go that day. So I went to have a quick dinner with my bf last night around 9:30pm.

It wasn't too smokey or smelly inside, and it was a nice quiet day. We decided on the rockafeller oysters (6 per order) and they were delicious! Though the oysters were  bit small and it seemed there was way too much spinach for the amount of oyster, it somehow worked out! Great flavor.

And then we shared the ribs and shrimp combo. The ribs were great! Cooked perfectly and the sauce was yummy, it was a bit too saucy for me, but super yummy. And since I am a low-carber, I asked to sub the fries and slaw for a side salad. (Very fresh veggies). And we chose the garlic shrimp which was also delectable.

I must say, though, the server was a bit slow. He was the only one working the night shift and I guess he was tired, but there was only us and one other table...

I am going back Tuesday to try more yumminess. I will post pictures of the items I get! I'm excited to try their other stuff like the lobster fingers and clam bake and crab (which they ran out of when I was there)...

I highly recommend this place. I will probably make it a regular place to be.

Good quality Snow Crab Legs are hard to find outside of a Vegas buffet, and the ones on the buffets are usually knackered with pre-scored cuts to make eating 'easier' but take the fun out of cracking and pickin' the crab, which is half the fun IMO. I've been in the hunt for a non-buffet Snow Crab spot. Not even Costco sells Snow Crab (at least 11.5 months out of the year...)

Have eaten at Shucks twice in the past week, the first time I ordered a pound ($17.90/pound) of Snow Crab, it came out Grade A quality: color, size and taste. Impressive! Pressed my luck a few days later and was served a Grade B quality crab :( Still better than the crab available at the neighborhood Smiths/Kroger/Albertsons (Grade C: $6.99/pound) but disappointing that the 2nd visit wasn't consistent with the first. Also, the side of roasted red potatoes on the 2nd visit were slightly under-roasted. Just substitute for their Burger-King-style, twice-fried fries instead, and you'll be OK: these are delicious.

Love that Shucks is open 24 hours and non-smoking. A direct view of the televisions is a slight challenge from some of the seating areas, so get there early before the big game. Half-price draft beers on certain NFL nights is a solid deal ($2-$3 per pint).

So this was the WORST  service I've ever had here. I live around the corner and this is my favorite place to go to. But I'm seriously considering goin to timbers next time. 
I usually order food and hang out with friends. Tonight we all  ordered appetizers and entrées, had a few drinks. Built up a pretty big bill. But still we were having a good time. Our server was nice and she was cute. Had a nice smile. She could have come around to check on us a bit more often but what ever that's ok with us. She got what ever we needed fast so that's all that counts. 
She ended up leaving before we were done and told us to go to the bar for anything we needed. Ok sounds easy. NOT!
The bartender wes a freaking asshole. We're trying to get our checks (my BF is trying to get them) and the bartender is giving him attitude about what's on what ticket. He doesn't know he was at the bar gambling most of the time. So I walk over and began to try and fix things. My BF turns around and walks away and the bartender throws his arms up and makes a face. (Like woah wtf) so I'm trying to work with the guy he prints up the ticket and throws it to the side then he walks of mumbling something and goes serves other tables. HELLO! I'm trying to get out and pay my bill. (Witch for the table was around $120) after he was done gave us a list of tickets we paid before he could even make drinks for other people. 

Needless to say leaving took way longer then it should. Service was shit at the end. Food was ok. Overall I haven't left a place this upset in a long time. Ugh. Good luck.

I will never go here again! The worst oyster Rockefeller ever! And I only went to order to go and it was as if I was an inconvenience! And the soup was a thick paste no way a bisque! I wasted my $40 for real
Late night pick up for me and hubby, not super into seafood but he loves it, chicken finger and chicken wings Delish!!

My girlfriend and my son and myself eat here about twice a month. We have tried several different things on the menu from Sandwiches to pasta to fish and seafood. The portions are good, and the food is always hot and fresh. The prices are very reasonable and your service will be prompt and friendly. If you have not eaten here you are missing out on the jewel of Flamingo Road.

Oh my Gosh! This place was so good! Oyster Rockefeller, Clam chowder, clam linguini, and now the the apple pie with a scoop of ice cream, all was sooo good! Definitely worth a 2nd or even a 3rd trip to come here. Pretty close to the house so that's good cause the Cucumber 'Chelda' is doing a number now. But was all so worth the price.

I really enjoyed this place until I found 4 hairs in my food...
The first couple times that I ate here, the food was really good and I was very impressed.  Then on the 3rd visit I ordered the fried shrimp basket to go and while eating I noticed not 1, but 4 black hairs in my food and one was even wrapped around the shrimp.  So I called the restaurant the next day to speak with a manager and left a detailed message as to what happened, and wouldn't you know... I never got a return call.  So its safe to say that this joint is officially off the list.

Very disappointed in the food, oyster rockafellas tasted warmed up and everything was slightly cold when it was suppose to be hot . Also the shrimp cocktail had no flavor it was gross, I won't be returning.

Great seafood! Great service! Good beer!
I love their Friday happy hour menu! $5 mussels! Can't beat that!!!! Also they have other happy hour menus for different days of the week. 
I do not recommend their lobster roll or cioppino. Too thick of a soup base. BUT everything else has been great! Even their steaks! 
The servers are always very knowledgable and friendly. Just don't expect exceptional service if their busy, just like any other busy place!!! Have patience when their busy and you will have a great experience. The highlight of all my dining experiences always comes down to the food! And their food is yummy!!!!!!!!!!
Oh and their oysters are fresh and delish!!!!!!!!!
I love this place right next to my house and everyday they have a special !!!! Oysters crab legs whatever you're in the mood for this is the place to be very chill great environment super clean
I love this place all the food is soo good and they have good prices and is a nice place to go with the family and friends

This is the only place I have ever been to that charges a to go charge . Which is so totally absurd. I called in my order, went to pick up my order and I notice the charge. The girl told me it is a to go charge. They charge you 50 cents for every container they put your food. Then I got home and they gave me the wrong food. I will never go back. Fuck them bitches!!!!!
I'd rate this place as decent.  Not great but not to bad.  The service was good but the quality of the food left me with more to desire.
Excellent Sevice, Delicious Food, cozy atmosphere and reasonable prices!:)AW
This place used to be a go-to for late night food n drink, but dang, its slipped bigtime. Always dead, and bartender won't even honor their past daily specials anymore.  Not worth going to!!!

Disgusting. Food and service was bad. Oysters were strange and not cold at all. A pitcher of beer here costs more than a dozen of their crappy oysters. I also found a dead fly in my beer cup which I should have taken a picture of as proof.

No Smoking anywhere! Love love love it. They offer $2 drafts on Monday and Wednesday and a different daily dining special all week. This location is also a Dallas Cowboys bar so they offer food and drink specials during all the games. Some of the specials include $8 pitchers, $5 Texas teas and $1 oysters. They offer a lot more food specials during the games and a Bloody Mary bar starting at $6 for the 10am games. You might want to get there a little early for good seats. In my experience, it doesn't fill up but the seats in the bar area around the tv's are always scooped up pretty quick. There are a few tv's in the dining area as well but the view is not as good.

The service is average and the food is a little better than typical tavern fare. I recommend the Crab Stuffed Tilapia with vegetables and wild rice. It's a pretty tasty entree for around $15. And did I mention that there is no smoking, even in the bar?

This was our 2nd time here and it was even more amazing than the first. We got crab and spinach dip and calamari to start for only $5 each! Both were amazing. We added on a bowl of soup which was a little salty but good. Then for meals we had the shrimp platter and crab stuffed tilapia. Both were amazing. The time it took to get our food was amazingly fast. We had numerous waiters and waitresses always checking in on us. This place is a must go!!! Only down side is its a little noisy.

Decent place, I don't know what all the bad reviews are for. Service was good. Food was good. We ordered seafood jambalaya which you can get with either rice or pasta, we ordered it with pasta. It was a huge amount. And tasted fine not great but fine. Also ordered Dungeness crab, fried oysters with a side of garlic fries, very good. The oysters came with a nice size helping of coleslaw, I'm not a huge fan of coleslaw but I tasted it and it was good. Crab legs came with red potatoes. All good.

I had the Tuesday Taco special. You can order any taco for $3. I had the Mahi Mahi, and shrimp. My fiance gave me a chunk of Tuna as well.

Get the Tuna first. It was cooked perfectly. The Mahi Mahi was also good, but you notice there isn't enough of the sauce on the taco.

The shrimp is the worst. It is chopped up pieces of shrimp that have almost no flavor. It is like chewy annoyances in a flour tortilla. 

Please give patrons a corn tortilla option and put a little more sauce in the taco.
Service here isn't what it was, but still a decent place. Prices are reasonable and the food is above average. Wednesday is buy one get one free on burgers and sandwiches .

We came here at 2am after a night on the town because this place is 24 hours, but we would have been better off at IHOP or Denny's.  The overnight worker there was incredibly testy and rude.  We did nothing to provoke him other than walk through the door.  I mean I get it if he doesn't like working the night shift, but don't take it out on the customers.  The only reason I give this place 2 stars instead of 1 is because the food was good.  I ordered the fish and chips, which was crispy and not over-battered.  But the food did not make up for the terrible service.  Some of my friends felt so uncomfortable that they did not want to order anything.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will not be going to this place again.

Absolutely amazing!  Service was great!  Restaurant has a comfy relaxed vibe.  The food is phenomenal!  I got the oysters, clams and a black and bleu salad...everything was delicious!  First time, but not my last!

My first visit here was a couple of years ago, I met a girlfriend for a late night snack. Sat at the bar and had some chicken wings which I enjoyed. 

Second visit was at the Durango location after leaving work at Centennial Hills Hospital. I was craving for country fried steak so I called ahead and ordered to go for the whole family. It was late and their doors were locked and you have to be buzzed in. I sat at the bar and waited for them to prepare 6 country fried steaks which didn't take very long. He even helped me to my car. I would order from here again if I get out early and hungry for breakfast. 

Third visit was at the Flamingo location. My boys and I came from Christmas Town and this was the closest I had bookmarked. Parked right in front and sat ourselves in a booth. It wasn't too busy, you guys know I like that :-) We all ordered a raspberry lemonade and ordered the crab spinach dip right away (too salty) while we decided our entrees.

I didn't enjoy the jambalaya I ordered, it wasn't spicy at all. The chicken alfredo, my 14yr old didn't finish so we took it home. Now the Schucks burger was very much liked. My 11yr old wanted to order another one! Hold on there tiger, that's enough for you today lol

Expertly crafted late night and midnight menus still available!

One bartender is great, female, there is a bartender graveyard who cussed me out because I called him out in his rudeness. I even complained to management the following day. I still will frequent this joint because of their amazing 24hour deals.
Don't get the carry out cat fish. Under cooked not crispy at all. Cold frys. Big hunk of fish sitting in grease. 21 usd for that with 4 shrimp which were over cook. Sorry.
Just had the calamari, and it was dry and chewy. It tasted old, it seems like they changed the recipe to their calamari. Very disappointed, I will not be eating here in the near future.

Although I miss Ashley tremendously she was our server for more than 5 years. My family and I frequent Shucks at least once a week for either dinner or breakfast and the food is always excellent. I would highly recommend this establishment for dinning.

For years I have driven past Shuck's and wondered just what was going on inside the place.  From the outside it is certainly a curious structure with an almost abusive amount of signage and a corrugated metal sort of look.  You really don't even know what to expect inside.  Answer is, you shouldn't expect much.  On top of sporting the same decoration as likely slapped on in the early 1980s, this place is a Dallas Cowboys-devoted sports bar.  For some of us, that will hurt your appetite.  

So why did I only ding the rating one star for such an assault on a girl via ambiance?  Shuck's food is is really disturbingly good.  We were guessing it would either be super sketchy or really good.  Thank god it was the latter.  Their menu is a curious collection of laminated pages and their claim of oysters just lists them in quantity, not type.  No one should come in expecting a raw bar experience.

You should expect really good oyster shooters and lots of them.  There are three types, of which we chose the Barracho, essentially a traditional tequila shot complete with salt and lime.  Added to the happy hour order ($5) of peel-and-eat shrimp (NOTE: they give you a spot of very nice horseradish which was excellent and unexpected), this makes for an excellent start.  Also, the martinis are half price during happy hour and without a doubt it was one of the best shaken martinis i have had in recent memory.  I am often disappointed.

Our server was quick and on top of our table with the perfect combination of food/drink delivery, plate swipes and privacy.  It was impressive.

Lastly, our food could not have been better.  The cheeseburger was perfection.  The right amount of bun softness and practically perfect ratio of melted cheese to meat patty with right amount of doneness.  The thin-cut French fries were straight out of the handbook of how to make perfectly cooked potatoes. And my steak was done precisely to my order.  You would think this would be easy, but to get differing meats done correctly and delivered on time seems to be a problem for most places.  Shuck's nailed it.

I'm almost scared to go back.  Have you ever gone to a place and had such a good experience that you think it has to be a complete mistake?  However, the more I think about those tequila oyster shooters, the more I think I will be back sooner than later.

Well my dinner plans fell through somewhere else so my husband and I was driving around trying to figure out what to eat.....I didn't want TGIF or Chili's(you know...your typical chain restaurant) so I decided to
Look on Yelp for a spot that had seafood and this spot came up. The food was great and our waitress was really nice. I was little skeptical based off the reviews but decided to try it anyway! I wish it was a little brighter because it was too dark it other than that it was good....will go again!

Sorry, but this is my opinion. I feel when you are working on tips, at least make a attempt to have customer service skills or a personality. When I have thousands of places to choose from in Las Vegas, please make me feel grateful I decided to spent my money here. What is sad is I left $5 tip and the server (Jonnae) doesn't even understand why.
My daughter and I ate here on March 1st and ordered the garlic fries, which were amazing. Tonight we ordered the garlic fries and it was missing the parsley. We mentioned this to Jonnae and her answer was, "Oh it was just for decoration." Really, the pink flamingo in front yard is for decoration. How can you be inconsistent with the way you serve food in the same week?  Nothing like leaving a restaurant mad you spend your money there.
This place wasn't bad at all, I just wish they had menu options that weren't sea food. Maybe some appetizers or something. The items are really limited if your like me and don't eat she'll fish

Driven by many times but never Stopped until the Packers were playing the Seahawk's in the playoffs.  Felt odd since this is a Bears Bar but I knew it wouldn't be busy. 

I went for the Shrimp Platter which had fried popcorn, butterflied coconut, and plain ole fried shrimp.  The coconut milk dipping sauce was my favorite part.  Everything was delicious we had the spinach artichoke flat bread. Yummy!

The beer choice was pretty standard with your common big 3 Bud, Miller and Coors.

The burger looked huge. The Big Mother Shucker! No just kidding it had a different name but something along those lines. I will give that a try  next time.  As well as some oysters that they are know for.

I've been to this and the other location a few times. I've got to say that I'm surprised that I'm able to get good seafood from a bar. I love oysters so $1 oyster night on Thursdays is great to take advantage of. The service is decent enough. I mean it is a bar so I don't expect super tentative service or anything but the servers are always nice. The prices aren't too bad either. 

I had the lobster roll. Now it's not big chunks of lobster meat like I'm used to. It's a lobster salad (which it does state in the menu) with mayo and celery. However there is a good amount of meat in the roll and it is tasty. When given the option of fries I chose garlic. Those were very good as well. They use a fresh make garlic butter with minced garlic over the fries. As far as drinks go, my mother had a mandarin cosmo which was delicious. I've had good experiences with this place so far and will continue to come back.

This is the 3rd time I have experience eating here and got deathly ill. I kept giving this joint another chance and the food is so bad that food poisoning is always the result. Please check your expirations guys. This is not right!  Don't eat here unless of course you want to end up poisoned

It's a really great place for seafood, especially late at night when all other options are closed.  It's nice to have a place like this in the Northwest area of Vegas, because it's still up and coming and the pickings on good restaurants aren't exactly numerous.

I had a daily special, and to be completely honest, I thought it was great.  The fried fish was soo good. Crispy on the outside, yet still tender and soft on the inside.

I come here a lot and I love it! The first time I came here, I hit my first 5 spot playing Keno (I'm not old... I swear)! The first time I came here was a little off though. We didn't get ID'd from a blond server. I would understand if we looked over 30 but I'm 21 and Chris is 24. The server with the red hair is amazing! She is great at recommending food, drinks, and just fun to talk to! I wasn't too fond of Doug at first, but he's really great to me now! 

There is smoking in this bar so don't come in here and complain about that. Most bars have smoking anyway. It's opened 24 hours too which is a huge plus being down the street! It's right across the street from Smiths on N. Durango and Elkhorn. I think it's cool that they have an ATM inside as well! 

Now for food. The bacon wrapped shrimp ($8.95) is to die for. The bacon is crispy and has this amazing smokey taste to it. The shrimp in this dish are huge as well! The Wild West burger ($10.95) is really good. Huge sized burger and extremely juicy. It comes with a side of fries! Their garlic fries are my favorite. It is extremely garlicey so just a heads up. If you don't like garlic, obviously it isn't meant for you. Their mashed potatoes are really good too but you need to add a lot of salt to it. Onion rings are the thicker cut ones (my favorite style) and it's extremely crispy. Their shrimp tacos were a little disappointing to be honest. If you're going to get tacos, get their chicken ones. Those ones were amazing! I love the fish n chips here! ($11.95) Again their portioning sizes for everything are huge. I just thought it was a little heavy on the stomach. My favorite food wise is their pasta dishes. The portions are huge! The scampi ($13.95) was amazing. It has so much flavor in it. Perfectly cooked noodles as well. The seafood fra diavolo plate (18.95) is all over the place, but in a good way. There's so much going into this dish. You get your shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels in a huge plate. The sauce is a little spicy too, it adds such an amazing flavor. The scallops in that were my favorite! Their shrimp Alfredo (14.95) is my favorite dish here, but keep in mind that I haven't separately gotten oysters or clams yet. They actually put a good amount of shrimp in it, it's so cheesy and delicious. It's not as thick as most places make it but it's still a heavy dish. It comes with a piece of toast on it as well. Their french toast on their breakfast menu is amazing! You get that with ham, bacon, and sausage for just $5! It's well worth it and filling as well. I love their chicken fried steak and eggs. $6.95 for that. The steak is a little small but the gravy is perfectly seasoned. Honestly the prices are worth it for everything I've tried here.

All in all I love it here. The service is great no matter who it is, the food is definitely worth the prices! Has to be one of my favorite places to go.

Tried to give this bar another chance, and they found another way to make it even worse. We ordered two martinis other than taking a lot time to bring them they were a total joke, see picture. Never again, horrible service.

We have been here a few times, and the place has never let us down! Whether we have the crabs, a sandwich, or pasta, it has been delicious. We get the oysters On the Half-Shell every time we go! Good service, and decent prices

Dude WTF Guys.  You let me down. This place officially sucks.  Your oysters made me vomit, and the crab made my ass piss.  In the past I've had many a great experience, but the last couple times this has simply not been the case.  I didn't want to believe it at first when I found myself spewing chunks of rotten oyster flesh in to the toilet.  I thought eh I just got a bad batch.  So I gave them a second chance,"F*ck me right" I live less than two miles away and I found myself clenching my butt cheeks for dear life half way home. As I sat their, my ass securely suctioned to the toilet seat i vowed to never have another ass pissing experience at Shucks.  F you Dude. F you.

This used to be our favorite Friday night date place. Not so much anymore. 

Staffs speaks poorly about each other to the customers. 

Bread Bowls are ALWAYS burnt. ALWAYS. 
-Also happened to vomit mine back up 7 minutes after eating half of it. 

Calamari fell apart. It was not prepared before fried properly. 

Service is slower nowadays and the food overall has just gone WAY DOWNHILL. Very sad.
Always come here for late bite.  Service is super friendly all the time and foods great at a good price.

By far the best oysters ever.  They have great food and great dills.  The customer service is amazing and I would and have gone back plenty of times.  If your in the mood for a good sandwich or great oysters please visit this place.  It's a neighborhood place but so worth the visit.

Just not really my thing personally. 

Service is good, food is OK but nothing stellar. Price is about right. Came here a second time for their lamb but it tasted so-so this second go-around. 

The crab is alright, my sister-in-law seemed to enjoy it. 

The lunch size pastas is probably your best bet in terms of banging for your buck. Other than that, the fried shrimp platter -- not so much. Buffalo wings weren't bad, and neither is the tuna tartare...

Best part? Dessert.  Cookies and cream sandwich, Key lime pie, or the cheesecake eggroll.

I would come here again if I was asked to, but I don't think I'll ever be on the hunt for it. Again, just not my thing.

I just got done eating here and I was very impressed with the value.  They run a two for one hamburger special everyday Which is awesome.  
The burgers were good and not dry like at other places in town.
There beer and bar food selections were great also.  Would recommend to anyone on a budget

Great place to meet friends, have a conversation and enjoy a great meal.  We had a top notch dinner that would've been 3 times the price on the Strip.  I had the jambalaya pasta and carrot cake...delicious.  It's an oyster place (with smokin' horseradish sauce) and very fresh oysters) but wish there was fresh fish on the menu too.  Great choice for us...we'll be back.  (Restroom was clean and the health dept gives them an "A" with zero demerits.)

The food is gross. Probably a better sports bar--where you get wasted enough to eat their food. I gave it two stars because I went there hungry, so hungry I ate most of the lobster roll AKA imitation crab roll with a little sprinkle of lobster bits. It's an oyster bar that does not even have good oysters. I was hoping it would be a good small seafood restaurant, but no. But like I said, probably just a good sports bar.
Great bar, food is amazing for a seafood specialty bar. Pricing is great and their breakfast food / late night menu is great!!!
Good crab legs and fried shrimp! Didn't like the cole slaw, but over all I will be returning l!

Was not impress with this place. 

We were at Centennial Hospital awaiting for our sis in law to deliver our little bundle of joy, Rylan. We were all so famished I Yelped the area and found this place. seafood bar?! Uhh yaaaaas! 

Upon arriving I really had a good feeling about this place. Maybe I ordered wrong but I also had a taste of everyone's else dish and I wasn't impressed.

I ordered the Seafood pan roast. Okay, so I may be bias but I am IN LOVE with oyster bar pan roast so my exceptions were probably a little too high. But the flavors just didn't not go well. The soup had a sweet creamy taste to it that I didn't recognize. The seafood that was in it was just not up to par. Just basically lots of clams and a few fish chunks. The rice, I don't even know what kind of rice that was. It defiantly was not the typical rice I'm used to. 

My friend got the Gumbo. She never had gumbo before so she thought it was good. But the flavors just was really off. Even the waitress said she didn't really like the Gumbo. I agree with her. 

My other friend got the Philly cheesesteak and the meat came out extra dry. 

The beau got Steak and crabs. Now that was pretty good. I actually ate most of his crabs. I love crabs with extra lemon butter. That was amazing. The seasoning on the steak was different though, it had a Mexican feel to it kinda like carne asada. Wasn't bad just different. 

The drinks were ... Alright. My friend had to send her margarita back because it tasted like water. The 2nd margarita wasn't any better but she got it blended and didn't want to complain anymore. The waitress was pretty nice though very helpful. 

Reviews raved about the 1$ oysters... Unfortunately I don't eat oysters!

Another tasty Seafood Louie.  Never disappoints.  I will keep coming back :)    The Seafood seems very fresh, even though we are in Las Vegas

One more picture of my favorite salad

We've returned here for a good fish dinner many times, and we've never been disappointed.  I am a HUGE fan of their lobster sticks.  OMGawd, so tasy and perfectly cooked.  We also had the coconut shrimp skewers and calamari.  Equally delish!   The ambience is just perfect, no need to dress up or feel under dressed.  There is plenty of parking and always get seated right away.  On Tuesday nights, they have some sort of Painting Class on one half of the restaurant, which is a big draw for the ladies.  I've experienced this paint class thing at other restaurants, so it must be a trend.
All around good seafood well most times. Had a pound of crab but it was bits and pieces not happy tonight.

I will NEVER eat at Shucks again!

Arrived on a Saturday evening and took a seat at the side bar.

After being ignored or should I say not noticed for about ten minutes the bartender comes over and asked if I would like something to drink. I order a drink and take a look at the menu. I order my dinner, after the bartender takes my order she comes right back to verify she had it correct before it was entered into the computer. On one hand I appreciate that she wanted to input it correctly, but maybe she should have written it down. 

When my dinner is delivered it is delivered by someone from the kitchen who just puts a plate of food in front of me. No regard to if I would like anything else or if everything looks ok. The food was so, so. I had much better in the past. One step above Red Lobster.

After I finish, another fifteen minutes go by and I'm sitting with an empty plate and waiting for my check. My plate is removed and another ten minutes goes by before I'm given my check. Once my check arrives I pay in cash and have to wait another ten minutes before my change is returned. I was beginning to wonder if the bartender was going to assume that my change was a tip and never return it to me the customer. 

What upsets me the most is all the time I'm sitting at the bar area in front of the walk way in and out of the kitchen. People are constantly walking back and forth with no regard or level of service to their customers. From what I could observe, one bartender was on duty to service the entire main bar and side bar area alone. One wait person to service the restaurant and seating area solo again. One mediocre manager on duty who spent more time talking to a female customer than managing the operation. This so called manager did no managing, the tables are dirty, your customers are not being serviced in a timely manner. What do  you do other than flirt with female customers?

Their business must be suffering and trying to save money on payroll by understaffing the entire restaurant.  Your not saving money if your not servicing your customer properly and upsetting them to the point of not returning. 

Obviously, the only thing keeping this bar alive is the revenue from the video poker machines not the food or service.

Love this place.  Been eating here since 2010 but haven't been in about a year.  No special reason, just been busy.  Stopped by today on a whim and picked up seared tuna, crab stuffed tilapia, shrimp and rice and some raw oysters.

Wow, it was great.  All of it.  Especially the oysters, big and meaty.  Won't be a year before we go back! Thanks Shucks, good job.

This place is within walking distance to my new place so of course I had to give it a try :-) I'm so glad I did! The food is good...I mean I was shocked how yummy the bar food was! A million tv's to watch whatever sport game thats on....fyi it's all about the bears in here though. I kinda only really care about watching the SF Giants play baseball, niner fan by default...but football I really watch for kicks and giggles no real loyalty so I'm not offended at the all Bears stuff ;-) 

Anyways back to my point...the food is wonderful! The food is good, prices are great and well, they remembered us when we come back :-) and I have a soft spot for any place that remembers their repeat customers...as we left they even offered us a water bottle to go :-) Kudos people! Love the place, love I can walk to it, love I can chill have some drinks and walk my bum back home :-)

We were craving for oysters and wanted to try them out at shucks. Not the kind of seafood restaurant I was looking for, but we still give it a shot. The place is kinda old and smell like rotten towel. The server was nice and friendly though. We went on a Sat and they were having a Sat deal on the clam bake for 21.95 (original price is 26.95). We also ordered a dozen of oysters and they were just okay.  The clam was huge, had at least 20 clams, 5 crab legs, spicy sausages, corn, and potatoes.  They were delicious, especially the clams. The clams were so juicy and meaty. We could hardly finish all the seafood they packed into the bowl. We left most of the potatoes and corn untouched. If we knew the clam bake is that big, we probably would not have ordered the oysters.

Good service Mickey and Larry are two of the best bartenders/servers in Las Vegas! If you like good seafood I recomend this place over Joe's Crab Shack anyday. Their fresh shrimp appetizers and sauce rule and the mahi mahi tacos are real delicious. Keep in mind they can blacken any food you like. I have literally seen people partyin and having a good time here then eat some nachos then fall into a food coma right after they finished their beer and meal. I travel for a living and this place is right off the freeway on my way home from McCarran Airport and it is the place I always stop for a good meal. Also like to mention a very mix class of people that go here. I have seen retired couples to biker groups and night club promoters at this place. It's nice check it out.

Been here a few times. We like tavern-like atmosphere and the bar area is pretty cool. Very good service tonight. We had the crab cake app and they seem like the frozen ones u can buy at the store, but they were fried nicely. Presentation was very nice. The crab cake sauce and the cole slaw were really good. I ordered a 1/2 dozen of raw oysters and had to ask for saltines because they had a strong, fishy taste. Tried them with the crackers but they were still way too fishy to enjoy. Like 'bad seafood' fishy. Tried my best but couldn't finish them. Got a little nervous. I've had my fair share of oysters for almost 30 years in Louisiana and I've never had a strong, 'not good' fishy flavor experience like that. I was let down. It could possibly be that they were frozen when they weren't fresh and defrosted, or the fact that they just might not have been fresh tonight. Not sure. Might have been an off night or just a fluke thing. Hubby had the fried shrimp basket with fries. The shrimp were ok. I guess we're spoiled with good gulf shrimp and authentic fried seafood platters. The french fries and cocktail sauce were really good. 

Going back to the other times we went.. 
The first time, I had the gumbo. It wasn't authentic or tasty and I didn't finish that either. Took a few bites and was done. It might be good to someone who hasn't had La. gumbo before or someone who likes the boxed/bagged gumbo mix flavor, but it's not for me. The second time we went, I had the fried oyster poboy and it was good. The poboy bread was nice from what I can remember. I'm pretty sure it was on french bread. I just remember liking it. Hubby had the shucks burger and he enjoyed it. It was filling and tasty. 

We'll probably be back for the atmosphere, drinks and maybe I'll try the Oysters Rockefeller or the baked New Orleans oysters. Might also try something recommended on Yelp. Won't have the jambalaya because we're used to authentic cajun jambalaya and authentic creole jambalaya.. but to some it might be really good. Overall, not bad. Just have to figure out what floats your boat at a place like this.

A trip back in time for me.  Nearly 10 years to the day my friend and I are back at Shucks.  We used to live up the street and this was our goto spot for some VP, beer and food.  Is it me or is this place now smoke-free?  If that is the case...THANK YOU !

I had the Mahi Mahi tacos and they were outstanding!  There must have been half a pound of mahi mahi in those two tacos...OK I'm likely exaggerating and clearly didn't have a scale with me but those things were stuffed full of nice quality fish. I'd venture back up here just for those tacos. Bar service was a little slow but once things got rolling with the food and the comp'd beers they had it all dialed in. Glad to see you guys are still around...keep up the good work and quality food.

Stopped by today for lunch after deciding against Krazy Sushi and I have to say it was a GREAT decision. It was a little pricey but everything was so good! Started with oysters on the half shell... They were perfect! The had the chose 4 and did x2 on the peel and eat shrimp, the Rockefeller oysters, and the calamari. Everything was great! The calamari had just the right amount of breading to not be overbearing and was fried perfectly! My lunch was so yummy!

FUN SPOT!!!
Met some friends after work, and we had pretty good apps and food.
I could totally see going here and just having fresh seafood apps - Oysters, Crab Cocktail, peel & eat shrimp. MMMMMMMM

We did have a plate of oysters, and they were fresh and yummy. Also ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp. They were good, a TINY bit on the dry side. Fried Calamari was OK. The steamed garlic muscles were great, whish it had come with some toast points for the broth.

On the night we went, it was $3 taco night. I ordered 3 tacos. They were completely fine, definitely not amazing. My friends ordered pasta dishes (Vodka Scallops and Shrimp Scampi) and really liked them!

I discovered that Friday is $5 app night! I think next time I am going to hit it and just stick to the apps and fresh seafood. That seems to be the key here.

BUT- Saturdays is 2-for-$20 Pasta Night, so you may be inspired to go try the pastas that my friends loved!

Either way, the room is fun and rustic, the staff was super friendly, and we had a blast socializing! Just wish the food was a bit better.

Many years ago we were at this restaurant and did not find it good enough for a return visit. A few months ago we ate at the Shucks on Flamingo and it was delicious so when our friends suggesting having dinner here on Saturday we were really looking forward to it. Unfortunately this one on Durango is not as good as their other one.

We ordered the New Orleans Oysters which we had also had at their other restaurant but these were not nearly as good. My husband had blackened catfish and I had the clams appetizer and we both found our meals very bland. 

Our friends had the fish fry and they enjoyed their meals.

If we were to try it again we would go back to the one on Flamingo.

We were on vacation in New Orleans in November and this place has a very large and very varied menu including many of the things we had in The Big Easy.  We started with Orleans Style Oysters baked with garlic butter and parmesan cheese and they were almost as good as the ones we had in New Orleans.  Then my husband had New England clam chowder in a bread bowl while I just had a cup of soup.  It was very tasty but could have had a little more clams.  Then we shared linguini and clams in a white wine sauce which they split for us and each of our portions was tremendous.  My husband really enjoyed it as I did but I thought the pasta was a little to soft (I like my pasta al dente).

Will definitely be back here as I would like to try something from the Bucket List

I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at Shucks. I'm from New England, and it's certainly difficult to find decent seafood joints in Las Vegas. This place has a good feeling, local dive, but clean. The service has always been friendly. I usually go for cold oysters and beer/wine, but definitely enjoy other selections. The stuffed shrimp appetizer is very good, I often find myself scraping the dish for the last of the mushrooms and rice/butter. Crab legs are fun, and this is the first place I've ever eaten dungeness crab, pretty good! I only wish they had Alaskan King crab! The mix and match of cold/hot plates is always a great idea if you can't decide and feel like sharing, too. This is my go-to seafood bar :-)

I love this place...even knowing that they're a Dallas Cowboys bar.

Their food is amazing, their prices are more than reasonable, their drinks are fresh and tasty and I've never had bad service from their staff.  I highly recommend this place as a seafood dive with a great bar and sports atmosphere.

Holy tamale batman.  Their combo plate is gargantuous.  You should have a few people to share it with.  The lobster fingers are melt in your mouth scrum-dilly-umptious.  The clam strips were pretty sandy and I coudn't really eat many of em.

Even though I'm reviewing the one on N Durango - my kickball team is sponsored by the one on Flamingo/215 and they have super yummy crab stuffed shrimp and good beer specials.  :)

Still so good, we ate there twice in three days. Lobster roll with lots of lobster salad - light, not gooey - with a little lettuce on a great sub roll. Tater tots and garlic fries (ask for them; I didn't see them listed on the menu). Oysters rockefeller which all oyster lovers will appreciate. Snow crab sold by weight. Delicious seafood pasta. We could not have been happier!

We've loved Shucks for a long time at the other location (and also the location that closed a few years back). About the Durango location, I can add they bend over backward to please the customers! 

We had a marvelous lunch. As starters, we shared a bowl of their fantastic, peppery, creamy clam chowder with lots of chunks of clam and a good clam flavor. Next, oysters Rockefeller -- a delicacy you can't get many places. Add a splash of lemon and enjoy. The shrimp cocktail contained seven huge, fresh, delectable shrimp with a very pleasant cocktail sauce. 

The Big Mothershucker (yes, you read that right) is perhaps the best burger you will ever eat. Share it unless you are insanely hungry -- it contains a full pound of hamburger plus much more. The combination of ingredients is so good! 

On top of all this deliciousness, the item that blew me away this time  was garlic fries. At last, a place that realizes garlic is not a word to be whispered delicately, but an elation to be freely enjoyed! The garlic was delicious even on its own. The fries were fantastic. How do they do it? What a meal. 

As if that were not enough, Monday is $2 domestic draft day. There are different special items every day. They've also got great pasta, crabcakes, all sorts of crab, shrimp, oh man. If seafood is your thing, this is the place. If seafood is not your thing, this is still the place!

We ate here yesterday and everything was fantastic. Our server was Nicki and she was awesome. She was friendly, personable, and recommended items that turned out to be excellent. They have a really cheap priced kids menu (you have to ask about it). My son had chicken fingers and fries. They have like 4 different French fry options. My hubster loves oysters and she recommended we come back for the dollar oysters on Thursdays. I had the ginger soy scallops with baby bok choy and rice, hubby had 1/2 dozen Texas oysters (steamed with tequila, lime & Tabasco), the lobster roll with waffle fries and 2 oyster shooters.   We plan to go back kid free and sit at the bar once college and NFL sports season begins.

Food is awesome. 
We had the crab legs, ginger scallops and the crab spinach dip (mediocre) 

The late night bar tender was horrible. Inattentive, slow, unhelpful.

We went in and he was less than inviting. But I was stuck on getting my grub on. 

We spent about 2 hours or more at this location and I was able to get a complete observation of this bartender and the impact he's having on late night business. You should really consider hiring someone with more personality! It will go a long way! 

Also, I may be a little bias because we have our spots and they take care of us, but after 6 drinks and 2 shots you would think two good looking females could get SOMETHING comped. Like maybe a bottle of water? But he charged us for that too. I mean, I get it, we pay for what we order, but we had to order the water twice. So there's that. I don't care how that sounds.

Bottom line you need a friendly bartender because this guy is bad for business. He didn't chat to any of the customers, he left our food in front of us for a half hour after we were finished. He didn't ask us if we wanted refills. 

Nexxxxxxt bar!!!

This place is amazing! I don't post unless I receive extraordinarily good service/food or extraordinarily bad service/ food or whatever it may be. Therefore I post very infrequently. Shucks is where I always go when I get a craving for seafood or any kind of fish. Their food has never disappointed. However tonight stands out and I have to post. I live approximately 10 miles away. When I arrived I told the bartender Brooke, that I wanted to get some food to go and a drink while I was waiting. And then I realized that I had forgotten my wallet. I informed Brooke of my dilemma. I have never met her before and I am probably more than twice her age. She told me to order what I wanted and she would cover me until I got home and called her back with my card info so I wouldn't have to drive all the way back to pay! Now who does that? Thank you Brooke! Great service, great food, five stars!
Great seafood, inexpensive, with great service. Now to the down side, very smokey   even in the dining side, also very busy on the weekends. Will definitely still go back.

First time trying Shucks and unfortunately will never be returning. Now I can not speak for the bar service as my experience was in the sit down family portion. 

When we arrived it was seat yourself. We sat for about 5 minutes with many servers on the floor and no one came up to us. We were next to the hostesses table so we ended up grabbing our own menus after a couple more minutes of waiting. Finally someone came up after about 10 minutes to see if we had been helped. The first person we encountered asked if the "two" of us wanted to order our drinks. Never once asking about a drink for our 3 year old daughter (I guess she was invisible). Next we had a different server come take our order. No personality what so ever and very unpleasant. No smile, nothing. You could tell she was not in a good mood. Other than one other time it was the only time we saw her our whole meal. When done our meal we waited for the waitress to bring our check. There was not one person on the floor at this point (no clue where they all went). Finally after waiting some more we grabbed a bus boy and asked him to find our waitress so we could get the check. ** I will say the two bus boys we encountered during our meal were very nice! Too bad they were not waiters. They could teach that waitress a lesson in having a better personality. 

My boyfriend and daughter enjoyed their food. I got steak nachos, but something about the steak tasted weird so I ended up picking it all off. At that point I wasn't about to complain and wait for a new meal. While most the food we had was good it was nothing special to make me want to come back after the service I experienced. 

Now granted I know people have bad days, but unfortunately when your tip relies on giving your guests a good experience you need to learn to put that behind you. We did leave her a small tip as she did at least take our order, but that is all the tip covered.
 ** Just to be clear, per in the response below, as I don't think it was, we did not tip our waitress poorly due to slow service (that was just part of the review). It was her poor attitude and the experience she provided us that earned her her tip. Food and and food wait times are the restaurants doing, and we understand that. The experience and personality are all on the waiter/waitress.

Shucks is a solid place and always has been ( since i first went in 2007) I havent been to this location though, and to my surprise it was quality all around. Thursday happy hour 1$ oysters are a great deal although I must say, whoever shucked them, did so upside down... smh. Meaning the oyster was served on the flat (lid ) side of the oyster rather then the cup like side so there was no place for the oyster liquor (natural tasty broth) to go. Besides that I ordered a fried oyster po'boy and criss cut fries that were more then ample, served quickly and cooked to perfection. If you find yourself having an oyster fix one of these nights, i would for sure hit this place up. I mean, some times you just want a pint and some oysters after a late night, ya know? Well, i know I do.

I loved coming to shucks. Their food is amazing and drinks are strong. Well my friend and I spent three hours at Shucks eating and drinking. Had a great time the service was on point, our waiter was personable and funny,we had no problems. Well we went to go get our nails done and get boba. Before we left the plaza we thought well let's get our family some food to go, since the food was really good. We walked in and sat at the bar to get a quick to go order. We were handed a menu and told the server would be right with us. Then we waited and waited as a group of servers and management ignored us. No server ever came. Well as we were ready to storm out, pissed off from being ignored by the bar staff, victor came and saved the day. He took our order and apologized for the other staff. Who by the way were still ignoring us and walking by with out checking on us. I don't know if the staff was upset  because we had outside boba drinks with us or what. But being treated like second class citizens is not my thing. Victor the server is amazing and the only reason we stayed and placed a second order. But everyone else well they were jerks the second time around. I'll never  go back to Shucks or recommend this restaurant. And yes I got loud and made super snide comments and was still ignored. Bye forever lobster bites. Visit date 7/22/2016

Service has a lot to be desired. If you like being ignored at the bar then you'll like it here. My boyfriend had crab cakes which he described as "gross cakes". Just ordered oysters Rockefeller one if my favorites! But at this "oyster bar" the oysters were the worst part I only ate 2 and finished the lackluster spinach due to extreme hunger just plain eww. 

I've been here before and ordered a spinach dip that was so cold in the middle I had to return it so they could heat it up, it wasn't any better warm though. This place has just been such a huge disappointment. It's walking distance from my house but I would rather drive to a bar that has better food and service. Sorry not sorry.

Gave this place another try and yet again was a huge BUST! Started with the appetizer Crab and Spinach Dip... TASTELESS is an understatement. Decided to try there "Friday Fish Fry special" and the fish was a total soggy mess. Literally falling apart and dripping with grease. I explained to the waiter my dissatisfaction and returned the plate. I was still charged for the meal even after returning the uneaten excuse for a meal. Never again

Good place to get shucked up! The Shucks burger is great, crabs legs are just OK but the rest of the menu is legit. The atmosphere is pretty much standard for a bar, the lighting is just right for a relaxed atmosphere. Bartenders are always quick with an order and there is little to no waiting. This place is great!

What a pleasant surprise to find this jewel in our backyard!  Had it not been for Yelp and all the reviews, we would still be looking for a good local fish house. The menu is terrific offering something for everyone!  Oysters, shrimp, halibut, cod, clams, crab, etc. All cooked as you like!  I had fish and chips, my husband had fried oysters, and we ordered an appetizer of fried clams. Oh, so good!  And, enough left over for lunch the next day!  Our server was so friendly and accommodating - she really made us feel welcome!  I can't wait to go back to our new "regular" fish house!

Seriously, this place has an awesome cook! I try the fish and chips and my gosh orgasmic ;) so fresh and perfectly crispy. Also tried two tacos mahi and shrimp and guess what sooooo freakin bomb. I'm still craving that stuff in my mouth. And of course it's midnight and what do you do at midnight at shucks you may ask!!?? You attack the shit out of the $1 oysters raw or rocker fella oh em gee awesome !! 
Btw the steak is delish just saying steak n eggs babay! Lol

The atmosphere is decent: however, everywhere you sit you can see right in to the kitchen.  The food portions were a good size and the food temperature was hot.  The taste was average.  The service was good and accommodating.
Yummy crab legs at great prices!! I thought the oysters were a little slimy but my hubs loved them!

Service was excellent!!.  Oysters, not so.

We went there for oysters (table for 10).  One of my friends said they should drop the "h" out of their name.  The oyster's had zero "oyster liquor" in them.  Usaully a sign of not so fresh oysters.  They didn't have a "mignonette" sauce for the oysters or even know what it was when asked.  Other food was good to most of our party.  Below is a link to a simple mignotte recipe.

http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Mignonette-Sauce-15405

The front of this restaurant faces a parking lot, with the back facing the road, so you have to be paying attention to find it. Once inside, it reads like a typical sports bar - smokey, lots of TVs, with half of the interior taken up by a dining area with some booths and low tables. The menu is EXTENSIVE. Usually not a great sign, but the food we got was acceptable. I had the Shuck's salad, which has a little piece of tuna, two shrimp, and a tiny scoop of crabmeat on a romaine salad with a vinaigrette dressing.
