It also came with a piece of cheesy texas toast on the salad which wasn't my thing. We also ordered the crab cakes, which in my opinion were small for the price. They tasted fine though, and the two came with a small salad of slaw in between them on the serving plate. No one got sick, extra point for that. My soda didn't ever get refilled though, so that was a minus. 

They have specials which are listed as you walk in, mostly things like X for half price on Tuesdays kind of thing. They also have rotating daily specials on a board inside the door. Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but if I am in the area in the future and have deemed all other options less desirable, I might come back to try the crab legs since that seemed to be the most raved about menu item. Maybe I'm just not that used to eating in a bar where people are smoking and my server doesn't refill my drink, but given that, the food was just fine.

Solid performer. We find ourselves visiting for happy hour on Friday to take advantage of half-price martinis and $5 appetizers. The clam strips are 4-star or better, and the peel-and-eat shrimp are plump, firm, sweet and meaty. Perfect bar food. 

Wife loves the Lemon Drop martini and Mandarin Orange Cosmo. I made the mistake of ordering a 'real' vodka martini only to receive a glass full of well vodka, no detectable vermouth, and two olives. Had it been a decent vodka I would likely praise it, but it wasn't so I won't. .

The two problems I have with Shucks are the uninspired dining room (just an afterthought it appears) and the smokers in the bar.  Obviously a local hangout, and most are smokers. The ventilation cannot cope with the smoke; it's not like a haze hangs in the air but you can definitely smell cigarettes while anywhere at the bar.   You can move to the dining room to escape the smokers, but the dining room is the opposite of special or cozy and lacks ambiance of any variety.

Didn't go for their beer and didn't go for their oysters. 

After some strenuous exercise at the climbing gym, a few of us were hungry. But we're poor so we needed something cheap. And then my friend suggested Taco Tuesdays at Shucks! 

The place is pretty large with ample seating. It was pretty empty on a Tuesday night. Eerily quiet. We took our seats at a large table. Our server was quick to take our orders. 

A plate of two tacos usually run around $10. But each taco was $3 in which you can choose from shrimp, grilled mahi-mahi or your regular fried fish. We each got two tacos - the mahi-mahi and the regular fish taco. Food came out pretty quick. The tacos were pretty big, I thought they were going to be a lot smaller like the usual authentic 3-bite tacos. The plate also came with colorful chips and yummy salsa. Both tacos definitely hit the spot. Wasn't greasy or too heavy. 

I had to flag down our server for some more salsa and a refill for water. I was a tad disappointed because the place was so empty and I shouldn't be playing find-our-waiter when we were the only customers there. 

I took a peek at the rest of the menu. It seems a little bit on the pricey side. Maybe I'll come back next time to try their oysters. But for what they're charging, they better be amazing!

This place is right next to my house. And I decided to try them. 
Pros: The service was good. They were willing to make me the drink off the menu, food was served fast. 
Cons: 
The raw oyster was not fresh at all, they smelled really bad and tasted fishy. This is kinda disappointing for a oyster bar. 
And Therefore, their oyster shooter wasn't good. 
The next thing we ordered was steamed clams. And again, they weren't great. I've had clams from different places and none of them were that fishy. 
For all reason above, I wouldn't recommend Shuck to nobody.
Great friendly staff. The crowd feels very neighbohood, as if they all know each other. Everyone is very welcoming and chatty. Not sure about the food, but bar atmosphere is great.

Neighborhood bar with AMAZING food.  Don't go to the "other" fake freash seafood places.  This one is the real deal. Never had a bad meal here. The drinks are always perfect. Try the appletini. We even go here for breakfast since Vegas has a hard time figuring out a place for breakfast that stays consistant.   You won't be sorry. We love this bar.

This place is awesome! Came here after work for some drinks, food and to watch some games. My friend and I both ordered a cup of clam chowder. It was really good. For food, I got the lobster salad sandwich with TATER TOTS. (Yay for tots!) My friend ordered the Philly cheesesteak sandwich with thin fries. The fries were regular sized, not 'thin'. Both sandwiches were good and  big in size. I took most of mine home with my friend's fries since we both ate my tater tots. 
The service was awesome. All the servers were cool. It was awesome I ran into a bunch of my friends here, all here for the same reason!

My husband and I only come here for breakfast. It's inexpensive and the quality is pretty good. The ONLY issue is one of the waitresses, her attitude is awful! Not sure if she's just not a morning person or just not a people person. Not to mention she's super slow and forgetful even when no one else is in there.
We've tried to sit up at the bar when we go just to make sure we get helped by someone else. Other than her, everything else is pretty good!
I love the food not only that, great service, and the bartender Sean dose a really great job, I do like that you have to buzz in after hours. Plus it is open 247.

Was here again during a Bear's game. I mentioned in my last review that I didn't care for their raw oysters--they didn't taste very fresh. Well, put those babies in a shooter with some vodka and bloody Mary mix and they are not bad at all. They are normally $5 but during Bear's games they're only $2.

The seafood here is very good, but the dish you really need to try is the black and blue salad. I'm not usually much for salad but this one blows me away. Romaine lettuce, grilled and sliced steak, blue cheese crumbles, onion straws and sun dried tomatoes make this one of the best salads I've ever had. Service is acceptable, food is very good.

Ehhh.  I checked out this place because several of my friends told me how great it was.  It was just okay.  Had the crab stuffed tallipia with wild rice and veggies.  A little greasy for my taste.  My husband had the pulled pork and waffle fries - he enjoyed his non-seafood better than I enjoyed mine.  The atmosphere was okay, the staff was friendly, prices were fair, but the food was not the best I've had.

I must say I was rather impressed. I talked this place up to a couple of co-workers and they were not disappointed at all. The breakfast specials are great on the wallet and good for the belly. Great eats at a great price. The service was top notch and the food was out in a flash. I got the chicken fried steak, complete with eggs, potatoes and just enough gravy. They've extended the time of their breakfast special, so you've got plenty of time to get there and enjoy. I will definitely return.  It's time for libations and oysters.

I first learned of Shuck's a couple of years ago after a friend told me about their fantastically inexpensive breakfast specials. Until now I had only visited the Flamingo/215 location and only for breakfast. When looking for place for the midday meal, the Mrs. and I opted for Shuck's. The only disappointment here is that I hadn't previously tried their lunch menu. They have a burger called the Mother Shucker that features a full pound of beef.  I opted for the smaller version or the "Baby Mother." It came with fries (you can get garlic fries) and I added a side salad. The side salad was one the larger ones I've seen and featured red leaf lettuce, tomato and onion. Even the Baby Mother was huge and some kind of tasty. The waitress, Ashley, was very friendly and attentive, offering her advice on which fried fish the Mrs. should get. Good call on the Haddock Ashley. It was fresh and crisp, complete with garlic fries. I left stuffed like a Thanksgiving Turkey, with a smile on my face. Next time I'll attempt the Mother Shucker.

It's really dropped off here. I normally come in Thursday night for oysters. The last two times the food has made me sick. The little bartender has the worst customer service ever. The silver lining is the server Jose who always remembers what you like and is very attentive. They are barely even comping play now or maybe it's just this bartender. Unfortunately not sure I can come back after all this time.

My boyfriend keeps reminding me that you have to review a place for what it is.  Meaning, I can't review Shucks Tavern next to Sage restaurant.  

With that said, for a 24 hour gaming bar with an oyster bar attached this is top notch.  The seafood was all super fresh.  The boy ordered clam strips and a crab bucket.  Both were delicious and fresh.  I had the fish tacos, heavy on the cabbage, but I like cabbage.  It was a celebratory dinner so we had carrot cake and it was flavorful and moist.  The service was great and the drink specials were good for a Friday night (half price martinis?  Yes please!).  

We would definitely go back, especially since the boy often gets a craving for crab.

I'm updating this review because as of recent and since the general manager reached out I have received great service once again. 

Like I said my boyfriend and I come here a lot and I was super let down after an employee refused me the night's special because he was busy (there was one other person sitting at the bar) however, oscar, nick, anthony, and karina have always given good service and still continue to do so. 

It's refreshing to see them any time we come in. 
Thank you for reaching out!

My wife and I recently moved into the area and haven't had a chance to hit up the grocery store. She has been craving Clam Chowda ( east coasters :)  and i just happened to come across the menu for this place and saw they had it.  Wife yelled SOLD!  

Walking in , its the normal bar , tv screens tables and booths. 
It was a little grungy in there , but nothing i havent seen before. 

They have a decent amount of beers on tap , i ordered a New Castle , the wife had a Coors light ( EWWW ).

Ordered up a cup and bowl of clam chowda ! ,  it was very thick , had the right amount of clam to potato and veggie ratio and was very tasty.   

Out came the rest of the food.  My wife ordered the Boston Cod Sandwhich. Its basically a upscale McDonald fish fillet , but was outstanding.  Had alot of flavor and the fish , didn't taste fishy.  I ordered the Fish Fry .. and man was i in for a treat. I had a HUGE plate of fried haddock which was extremely flavorful and tender\moist.  I enjoyed it completely.   

They have alot of non fried light choices on the menu such as crab stuffed tilapia.  We will definitely be back to try these !. 

Try it , you wont be disappointed.

I am a real oyster lover. Like, LOVE LOVE LOVE oysters. Ask my Yelp companion Tetsuro P. I can pack those suckers away. I can eat a bunch of them in one sitting. Often times, I have joked about how I should do a competitive eating contest. I think I could take the women's oyster trophy home. But that's a whole other review.

I have always called T.P. up and asked to join me for oysters. He usually says yes, so I guess that makes us "oyster buddies." Mind you, I usually make this decision VERY late at night (or early in the morning, depending on how you view it). I think it's cool that even though he's not as big of an oyster fan as I am, he still comes along.

The main reason for this (besides the LOVELY company, lol) is the HAPPY HOUR here. It starts late at night (I think maybe 11 or midnight, not 100% sure), but it's worth it!! All the raw oysters are $1!!! Many appetizers are between $3 and $6!! I can eat my fill of oysters, and not go broke! It's heaven for me.

The bartender who is usually working late is a pretty cool guy, and both he and the older cook in the back now remember us. One time, the cook even came out to deliver my oysters! I guess he had  to see me for himself. He was probably expecting some huge, obese chick, based on how many I always order LOL!

I have never been here during the day, but they have a full menu and serve lots of other things besides oysters. So far, everything I have had here has been pretty decent.

Absolutely disgusting. I went years ago and haven't been back since. It's gross food for the price you pay, it was dirty, and service was absolutely awful. I'm surprised the place hasn't closed down because it's been such a long time, and the experience sucks. Don't go here unless you went here when it was new and grew up on it, then I can't blame you. But definitely not a good spot in my books.

Really good place to enjoy some good eats that won't break the bank.  We got the Mother Shucker and it was freakin huge!!  The burger was a full pound stuffed with cheese,bacon, and mushroom.      Alps I on tap were the garlic ginger scallops that my wife said were tasty!  Our total bill for this feast was only $32.  Definitely will be back.
Great seafood Louie salad!  Happy hour 5 for $5 is solid.  Mussels portion was huge for$5. Service was attentive
I ordered 1/2 lb of Crablegs with a bowl of clam chowder with calamari for an appetizer...and the food was awesome!  I should have came here a long time ago!
Great food, great service.  Only thing I wish is that they wouldn't allow smoking, but that's every Vegas bar.

I am a local that works in the Vegas industry.  I come here after work to have oysters and great drinks with Larry (the best bartender).  He takes care of my friends and I all the time!  If you want great food and great service with awesome drinks, come see Larry!  Graveyard shift!  Oh ya baby!

I stopped in around 11 pm on a Saturday for a bite to eat. I didn't realize that you had to be buzzed in. That's a bit creepy. Once inside I found the place dead with a cluster of waitresses and bartenders huddled off to the side joking around.

 I took a seat at the bar. After a few minutes the bartender tore herself away from her personal conversation to wait on me.  Even after that, the service was slow. The bartender seems miserable to there. She was equally as morose with the few other bar patrons. After going over the menu I asked her opinion on some choices I had narrowed down. Her menu knowledge left much to be desired. I settled on the oysters. They are terribly small and poorly shucked. 

The reason I have this place 2 stars instead of 1 is because it has potential but like many other Yelpers have stated, the service needs improved.

Alright, so I came here sometime around May of this year and it was alright. On my first visit, I had the rockafella oysters which I believe triggered my allergic reaction to shellfish. We sat at the bar and I had a lot of beer to drink... good times.

I ordered some chicken- type sandwich on my following visit which by the way was humongous and I was unable to finish it. Now this place is located in North Las Vegas so it's more of a hangout spot for the locals, there's nothing fancy or fantastic about it.

As a sports bar or a seafood joint, I'll admit Shucks is on the average side.

The only reason my family and I go here is for the breakfast deals (served until 1pm most days). You can truly high quality bar-food breakfasts here for $5. Pancakes, potatoes, chicken fried steak, benedicts...all really good. You will spend more on half the amount of food at any fast food chain.

I have older in-laws who wouldn't otherwise step foot in a bar, but love Shucks, and at the low price, you can take a bunch of folks out without breaking the bank and enjoy the Sunday morning NFL game while you munch away your hangover.

Hurry up and open Distill!!! I used to love the place. (see previous reviews) but they are starting to get weird with the regs. we used to play and play, be served drinks and served some more drinks, suddenly today we get Sh***y attitude from our ex fave bar tender and told we have to now pay for cognac. Meanwhile others at the bar yapping all afternoon served with no problem.  we play at least 100 + and are told we now have to pay $10.00 per shot? when did that crap start? oh it's been always. nope! we used to be comped food and drinks and now they are becoming Timbers. ok. well if I put $20 in the machine multiple times give me two shots a pop. they are starting to suck service wise and I'll lose my money elsewhere because the machines suck as well!

took my mom to dinner, she wanted cab legs. have not been here in about 3 years.
I forgot how small the menu was, the portions were tiny, granted we ended up getting 2 appetizers; spinach & crab dip (no crab I could see or taste!) and stuffed shrimp (4) smallish shrimp stuffed with seasoned bread crumbs(and again not a hint of crab that I could discern). There also was a misunderstanding regarding a order of guacamole, for $ 2.95 I expected chips, not a side serving which was a good size. I was told by the waiter that people order it to add to their sandwiches, it was a lot of guac for that. the chips he brought were another $ 2.95 which I was surprised to see on the bill. I used to come here 4-5 times a year when I lived near by and was always satisfied but since moving back in the area, this was a huge disappointment. Small menu, small portions (except the guac!) bland taste very poor value. I hope this was just an off night for Shucks. (I did mention to the waiter about the guac and chips, I did tell him in the end not to worry but he was not very forth coming or apologetic a good waiter would gotten a manager or taken the chips off the bill, I deal with the public in the hotel industry and some thing of this nature would have been done regardless of my wishes).
Decent food with a fair price, nice and roomy inside the tavern

We love Shucks Tavern. The food is great, they are open late and it's never overly crowded. From salads and chicken fingers to big juicy burgers and lamb chops, Shucks never gets it wrong. Food and wait staff are fantastic. We highly recommend this place!
Have been here many many times and we love this place as it open 24/7 great fresh and juicy food, great selection of liquors and pretty comfortable.

First off, the food is amazing and fresh.. Me being a seafood lover, almost everything on the menu is great!... But that's not even the half of it. I've come here a few times and always loved it; but tonight was THE WORST Customer Service I have ever had in my entire life. The Blonde female bartender was nice and personable. The male brunette older, grumpy heavy-set bartender, Sean, had no personality what-so-ever and came to check on us only to reply in an irritated tone. HE NEEDS TO BE FIRED ASAP! This is not a joke. He decided to scam our bill, as to hope we didn't notice, and charge us for extra drinks as we were already actively playing the machines. We decided to tell the gentleman the problem and he insisted he was right in his actions. Now me, being in the food and beverage industry, instantly noticed his lack of motivation and enthusiasm already, as he watched sports, but still gave him the benefit of the doubt... At first. As we argued about the bill he got very offensive and unprofessional yelling inside the restaurant trying to force us to leave. I will NEVER come back to this restaurant again because of the most terrible service I've ever had in my life. Do Not Come Here! SEAN IS THE RUDEST BARTENDER AND WILL GET IN YOUR FACE TO PROVE A POINT.... TO A CUSTOMER. Beware

Made a return trip this weekend and wished I hadn't.  My complaint isn't for the food but the service.  Waitress took our order and disappeared.  Although she made stops at the table next to us, it  was like we didn't exist.   We flagged her down once and then luckily were able to get the attention of another server in the restaurant for drinks, etc.   It made for a very unpleasant dining experience especially since it was my suggestion. And I should add that in no way was this place busy at all.

Not very impressed. Had a clam bake, it was over cooked and not well seasoned. Soup was bad/too watery or salty. Calamari was over cooked. Oysters were ok, but that is hard to mess up. The server was nice, but the food needs some serious work.

I'm just not impressed with this place. The non smoking section smells like smoke and the oysters are sub par. I don't think we'll come again.  We've tried this place twice because it is so close. I'm not impressed with the cleanliness or the service for that matter.  I do not recommend this place.

Every month I get a ravenous craving for fish, especially oysters!!! My boyfriend and I were originally headed to the oyster bar inside palace station, but the wait was easily 2 hours... minimum! I certainly had no time for that, especially with my mood swings, so we decided to head to shucks.

Upon arrival, I was a bit concerned since the ambience was pretty dark and loud since there was a party of about 20 rowdy folks and about a few people at the bar. It's self seating so we sat by the bar since we'd probably get faster service and I was right. We had an awesome hostess that recommended specials and was prompt when we needed her. Here's what we ordered:    
   
2 dozen oysters
Fish n chips
Lobster roll
Bloody Mary
Blue moon

Oysters -were pretty fresh and had to stop myself before I ate all 24.
Fish and chips- beer battered cod was crispy, not oily, and perfect seasoning; the fries were on the flimsy side and skinny, but still nicely seasoned
Lobster roll- wasn't what I expected. I thought there'd be chunks of lobster, but instead looked like crab meat. The bun was nicely toasted and overall had a nice taste. My boyfriend doesn't like celery, and the roll had lots of it, but whether he was just too hungry or not, he still enjoyed the roll.
Bloody Mary- had the perfect amount of spice, and blue moon.. Well it's a blue moon.

Overall, I enjoyed the food and staff and will definitely return for the oysters and fish and chips. The prices are generous too, but will definitely return for those $1 oyster Thursday special!!!

Came here since it was close to our house and pretty late...
Got our usual Lamb Lollipops with the Honey Basil Sauce, Clam Strips
and instead of Raw Oysters, I wanted to try Their Oysters Rockefeller....I should've read the description because they tasted like pizza with spinach and melted cheese on top, tasted okay, but I like my oysters with hollandaise instead of melted cheese. thats how I've eaten Oysters Rockefeller.....my bad for not reading the description thinking everyone else prepares it the same way.

we also got the fried cheesecake chimichanga and chocolate mousse cake which were okay. Next time I'll stick tothe raw oysters...ALOHA!!!

Guess I was wanting more. The service was great here, attentive, kind and he packaged our food that we couldn't finish with condiments and plastic utensils. Better than some fancy restaurants. 

The raw oysters were medium size but fresh. They came with all the right condiments, hot sauce, cocktail sauce, lemons and horseradish. 

The boiled crawfish were not good at all. They were way overcooked and looked old too. Maybe they were frozen but they were all shriveled up and the meat was a grayish color. I ate a few and decided not to test my stomach and eat anymore. 

The burger was good. Juicy and flavorful. The chicken tenders were pretty good as well. Love the fresh garlic that they used to season them.

Just wanted to start off and say the gaming at  this place is good got a four of a king And for the food it is awesome!!! seafood is hella  fresh and the bartenders are really nice  good place to kick it and watch the game or even go  to enjoy some great fresh seafood!!!

If I could talk to John taffer from bar rescue I would tell him to go straight into this place. Let me tell you the service here ..... TERRIBLE. Sadly the owner is very cool and very nice took care of us once we couldn't stand this place but ..... He needs to fire EVERYONE. 
If you get the oysters and your have EVER eaten oysters you will immediately know these are NOT fresh and not even good enough to be edible. Gagging by the first bite we all moved to the clams. They were very good but very sandy. So a few crunches will not surprise you. Then we went on and received our main courses. I ordered the coconut shrimp and they arrived cold with fries even colder. My partner ordered the pasta which he said the chicken seemed rubbery and the pasta sauce was yet again, gagging. The burger my friend ordered looked like a joke. Deserts were great. Beer was good. And wine was watered down. I hate giving bad reviews but if this place isn't helped it should be reported to food services. I was blown away.


If you know food you will be disappointed beyond belief.
We had a great time watching Monday night football, food was great, I recommend the crab, it's awesome

My friends and I have been going to Shucks for a very long time. I have been to all of them. I used to like going to the one on Serene and Eastern as well, but they are closed. We always look forward to late night specials and seafood 24hrs! 

Most of us work the nightshift at the Trauma Center. We are at Shuck's on all shifts. Days, swings, and nights. Most of the time we are there on graves. We know Larry, who my girlfriend, thought his name was Shuck...lol. We also know Mickey. We met most of the others as well  but Larry is the one we spend most of our time with. 

As with any establishment there are busy times, so we don't always get the attention we are accustomed to. We are there for the food and the friendly service is just a perk which we enjoy as well. Larry, Mickey and all the others, even the ones we don't really know have been pleasant. 

I'm a little disappointed to have read a previous review here on Yelp 02/12/2012. Somebody targeting one of the employees for their poor service. I find that hard to believe. My girlfriend and I were there just 2days ago. Sunday morning. We order our usual shrimp, hamburger and of course RICE for my Asian girlfriend lol. We had 2 drinks put some $$ in the machine, didn't win :( but as always pleased with our visit. Yes happy hour is happy hour, we often over tip but not always. The previous review not only attacked the service, but obviously attacked the quality of food being served. They are apparently unhappy and probably shouldn't go there. 

SHUCK's is awesome, has great 24hr seafood and we have always enjoyed the service as well!!!

Was a little disappointed in my night at shucks... Went for crawfish since it's in season and was served frozen crawfish that was so over cooked it was rubbery and had no flavor... Barely any customer service with our server didn't even ask if everything was okay.....

I'd go back again, but it is just a place that is great to know that has something you're looking for if you crave it. I love that they're 24 hours and they also have a cheap breakfast special.

I tried their fish tacos that day since it was their special, and did the build your own for 22.95. My friend and I did the fried clams (which I recommend), the raw oysters which is four to this platter, the ceviche, and the cocktail shrimp. This platter is actually alot to eat, and good to share if you don't have a big appetite for seafood. Also, the tacos were good. The fish was tender and not dry. Flavorful, but predictable, and nothing unique as far as taste. The iceberg lettuce just makes it feel like any other fish taco.

Been a huge fan for years. Overall Shucks has always been a 4 star experience. Love the breakfast specials and my wife and I love the Seafood Louie. We have not been in for awhile but to cap off Mothers Day, we popped in for a couple of salads.

Something was different. In the past, the salad has included two pieces of lobster meat that came from the interior of the claw. In other words, it was really obvious the salad had lobster in it.

The menu description states:

"Crab meat, shrimp and lobster served on a bed of mixed greens, tomatoes and a hard boiled egg. served with Louie dressing."

The crab meat is usually the glob of shredded meat in the middle of the salad. The two shrimp are on the side, along with the garlic bread, tomatoes and the sliced hard boiled egg.

No lobster to be seen unless the glob of finely shredded crab meat now has finely shredded lobster meet combined with it. And if that is the case because they changed the way the salad was made, they should probably change the menu description.

The worst part(and why you are getting three stars) was the defensiveness of the server speaking to me like I was an idiot and did not know what I was talking about.

We will still come back for the breakfasts but will never again be ordering a Seafood Louie salad.
I wouldn't know, sat ourselves with no one at the front door. Waited 20 minutes without anybody noticing our party of four at a 3/4 empty restaurant. I'll try again next time!
Ok neighborhood-vibe restaurant. Food was typical of a greasy spoon. Or maybe I'm just from LA and have higher standards. The oysters were just ok. Even those felt somewhat...'greasy'.

I came here hoping to find great seafood near where I live. Unfortunately I didn't find it.  I started with some Oysters which were ok.  They weren't anything special and I wouldn't return.  I then had a combination platter to try several other dishes and was sorely disappointed.  The shrimp ceviche was bland and the only flavor that came out was the cilantro.  The calamari was overcooked so it was very chewy and the marinara it was served with was runny and odd tasting. The fried clam strips were over-battered and overcooked... the flavor itself wasn't bad but it was like chewing a tire.  The crab cakes didn't have any crab flavor, it was just an overpowering pepper flavor. All-in-all the service was fine and the people were nice so I have no complaints there.  Unfortunately most of the seafood is not fresh and I think this is the biggest reason why most of the food is bland and tough.  Granted its tougher to get fresh seafood in Vegas but the quality of the food is so low I won't be returning.

For a place called shucks, I'd expect an oyster that at the very least smelled better. I thought I was going to a seafood joint. As it happens I ended up at a sports bar that happened to serve sea food, and in a rather mediocre fashion at that.

I've been driving by this place for years, I keep telling myself that I should stop by one of these days. Well, that day finally came. The wife and I made an early dinner trip to check it out. Nice inside, spacious, a deceiving from the outside. Maybe because it's laid out kind of open like, with the bar on the right side, dinning area to the left, with some benches in the middle facing several large screen tv's. Good layout for sports watching. Food was good too. I have some smaller version of their huge burger. Good stuff, service was good. Not a place to hang out if you're under the age of, oh, 50...at least when we were there, more of an older crowd, maybe because we were so early. I'd go back, maybe later in the evening, see if any younger people show up, try some more of their menu and watch some games.

Not a long review. Ordered gumbo $13.95 . It was such a small portion a toddler could not have been filled by this portion . Setting that aside it tasted like it came from a can. Never going back and I would never recommend anyone eating there.

I literally walked in and out of this place. There was no one to help us be seated at the front to the point that we had to search for the host/waiter even though the place was dead.

Did I mention this place REEKS of cigarettes? Like, really bad?
I love seafood but I didn't feel like I'd be able to taste the quality of the food accurately here while inhaling clouds of smoke.
I lost my appetite immediately and left.
Bland, boring, and slow.  Oysters were okay but everything after that was fast food like, without the fast.  Not much lunch trade and still wasted an hour there.

well, the 1st time we went here, it was fabulous. so, we decided to go again & we ordered the same thing as before and what a disappointment, must've been a different cook the 2nd time. the coconut shrimp was under cooked & I had to send it back & when I did get my meal, it was greasy and they must've forgotten the coconut part...I ate 2 shrimp & took the rest to go. we might try this place again but it'll be a while before we do, if we do...
The food was good loved the pancakes, next time trying seafood looks  yummy . Great service very. Friendly people ,I will be back

Can't stop thinking about this place since I went two weeks ago. I know I was rather tipsy when I was there, but I do remember the food being great and the service being even better. Darvey (Sp?) was our amazing bartender!!!!! I woke up the next morning (afternoon) with my chicken wings by my side and they were still yummy. Thanks Darvey, Darby...you catch my drift...

Service was attentive, ordered 6 oysters--fresh and clean; also ordered the clambake. Enjoyed both. Not many people  in the restaurant/bar, a couple of families. Didn't encounter any cigarette smoke. I'll return. Good value too.

The service was fabulous and the food was beyond delicious. With ample serving sizes. 
My flat iron steak and coconut shrimp was perfection. The steak was very tender and had terrific flavor.  The coconut shrimp was delicious, albeit almost burned----but didn't taste burned. Got out of oil just in the nick of time. 
All in all, for me and I think I speak for the rest of my party (3 others), Schucks was an exceptional dining experience. 
Thank you.

I have eaten here before and  it is always excellent.  Went in for a beer and a shot after work. The bartender was good, he described the specials that he had and served me quickly even though he had a full bar. Great customer service even to the two girls at the end of the bar that dident know what they wanted to drink (If you have ever worked behind a bar you know the type lol). This is a great place to grab food or just a quick drink.

This place is a awesome I am from so cal and have been looking for a local spot with great oysters at a good price. You can't beat Thursdays $1 raw $1.50 cooked or $2 shooters. Been here a couple times and the oysters have been consistently good. Victor has been our server every time and he is great. He's friendly and always makes sure our drinks are full and the oysters at flowing!!!!!!!

I've liked Schucks food but the trip there tonight reminded me why I don't go there except to remind myself why I don't go there. 

The customer service is atrocious. I sat for over 5 minutes at the bar and not once did the brunette bartender acknowledge me in anyway. She got a couple of drinks, went into the kitchen, and then played with her phone cord on a strip outlet by the register. Never once looked up and said she'd be right with me or anything. This reminded me that this has happened to me before there. You basically have to be a regular to get anything resembling adequate service at Schucks. 

What is the dysfunction at this bar that they can't get employees to practice just adequate customer service?

I've been coming here for years and as much as the seafood is good and a couple bartenders are great the machines are awful. I've never once won in my 3 years playing here. The best I have ever done is break even and the points from the player system are awful. If you stop playing for just around a minute it forgets your player card and doesn't count your points. You have to either keep playing which you rarely win or you have to keep reinserting your card every few minutes to try and take breaks and make your money last longer. The only reasons I continue to come here are because of Kara being the most amazing bartender in Vegas and because it's close but there's a pts, brewskies, and the Durango lodge within a couple blocks so I wonder why I bother if all I do is lose. They need to loosen up the slots just a little or I'm probably done gambling here. I've lost nearly a grand which to me is a lot and I not only don't have enough points to redeem anything but the points don't even go to food. I really shouldn't play here anymore. I usually don't mention anything when I start to dislike a place and change my hangout but I'm hoping the owner will see this and maybe change at least how tight the machines are.,I don't care about winning I just want to break even or be able to tip my bartender well without getting bent over the bar every time I gamble. I doubt anything will change though.

Went here 3 times now, and it has NEVER been good! This will definitely be the last time I try...
The freaking crab was hollow, wings were soggy and sandwiches were awful. They brought out three different clusters and none of them had more than one or two legs with meat in them...they said it was because of a bad order??? Whatever. On top of that, only one that was even hot...and it was the very LAST one, and by then I was over it! 
Gaming is also terrible. We both played hundreds at the bar EACH time and never saw anyone else hit anything either, which is so crazy. To sum it up? Mediocre food that they WILL comp when you lose at least 600.00, lol. No thanks!!!

I normally go to Shucks for my Saturday breakfast. $3.95 any breakfast and $2.50 for soft drink... Ive made it my treat someone to breakfast place for the last 2 months... Last night my husband and I decided to go try their hamburgers and omgoodness, please know I am hard to please when it come to certain foods and burgers being one. This burger was just amazing, I was full after eating half the burger but it was sooooo good I almost ate all of it. Surprised they didn't have to call a tow truck to take my out to my car.... But seriously this is a wonderful place if your looking for a awesome burger or breakfast. Also Brit or Brad I think his name is, is a wonderful host... 2 shucks burgers with fries and 2 lemonades $24.00... And it was so worth it... They have Red Robin beat by a long shot

Disappointed With the service. However Gus has saved this review from recieving 0 stars. 

Heres the story on how my Partner and I spent an Hour and a Half in this establishment feeling unacknowledged.
 
Our Waitress Sherri, was very unwelcoming and Unsociable. We sat ourselves as the sign in the entrance says too do so, She noticed us right away and still took 10 minutes to bring out our menu's. Keep in mind the Restaurant and bar was not busy. We were very hungry and Just wanted to order our food but it took an additional 15 minutes for her to come and take our order, where she made us feel as if we were wrong for ordering food.... She was very unfriendly and described the Food as okay... after she took the food order she stormed off where we didn't see her for a very long time and we wanted to order a few cocktails, Once our food was ready Gus brought it out and we finally were able to Order our Drinks since sherri never even asked for our drink order...  Gus was very Friendly and Prompt, And pretty much for the rest of our evening he took care of us and was extremely Hospitable. 5 stars for Gus!!!  Unfortunately Gus was not our server, it was not his responsibility to take care of our table, But he did, When we finally saw sherri Gus had already bussed our table and removed our plates and glasses, we asked her for the bill thinking she would bring it right out.... Here we are waiting without Drinks for our bill to come, Restaurant was not busy, Gus walks by and I inform him, "hey whats up with our Waitress she hasnt took care of us at all tonight and now wont even bring out the check", Very respectably Gus apologized and brought us out our bill right away. 

This experience took over an Hour for 2 plates of food, and 2 drinks.... Very not cool ;/

I give this review with a full stomach of perfectly cooked steak and excellently prepared mussels! The service was exquisite with their wording, friendliness, and helpfulness. My mother has trouble deciding what she wants and the waiter was very helpful in helping her decide. The shrimp was perfectly fried and the mahi mahi was very light and fresh with scrumptious seasoning!
I love this place. I come here all the time and know a lot of the staff. The food is always great and the waiters are always friendly.
Excellent service!! Very good prices on the raw oysters. Plus there is no line to wait in!! Love the seafood selection along with their specials.

Shrimp po boy had very few shrimp which was not tasty.  Fries not very good and the cole slaw was sour and not edible. 
Wife's fried oysters were terrible, bad tasting. Iced tea lousy.
We moved here from Dallas and Aw Shucks restaurants there were awesome!
Terrible waste of 30 plus dollars.

I've never been anywhere else where you can receive poor service, say something about it just to later be punished with an erroneous charge. To top it off, God forbid they make it right..... Instead, I was advised to dispute the charge with my bank. What a joke, it's a shame considering their food is really good.

It's like that meal you eat when you're really hungry and all of a sudden your full and grossed out.  The crab and spinach dip was runny and simply not good.  It came with toasted flour tortillas cut in triangles.  The crab cakes were salty and full of flavors that shouldn't go together.  The Rockefeller oysters and fried shrimp weren't bad.  Garlic fries were greasy and salty.  Ceviche was plain.  Snow crab and peel and eat shrimp was ok.  My advice is stick to the bar and have yourself a beer.

The food was excellent, but the service wasn't my favorite. We walked in and waited a good 10 minutes for someone to take our Order. WE even had to ask for a waiter. No one payed any attention to us throughout our time there. I hope next time the service is better to enjoy with the food.

Just moved nearby. 

As good as other top-notch Nevada-style pubs Steiners and Village Pub.

Specializing in seafood.

Had peel and eat shrimp- very fresh, and a Shrimp Buffalo Ranch Wrap- very good, not too spicy-not too bland.

Good service.

I will be back soon.

I wanted to love this place. . . and everything I had tasted awesome! A solid four stars if my boyfriend hadn't gotten food poisoning from this place. $60 meal turned into a $600 hospital visit. . . enough said.
Great food and great service. We eat here all the time and have never had a bad experience. Some of the best and freshest seafood in town.

So good and so simple.  I love their oysters.  The mothershucker burger is huge and always cooked medium rare when I order it this way and the jambalaya has just enough kick to it that keeps me coming back.

Shucks is faithful to me in the sense that they're open 24 hours and not that run down of a place. 

I think I've posted a years worth of pictures before writing this review but whenever I'm in the north west area of Las Vegas I know for sure Shucks is always a good option for me to fall back on.

Let me wrap this up by saying the Salmon entree is excellent, the pork chop appetizer is always good, and the black cod/catfish dishes are gravy too.  

Do not hesitate ever to walk in!

My favorite is still the jambalaya but the only time I ever eat at Shucks is night or late night and the atmosphere is just not there for me at this location.  My favorite dishes have always been the jambalaya, lamb chops, big mother shucker, oysters!, and crab legs.  

The food is still good and the oysters are still one of the best in Las Vegas but it's just awkward sitting at the bar when drunk and stinky people are around you, a bartender isn't quite friendly and not even around as often, but I'll still come back.  Late night eats here is okay but it's one of the few that are open so I have to deal with it.

I have been 3 times over the last year or two. The first time my family met some friends for dinner. We ordered and one persons meal was completely wrong, and my husband giant burger was RAW on the inside. I mean not cooked at all!! Second time service was awful but the soup was good. Tonight and the last time I will attempt this place. My son ordered some chicken wings with onion rings and I stuck with the soup. We got fries instead, I told the runner we had ordered onion rings and he said he would bring them out. Our server, name never told to us, came out and said we didn't order onion rings. I told him I did while my son sat shaking his head yes. He then told me well I didn't hear you but he is going to bring some out. Ok, not that big of a deal, a little rude but whatever. As my son proceeds to eat his wings he realizes there is dark grimy something in his chicken. Idk what it is and it's in the last 5-6 of his wings. When the waiter comes back he asks if we want a box, absolutely not! One of the wings had what my son said looked like bloody eggs in it. The server looks at the food and says so it wasn't good? Really no! He leaves with the plate, so then I have to hunt down a runner to get my bill. I also ask for a manager. After waiting for a long time with no manager in sight I paid my bill and left. We will never return. Service was horrible, food was horrible. 3 strikes you're out!
Oyster was bad !! Not fresh and not cold enough!!  Can not spend my money here !!! I know the happy hour is busy here but food is disappointed

It was a Sunday afternoon with hubby and the in laws. We all were super hungry and felt like seafood. After searching for seafood restaurants on Yelp, I came across Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar. I printed out a coupon ($10 off of a bill $50 or more) and we hit the road. 

At first, we were all very skeptical and the restaurant's building wouldn't reveal anything about what was expecting us inside. Finally we got over our fears and entered the restaurant. The atmosphere was very friendly, even though a little smoky, since the bar wasn't separated from the dinning area. 

For the first hour we were the only customers in the entire restaurant, which didn't bother us at all. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. We asked him about his favorite on the menu and he suggested the Clam Bakes for $26.95, which feeds up to 2 people and includes the following: 
   
    Manila Clams (1 lb)
    Snow Crab (1 lb)
    Dungeness Crab (1/2 lb)
    Andouille Sausage
    Red Potatoes
    Corn

We ordered 2 of it and WOW, it looked and tasted amazing. The clams were very fresh and tasteful, and so were the snow crabs and the rest of the goodies in that shell looking bowl. 

As we asked for the desert menu the waiter came back after about 10 minutes with a tray of different cakes and ice cream samples. We all thought that was very cute and the effort was what counted. We decided for a piece of chocolate cake and the fried cheesecake burritos. They both were very delicious. 

I would definitely go back to Shucks. The food was fresh and tasty and price value relationship was great.

Who says the food deals are dead in Vegas? Shucks' entire breakfast menu is $3.95 and you really can't do better than that.  I had Shucks Breakfast:  2 eggs, choice of ham, bacon, sausage, brunch potatoes and toast. My dining partner had the Chicken-fried steak breakfast.  I had a bite and it was really good.

As other reviews have mentioned, coffee is $2.50 which nearly doubles the cost of breakfast, but it's still cheaper than Denny's!  Highly recommend this place for breakfast.
I like this place it's close to my house and pretty low key, pretty good selection of beer and food.

My family and I have been eating at Shucks for several years now. The food has always been great, but the service is so hit or miss. Lately more miss than hit. 

The kitchen is small and the wait staff is only marginal. It's fine as long as it's not busy. But if you go on a Friday night, expect to wait forever. Tonight, I had to ask for a waiter to take out order because we sat for almost 15 minutes without being greeted by our waiter. Then the table next to us, who was sat after us and waited on after us for their appetizers and entrees before we were served anything. I had to ask for a manager. 

Like I said, the food never disappoints. But I'm not sure we will be eating here anymore with the lack in service.
We usefully come for dinner but instead we came fire breakfast.  Good breakfast menu. They have several items just for  $5.
I'm giving this 5 stars for one reason; I love Florida style fried shrimp and this is the only place in Vegas I've found that has it like I like it. I would come just for the shrimp.

Awesome seafood in the middle of the desert!  Crab legs are on point, shrimp is amazing, lobster mac n cheese....yum.  I found this place late night after a night of partying.  The bar food is delicious too.  Service is solid but not wow worthy.  So that's a half star deduction.  And another half star deduction for being a Bears bar :). Go Broncos!

I was watching a re-run of Bizzare Foods recenlty and saw Andrew Zimmern diggnig up clams in Rhode Island.  Suddenly I found myself with a strong craving for fried clam strips.  I used to share a basket with my mom at our favorite sea food place when I was a kid.  I had to have them again.  It had been too long.  After much searching a failed attempt at a restaurant that no longer exists, I found myself at Shucks Tavern.  

It was about 9:30 AM when I was in the area and I knew Shucks to be open 24/7.  So in I walked and was immediately handed a menu for breakafast items.  I gave the guy a funny look and asked if they were serving only breakfast or if I could order from the regular menu.  He said I could order anything and must have been confused by my request.  I mean who wouldn't be.  I'm sure most people don't tend to order fried clams at 9:30 in the morning.  But I've never been one for breakfast foods and I had a craving.  So I ordered my fried clams, a side salad with Italian dressing and an ice tea.  

What seemed like many minutes went by and were fewer than it seemed.  Soon I had my salad and a nice plate of fried clams.  They were impressive too.  Dark golden brown.  Big and meaty.  There was a large cup of cocktail sauce and a couple of lemon wedges on the side.  The salad was perfect for a side.  Mixed greens, tomato, onion.  The perfect amount of dressing.  The vinegar woke up my taste buds and got me ready for the good stuff, the clams.  And they were good.  Tender but still chewy to let me know they were the real deal.  None of this chopped formed garbage.  Perfectly fried and crispy.  The cocktail sauce was amazing.  There was enough horse radish to make me sweat.  A little extra lemon juice mixed in and it was perfect.  I ate down those crispy little bi-valves and felt this sense of euphoria wash over me.  My craving had been satisfied and I was ready to begin the rest of my day.  Everybody else can keep their Wheaties.  For me, fried clams first thing in the morning is the true breakfast of champions.

If you're in The Centennial Hills areaand you are looking for a great seafood restaurant with incredible burgers, soups, nachos or you want to stop in for an endless lunch for $8.95 this place is a must!

The restaurant itself is very large and very comfortable booths, tables and the bar stools are super cushy

This was our first time here. It was great. The service was awesome!!! Had crab and spinach artichoke dip as appetizer....yummmy. The seafood bisque in sourdough bowl was great too. We will definitely be back!!!

WOW! My new favorite place in the neighborhood. A little noisy during football games Sunday and Monday night but if you are a non-drinker this can also be very entertaining people watching. Now for the food, I have eaten there several times and there are no complaints the crab legs are fresh and cooked to perfection as is the fish, the cod is crispy and flakey the mahi mahi is as good as I have ever eaten on any fresh fish market. The service is friendly and they work their ¥%£%# off so we make sure they are rewarded well for the excellent service. I can't say enough about this local gem.

I've been coming to this location for a few years and have always been extremely happy with the food and the service. They have a nice bar area and then booths and tables. I usually always grab a booth because when I come here I'm so hungry I want to order a few things and it all doesn't fit comfortably on the bar. 
We have had the exact same server for over a year now and he's great. Brings us our waters and beers quickly and keep them refilled. All the staff is pretty awesome and friendly and makes sure to never forget you. 

My foodie date and I were starving so we started off with the crab and spinach dip. I personally do not like the pita chips it comes with so I had them switch it to tortilla chips instead. Always a favorite. Then we also ordered  the calamari this time. This was the first time ordering that appetizer here and I have to say that was some of the best calamari I have eaten anywhere in Vegas. It was so light and crispy that I savagely ate the entire plate by myself. If you come here definitely order that. 

Now on to the entrees! I think I have tried almost everything on their menu now but the Steak and Crab is by far my favorite. It's a flat iron steak( seasoned perfected) which is delicious and 1/2 pound of crab. The steak is always so tender you can cut it with a fork and my crab was exceptional. Huge pieces of meat that didn't even need any lemon or butter because it tasted so good on its own. They were out of my favorite sautéed summer squash side so I got broccoli instead. My date had the new Clam Bake( I think that's what it's called..?) which was amazing! It had a generous amount of clams, andouille sausage, corn, snow crab, and these deliciously seasoned potatoes. Not only did I eat all my food but I ate part of my dates as well. Haha it was just extra good. 

Even after all that food I had to have some desert. Their cheesecake and brownie is to die for but I decided on the fried cheesecake and let me tell you I wasn't disappointed! 

2 appetizer, 2 entrees, dessert and soda/beers our totally bill came to $85 which I thought was very reasonably for seafood and steak. Great place and if you are a sports fan they always have the games playing as well.
There bus boy although he resembled Ellen Degeneres was very helpful and polite. Food was amazing and service from them employees was phenomenal. Trevor well done son.

I like this place ~ it's a local place, it's comfortable, service and food are wonderful, what more could you want?! 

Let's start by saying, I don't do oysters . . . shrimp yes, crab legs, yes, but not oysters, so I can't review those. 

My all time favorite and what I always come back to is the blackened tuna tacos!!  Wow, yes please!!  And the shrimp tacos are also amaaaaazingly delicious!!  Blackened mahi is also very tasty, but tuna is my favorite!!  My husband always gets the fried shrimp and always raves about it, so I'm guessing they're pretty awesome too.  He orders fried shrimp everywhere we go so he's quite the expert by now. He says this place does it right!!

We've been here quite a few times and have never been disappointed, of course we'll be back!  The people are always friendly and that's a plus!  Try it out ~ great neighborhood eatery!!

Half of my son's hockey team (plus parents) went here for lunch yesterday. Extremely good experience. The server was organized and kept all the kids' orders straight with each parent. The food came pretty fast, considering how many of us there were. And the food was pretty good too!  No downsides.  :-)

Excellent Food and Outstanding Service!

I recently visited Las Vegas and was recommended by a friend to try this place out for their great 24 hour menu.  Late on a Saturday night, this seemed like a good option.

WOW!  The food at Shucks is amazing.  I went in with the intention of just having a dozen oysters, but the late night bartender recommended a couple of other dishes as well.  I decided on the garlic shrimp--in addition to the oysters.  Both dishes were amazing. The shrimp were fairly large and the garlic sauce was outstanding.  The oysters were fresh and very tasty!  

The bartender working that night was on top of everything.  Helping out others in addition to recommending great dishes.  He really made me feel welcome!

All I can say is that this will be a "must-stop" everytime I head out to Las Vegas!

Well, to start, apparently on Tuesday nights they have a "paintnite" where they take up one side of the restaurant where all the booths and real tables are. They use a microphone to give painting directions that is way too loud!
The food we ordered, steamed clams, 2 half pound orders, one garlic and one Cajun, came out in the same bowl and had a bad taste, like mildew water.
The tacos were good. They were on sale, $3 each. 
We also had the New England Clam Chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, that was bland but good. Also a lobster roll sandwich, was good but still had to much mayo after we ordered it with very little mayo. 
The blackened cat fish was moist and tender but not blackened enough. 
I must say I don't write reviews all the time, but I felt I needed to warn the public.

Awesome seafood! Standard gaming bar, couple great bartenders but what really sets it aside is the great food and reasonable price. Best clams I have had, in Las Vegas that is. Great oysters and the crab legs are solid, not nearly as expensive as you might think either. This one is definitely worth a shot if you are tired of the same old Las Vegas style bar food that is on every corner.

We are so incredibly picky with seafood, my GF is from Maryland and only used I the best... This place is the ONLY place we truly love for seafood! We have been here several times and NEVER disappointed!!! The oyster Rockefeller, DIVINE! The peel and eat shrimp was perfect and the coconut shrimp was beyond amazing!!! Try this place for some legit seafood!!!!

I LOVE Shuck's Thursday's specials for Oysters. $1 dollah oysters! They also have this special on Sunday and Monday for the NFL games. I came here on Thursday and it wasn't busy...just a steady stream of customers.  We decided to come here for the oysters since it is oyster season...supposedly any month ending in "er" is oyster season.  
We started off with 15 oysters and I decided on the Pear Martini. The Pear Martini was just ok, it just tasted like regular vodka with sprite. I decided to go with the shrimp tacos and a cup of the clam chowdah of course. The bf decided on a burger. Our oysters came out first....and it was love at first sight. They were so fresh and delicious...definitely in season! It left me wanting more....but I think 15 oysters is quite a bit for the two of us. The food came out shortly after we got our oysters...so between eating oysters and some soup (not at the same time), I felt like I was in heaven. However, I finally got to my shrimp tacos....I was so dissappointed. The shrimp was over cooked and just didn't taste like shrimp....and there was so much cabbage and dressing that it soaked through the tortillas.  The shrimp tacos were slightly redeemed by the french fries....those were crispy and tasty! I believe the bf loved his burger....but I'm sure that's not too hard to mess up.  
5 stars for the oysters, 4 stars for the service and 2.5 stars for my shrimp tacos. Lesson learned...no shrimp tacos from Shucks but plently of oysters! I will be back to get more oysters on Thursday!

this place is cool. i've only been here once and enjoyed it very much. we ordered the Shuck's Clam Bake for two and got, clams, snow crab, dungeness crab, king crab, corn and red potatoes- all for under 25 bucks. i thought that was a great deal. the seafood was tasty and seemingly fresh. i left full and satisfied.

Shucks has a couple appetizing items on the menu, but for the most part the food is overpriced and far from authentic.

The service can be a crap-shoot in terms of speed and getting correct orders.  But I have nothing bad to say about the atmosphere of the place.

Not saying I wont be back, but its low on the list
Bartenders are great, good food and good prices. All around just a solid place to go too especially for seafood or a burger.

Great food and drinks, my favorite local bar. The food is a lot better quality than most bars in town. Best fish n Chips I've had anywhere and they have very cold Lagunitas IPA on tap which is great. Prices are very reasonable too and they have no problem comping drinks if you're playing a little.

I used to love Shucks, and it was my go-to neighborhood bar. Back in the day, they had fantastic 2lb crab buckets for under $30. When people would ask me my favorite thing about Las Vegas, those affordable crab buckets would be part of my reply- mostly because you can order them 24 hrs a day. Crab at 3am? Why not?

Those  days are long gone now. The menu has changed, the late night specials have changed, the bar staff has changed. They used to offer a great late night menu after midnight (pics posted) but no more, now it's just breakfast. There's two bartenders who work there late night, one is a darling, the other who is newer is so rude.

The crab is now $9 for 1/2 a pound, which is  just kind of silly. Sometimes it's good, sometimes it's only so-so. The tuna is previously frozen, which is what you would expect from a place like this and sometimes it's okay, sometimes it's inedible. The oysters seem to be popular but they're gulf oysters which really isn't my thing.

I used to love this place and would come at least a couple of times a week, but no longer. I'll still drop in once in a while if the bartender I like is working. And it's still a great place to get seafood late at night, but for your bar needs? You can do better.

My husband's co-worker raved about Shucks constantly, so we finally decided we'd give it a try last night.

What a horrible dining experience.  Granted, I wasn't expecting it to be a 5 star experience - but if I could leave a "NO star" rating, I would.

Being a Friday night, we anticipated that service may not be great...but it was awful.  Our waitress was clearly overwhelmed by handling the bar area and tables, so perhaps that's why she made us to feel like we were intruding, rather than attempting to muster a smile or be polite.  Not the way to ensure a decent tip.  Though we left the customary 15%, had she put just a small bit of effort in to being friendly, we would have tipped her higher regardless of the poor food.  I never knock the wait staff for poor food.

We started with the crab & spinach appetizer special.  One bite of a mixture of the crab and dip and we immediately knew the crab had passed its servable life expectancy, and the seasoned chip things were stale - not off to a good start.

Needless to say, we weren't taking another bite of that.  We'd also ordered calamari, and neither my husband or older son complained about that (I don't eat it so I have to assume it was OK...they both lived through the night).

Our youngest ordered the sliders from their children's menu, our older son the pulled pork, and my husband and I steamed snow crab.

What my husband and I got were cold steamed crab legs and half melted butter.  And who serves a pound of crab legs without the claw?  It was too late to bother going anywhere else by this time, so we just ate the cold crab.

The pulled pork was fine, but it wasn't until our youngest seemed to focus more on the french fries after only eating 3/4 of one slider did my husband realize the damn things were RAW through the center...not rare...RAW.  How is it possible to NOT cook 2 slider size burgers thoroughly?  Note that our waitress didn't ask how we'd like the burgers cooked - so I could understand had the sliders been done rare (which would have been acceptable) - but RAW????

A complete waste of our time & money - I'd rather go to a Red Lobster chain than ever eat at another Shucks.
GREAT food, GREAT service, (thank you Ashley), we will be back! Haddock almost as good as what we get on the East Coast. Killer drinks!!

Shuuuuuuuucks!!! What happened? We came back for the seafood pan roast and it was good but not as great as I last remembered - 3 stars. 

Maybe because it was actually crowded and had a long wait to get the menu, the servers, and it was a Saturday night.

Jambalaya - was 2 stars. it did not look like one and didn't have any jambalaya spices. 

Oysters- mehhhhhhh they are a bit below average. 2 stars. 


Fried calamari - 2 stars. Didn't like the breading at all. Imagine Popeyes chicken breeding on the calamari and not the super light fluffy batter.

garlic bread- 4 stars. Love it here with the cheese on top.

Bacon wrapped shrimp- 2 stars. Good enough but nothing to write home about. My friend has a way better recipe than how it's done here so I'll skip it in the future. 

I'm a bit bummed out that it wasn't as good as I remembered. Seafood pan roast is still good enough to eat.

My husband and I have been coming here for years. The food is consistently great! Everything we have tried is just as good as the next. A big high-five to the staff all the way from the manager down are awesome. Check out the daily deals.
Burger was good. But bartender charged us for sodas... really sodas at a bar???!! Even with machine play???

I've only been here once and hope to bump up my rating as I plan on coming back. Shucks is very appealing to me because its pretty close to my house, making it super convenient, AND they have a good mix of seafood as well as meat - very important factor for me because my sweetie hates seafood and I love it. Typically places that advertise seafood have either none or very few meat options. Shucks seems to have everything. Should be a match made in heaven, right? I thought so too but it did not go down that way.
Fist, they had $3 margaritas on Tuesday - yes please! Margaritas were pretty good, deliciously potent. I decided to try their crab and spinach dip appetizer and went with jambalaya as an entree. The the dip had something sprinkled on top, which I assume was crab.. there were no other signs of crab, it was basically a spinach dip. The cajun jambalaya was supposed to have cod, crawfish, and andouille sausage - it had one piece of overcooked cod, probably 3 x1 inches with tons of sausage and some crawfish. The clod looked like was a side order. I was super confused why it came in one piece on the side and why that was all the cod that was in there... The biggest problem I had with the jambalaya is that it was SUPER salty. I am a salt loving gal but this thing was all salt. I couldn't really eat it. 
My honey, however, enjoyed his wings and fries. He is a wing snob and is very particular about his wings. He only gets wings from two spots in Vegas. Well, he like the wings here! He got them medium. His french fries was delicious too, I can attest to that :)
Though I did not care for my food, I plan to come back and try other things off the menu to find what I like. I really have high hopes for Shucks!

This is Chicago Bears bar. I am not a Bears fan, but I play one on TV. They have great game day specials, and as long as you don't causer trouble by be ing over zealous for another team, they are quite nice, as I have found Chicagoans in general. So stop in, behave yourself and enjoy the great Bloody Marry's and Chicago Dogs, cheap on game day! Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

Been craving Oysters for awhile found this place and was super excited but left super disappointed. Ordered a dozen oysters which ended up costing $20 and they were SO small we couldn't even taste them it really ruined my meal. Biggest waste of money. Also ordered a chicken BLT wrap, it was good but really messy and fell apart so it was hard to eat. Other than that, service was great but doubt that I'll be going back.

Best fried clams I've had outside New England. Lightly breaded, full sized, and great clam flavor. Nice tasting homemade tartar sauce. The lobster roll was okay, but too over-processed. Lobster meat shredded (a huge no-go if you've had a REAL New England lobster roll) and way too much celery. Green onions and seasoning in the mix take away from the lobster flavor. They should keep it simple and let the lobster be lobster. It's hard to beat a real Maine lobster roll though.

Aww shucks... I was SO excited for your Thursday deal of $1 raw oysters, $1.50 cooked oysters, and $2 oyster shooters.  But as our party sat down, our server informed us that the special for tonight is $1.50 raw oysters and $2 oyster shooters (no more cooked oyster special.)  We thought, "hey, 50 cents extra isn't too bad. Let's dooo it."  And off we went to oyster happy land.  

Thinking it was a great deal, each of us ordered a dozen oysters each.  As a part of their Thursday oyster special at $1.50 a pop, it comes down to $18 which is dun dun dun... the SAME price as the menu!!  What kind of deal is that?!  My friend and I put our order on the same tab to include 24 oysters, which would've been a better deal on the menu at $32 than at the $36 special we were charged.  

Don't get me wrong, the food was good!  Oysters were fresh, meaty, and sweet.  They provided ample amounts of lemon, horseradish, tobasco, and cocktail sauce.  We ordered some oyster shooters and man, those cups were a lot bigger than we imagined!  (We thought it would be like the tiny Japanese oyster shooters you get at the sushi restaurants, ha ha.)  At $16.95, the linguini and clams were alright.  The noodles were bland and lacked sauce.  The garlic parm fries ($2.95) was a good deal, pretty big sized basket that can be shared with a group.  It has a nice hint of garlic that wasn't overwhelming.  I found myself reaching for the fries more than my linguini.  My friend got 10 wings ($14.99) in soul sauce and he said it was alright.  We also ordered 2 pitchers of beer and I couldn't help but notice that my cup smelled like an old rag.  I didn't complain because, hey, I'm eating at a bar.  But it was just something I noticed. 

The service was pretty good. For a table of 12, we got our orders pretty quickly and they were able to split our bill without a problem.  The food is pretty good despite it being at the bar.  But because I'm eating at a bar, I expected food to be on the cheaper side and not in the $15+ range.  The not-so-special oyster special realllly killed my expectations.

Shucks has a hole in the wall vibe but has great food and a fun atmosphere. They have extremely reasonable pricing on fresh sea food and cheap drinks. They always have specials on oysters. Other than their oysters, their seared tuna and ceviche are my go-tos. Always friendly staff as well!

Good food, horrible service. This is the third time I've gone in and have received poor service. It takes forever for the bartender/waitress to come over or even address you.Then once they finally do, they take your order, give you one drink and you basically have to hunt them down where you're ready to order a second drink, so plan to finish your food before someone even comes over to offer you another drink. It's unfortunate that the service is so poor because otherwise I would have given them 5 stars. Obviously if I come in to a restaurant/bar I'm looking to eat and drink, not just stare at the tv's empty handed. I will say the one time I came in and sat on the restaurant side, the waiter was super attentive and the experience was pleasant but that bar side ruins it for me.

Surprisingly, a pretty good seafood restaurant.  Lots of regular bar food, but also a lot of shellfish and seafood on the menu.  Staff was decent, friendly.

The menu is kid-friendly but the bar is not really separated from the eating area (it's all open, not separate rooms) so depending on how busy the bar is, it might be a little smoky for little ones.  

No military discount, but if you need seafood and don't want to brave a casino or downtown, then Shucks is a great alternative.

Really enjoy coming down to Shucks to chill, have a drink, and eat seafood.  It's really casual and a great place to have a late night bite.  The seafood is fresh and the drinks are strong.  The wait staff is always really friendly and this has become a regular hang out for us.  They have daily specials and is a great place to watch football.

After seeing all the reviews on this place and its late night specials I couldn't wait to try this place being that I love oysters and a great happy hour spot. OK so we went here late Saturday night around 1am! Walking in the bar came across as a Pretty friendly bar. It seemed as though everyone knew everyone. The bar staff was friendly, nice and attentive! He took our drink order and dropped off the late night menu... the menu everyone had been ranting and raving about, the menu That brought us to this bar only to find out.. the menu changed!! Yes changed! NO burger and fries deal, no calamari special the only the thing that was the same was the $1 oysters! When we asked the bartender what's up w the the menu he Told us it had changed.. So I ordered the Rockefeller oysters, fried oysters and a couple raw ones as well and they were delicious.  The cook brought them out which nice. Overall the place was nice and the food was good but I wouldn't go out of my way to drive that far for it..

I just love this place! This time tried the sea tacos with grilled cod... SO GOOD. My son had their shucks burger and it was also great. Fries have been on point every time... And their cheesecake.. Damn good. Everyone was so nice. We had Nicolette as our main server and she was great :) I know I should try new places, but I really do enjoy shucks too much to branch out right now!

I'm happy that Shucks offers Seafood Pan Roast! I usually go to Palace Station for it but there is usually a long line. Plus I feel pressure to finish because it is confined to a small bar area where people are lined up behind you. 

I chose to have the shrimp, scallop, and crab meat with mine. The seafood is mixed in a hot creamy tomato broth which I had over white rice. It so good especially on a cold day! I also had the shrimp ceviche which was also delicious. If you don't have anybody  to share the appetizer with like in my case I would suggest just getting the entree because it is filling enough. My husband doesn't eat seafood so I was stuffed eating both. 

We shared a apple tart with vanilla ice cream for dessert which was perfect! I think Shucks is a great place to go for seafood if you want to eat in a casual atmosphere. Plus it is opened 24 hours so whenever the craving strikes you can go!

Interesting place with the tin shack look. Decent food that not too expensive mainly emphasizing the seafood options available like crab & crawfish boils. I had the fish and chips and they were OK but not quite sure if they were fresh or frozen. Some friends had burgers and they looked good.
I've been here a few times and this place to me is just okay. Oysters aren't very fresh and the food is okay. Place could be a little cleaner too. Service was okay as well.

My husband and I enjoy bogo sandwiches and wraps Wednesday evenings. The food is always superb! I would give this review 5 stars if it was just based on food. The crab legs are fresh, sweet and juicy. Love the fries and buffalo chicken wrap. However the service here is horrible, if you're unfortunate enough to get one of the girl waitresses. Takes 10 min to even be greeted luckily by then you have already decided what to eat. The food is out pretty fast because the cook usually brings it. Then it takes 30 min to be able to pay and leave.. Anyway if you have extra time to wait and don't mind dinner taking two hours they have good food.
Worst customer service ever! Took 45 min to order, you need more employees? Hit me up, I'm free.

Wow!  What a great place!!!!  For us, it's our Cheers!!!!  We walk in and everybody knows our name, drinks, meals!!!!  A little crowded during Paint Night but we work around it.  They have great music, a good following of regular customers, the best salmon Caesar salad ever!  Not to mention bar tenders!!!  Thanks Carina!!!!

Had the opportunity to enjoy a lovely breakfast here this morning. Honestly I wasn't expecting much but it ended up being a really great meal the potatoes were nicely seasoned eggs and bacon cooked perfect. The pancakes came out nice and fluffy but I didn't like that they only had the heinz syrup in the packets yuck. But the decor was nice and warming even though it was a Bears based theme being a packers fan that was kinda rough lol all that aside I like this little place very cozy and welcoming. Lastly I would like to say the service could use a little help I'm sure that because it was early not all the servers were there and maybe they were stretched thin but 30 min to get our card processed was just too much and it's not like the place was packed full also I would not recommend a bloody Mary here very thick and concentrated was not a highlight of the meal at all.

Being from Seattle I know seafood! And if you have ever cooked lobster you know it turns WHITE! And this place serves translucent lobster! When getting a reply from the server he said that's how it is.....So gross, hoping my man and I don't end up sick!!

They lose a star because the service is just OK....but for bar food I have ate at both the centennial and the flamingo location (for paint nite) and both are great, but I do think the portions at the centennial location are larger. I always get the scallops with ginger glaze and it is a HUGE portion and always very tasty. The garlic fries are AMAZING!! Family friendly also! I definitely choose Shucks over a PT's or Timbers for a good, reasonably priced meal.

Service was a little slow to get someone to take our order. My wife ordered the clam chowder, and said for a seafood place wasn't the greatest. I ordered the fish and chips were kinda small. And honestly it wasn't the greatest, the batter was so so. I was hoping for something more. My girl ordered the combination platter and not all the shrimp were battered, the bottoms were not battered at all. They needed to sit for a sec since all the batter came off. It took 6-7 minutes to get a beer. Ordered 2 kids quesadillas and that took almost 20 minutes. I didn't thank they were that busy, but ok. Sorry to say just not that impressed.
Good music and bar food. Service can be spotty at times. Still the selection of drinks and food make it worth coming back.
I just ordered to go and I am really dissatisfied with my order. I got the pan roasted seafood for $20 and it's so not worth it. It tastes good but I guess they want you to buy 3 orders per person.
The service was great. The lobster was like rubber, wasn't prepared right. Wasn't pleased with any of the dishes we had received.

AMAZING $3.95 BREAKFAST.

I am really not a fan of their lunch and dinner.  One time I got the king crab lebs and I had to send them back they were so nasty.  But breakfast is where this place really shines.   Monday - Friday 12am-11am.  Weekends 12am-1pm.  Huge portions and a slightly limited but good selection of entrees.  The omelettes, and chicken fried steak are a great and tasty value. I don't think anywhere can beat this breakfast, even the casinos.  Check it out and you won't be disappointed.
Waited 15 minutes before a server acknowledged us. Foods ok but not good enough to make up for the crappy service...

I'll get straight to the point.
