Thursday Special $1.50 Oysters - they were not the worst oysters I have ever had, but they were not exactly plump and sweet. They were what you would expect from a bar.

Mussels- the absolute worst mussels I have ever been served. The mussels were so small they were not even worth eating. The shells were broken into small pieces. I was shocked that they served them to me.

Crab Cakes - definitely not lump crab and they were cold.

My expectations were not high to begin with, but com' on man. You can't serve people that kind of mess. That was a waste of $67.00. I was better off on my first trip when they were closed. Very disappointing.
This place has the best nachos in town! Steak or chicken. You also can't beat the cheap huge breakfast. Not only is it cheap food. It tastes like only something a king would eat. Thanks guys

Good service...horrible food.  I really don't know why it's almost 4 stars, and you'd think they would have great oysters since its specialty is oysters.  I ordered the dozen oysters, which smelled fishy once they laid the platter on the table.  The shells were yellowish green like it was bad.  I decided not to knock it unless I tried it, and yep I was right. The oyster was small and sour. Definitely not worthy of $13. I then ordered the clams, which were ok.  It was big & meaty, but the sauce was so bland--it killed it.   It came with corn and sausage which was basting in the same flavorless sauce.  I was really disappointed in how everything tasted after the long awaited anticipation.  There was nothing wrong with the service.  The staff was friendly and attentive,  but I would never recommend this place to friends because of the food.  Sorry, just being honest.

This is a very laid back bar, old looking decor, definitely not the hot spot in town however the food is great! I think is a really cool combination to have seafood at a bar! There are plenty of tvs to watch sports and they always have drinks specials! If you are craving some shrimp, crap legs or oyster then I would totally recommend for you to come here ..,

We are originally from Wisconsin so finding a good fish fry in LV that meets our expectations has been a challenge. We've been to Shucks three times now and have to say that it the best we have found in town. They bread their haddock in house and the fillet is a generous portion. The house cole slaw is also very good. I've also tried the snow crab and was very pleased. 

The atmosphere is pleasant tavern, clean and efficient. It has a few TV's to fulfill the sports bar requirement but they are not intrusive. Staff is very friendly and the food comes promptly. We give it a solid recommendation and are putting it down as one of our regular spots.

My boyfriend and I are on a getaway date, staying at Mt. Charleston. Needless to say they messed up so we came back into town for dinner at Shucks. We sat in the dining room and Jeremy was our server, let me tell you I have never met a more friendly, courteous, outgoing server in my life and I work on the strip in the restaurant business! He definitely saved our date night, made amazing recommendations on what to order drink wise and food wise! Give this kid a raise and let him know you appreciate him. People like him are a rarity these day! Thank you thank you thank you Jeremy! We will be back just to see you!

I came here around 12:40am. I forgot my id but had a picture of it on my phone. The guy that works at the bar said, no id you gotta leave. Basically he threw out customers he could have sold oysters to minus the alcohol. I do those this place already.
I was craving shrimp ceviche so I came to this bar, I got it to go and the portion was all right, could have been a little bit more. It was also overly salty, but I didn't hate it
Great food, drinks and service. Always fresh seafood especially the oysters! Surprising for being in Vegas. Happy hour is nice too. Never disappointing

This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. They have amazing service and amazing food. I'm from Florida, but I will have to say their crab is way better. They have a couple different options on how u want it seasoned. Cooked to perfection. I've never had a bad meal from here. I recommend this place to everyone. -5 stars-

If you want seafood at 3 AM this is your place! I tried the crab legs they were fresh and prepared well. The flavored butter was a very nice touch. You can get the crab with different flavors- old bay is what I tried you can't go wrong with that. The bar has video poker, it's an average style vegas bar. It's nice to have someplace to go for late night seafood if your looking for something different.

Love this place! Great for those seafood cravings any time of day or night. I am from the east coast so if there is one thing I know, it's claim chowder and boy does this place do claim chowder right! It has great bar atmosphere and I love that you can seat yourself. My favorites are their crab buckets, popcorn shrimp, claim chowder (duh) ahi tuna, and po boys! .... and pretty much everything else. This is def. a must eat spot!

Been here several times.  Love crab and oysters. Last visit was Friday the 7th the entire visit was a disappointment.  Service was slow, inattentive and rude.  Oysters smelled and were not fresh.  I ended up paying for eating 2 of the 6 for a few days. What a shame! I've been here before and loved it

If you're from the south and looking for fried food, you'll be disappointed, but for the most part it wasn't a bad place. I got the fried shrimp and fried oysters and they were mediocre. If I were to go back I'd probably try something other than fried seafood. The staff was extremely professional, polite and tentative.
I'm here all the time great staff love it. The breakfast is possible the best breakfast in the area. Great deals nightly on food.

I've read a lot of the other reviews and will consider trying this place again one day based on those. They get two stars from me because they are open and serve food 24/7. I've worked restaurants all over this country and know 24/7 is a struggle itself. I personally didn't have a good experience at all. I walked in, all be it during their "down time" I'm sure. I was one of 5 people in the place. Two team members eating at a corner table(everyone has to eat and I'm in no way put off by this.) The dishwasher was sitting watching tv, again breaks happen and that's not bothersome to me. My issue is that there was one lady at the bar besides myself. She had maybe a sip of beer left for the 15 min I was there(would be my last ever here if I was her). I came in to grab a bite to eat and an application since I was new to the area then. Sadly I was never even offered a drink, much less would I EVER work here now. Maybe next time the bartender that I literally stared at the whole time I was there will realize she is in the customer service industry. Randomly tapping on her register but, really texting and on her phone the whole time is very obvious and frustrating. Especially to someone in the industry. I'll have to go in when they are slammed on a Friday night and see if the staff is ready and on point for service then or if they just have a great location and are only getting business because, this is Vegas and they are one of two bars in the immediate area. Which the other bar a couple doors down always seems to be busy no matter the hour and they have great food, drinks and service. Hopefully next time I will actually get served here and can rate the food, drinks and service instead of lack there of. I think I was extremely fair not just giving 0 stars. Not possible but, that's probably what this particular visit should have received.
Best crab in town!  Always fresh.  Wings are great as well.  Everything we order is excellent.  Been here several times.  Waiter Jeremy is awesome!  Couldnt ask for better service!!

I was craving oysters for some odd reason, so I pulled this place up.  I'm glad I did!  Granted I lost money on Keno, but it was a great time nonetheless.  Not sure why some people have said they waited FIFTEEN minutes for a drink?!  Um, the bar isn't that big.  The bartender, Shawn, came right over to me when I sat down, as he did with every other patron. The bar is wayyyy too small to ignore someone for that long, so clearly their 15 minutes was like 45 seconds.  Anyway, I really enjoyed this place.  All the people were friendly and I'll be back.

This place is so over priced! The thing that is disappointing is the food isn't that great for the price you pay. A funny note, it's supposed to be an oyster bar but they charge way more than if you go down the road to get oysters...hmmm. doesn't make sense. Menu is limited for a price point and for the amount you get and for the quality.
As The Great D-Barns Would Say "Best Hidden Gem In Vegas",  GREAT Prices/Food & Service...

The oysters were sandy ! This is supposed to be an oyster bar why couldn't they have better oysters come on ! I ask for a to go drink and they poured the drinks in a cup with no cap and straw lol my friend ask the bartender what type of drinks do they have and he said almost every drink umm okay like we were supposed to know. Other than that he was nice just the place needs some work.

The service was good. My food was tasty. But my martini was a bit strong and foamy.  I shouldn't be buzzed after eating and having two drinks. Still like to come here. The blackened Mahi Mahi sandwich is my favorite.

We eat here all the time and it is one of our favorite seafood places in Vegas.  The portions are large, the food is fresh and the value is good.  Fridays have appetizer specials for $5 each and we usually chow down on all of those.  The crab is always well prepared and the oysters are tasty.  The service is generally prompt and professional.

Went in for breakfast and found that their portions are plenty! They have great selections for right under $5 and I got a steak and egg breakfast for around $8! Amanda, our waitress was very attentive and was able to predict out needs. Great service. Great chill and cheap place for breakfast and it's beyond worth it. Can't wait to come in for dinner! Plenty of TVs for games, fun drinks, and a great seafood/ drink menu. We will be back.

Family friendly that's a plus! Fresh seafood. We had the cold peel and eat shrimp and the warm dunguness crab, cooked perfectly. Served with lemon and butter. Also shared the combo louie salad, crab was not fresh, it was canned but the shrimp was delicious. Lobster roll was devoured and full of lobster. For a tavern was shocked that the drink service was not that great but, we will see how it goes next time as we will be back. The best price for fresh seafood in our area.

$1 OYSTERS?!!??!!?! YES PLEASE~!!! (Thursday Special)

Came here a couple times to take advantage of this special along with some oyster shooters and surprisingly the Oysters have been consistently fresh! The service has always been fast and friendly! 
The only things I've also tried are the french fries and seafood bisque in a bread bowl.. fries are fries.. The soup was a bit on the salty side ... 

HOT TIP: They don't have Happy Hour here ;[[[ .. just daily specials ( Check the board right by the entrance) but on Thursdays it's definitely worth a trip coming to Shucks ;]]]
As soon as you walk in, you'll smell the cigarette smoke. We sat down and waited for our waiter, which took some time. The food was mediocre. I'll never go back again.

1st visit: Lunch on a Thursday. Oyster special (not so special) $1.50/raw oyster, $2/cooked oysters. If you get a half dozen or more it's basically the same as the regular pricing. Nice thing is they let you order less than a 1/2 dozen of each so you can mix & match without spending full order prices.
Ordered 2 fried oysters: crispy light breading, large, plump & juicy, best thing I had there.
2 raw oysters: small and not the freshest
2 oysters Rockefeller: small but good
2 grilled oysters: small, okay but a little dry
1/2 lobster roll ($5.95 special that day): more like lobster/seafood salad roll, looks like a mix of seafood or fake crab w maybe a little lobster thrown in, no chunks of lobster (this a bar that serves food, why would I think they would have a good lobster roll, especially at that price?)
The $6 check-in Guinness offer is of no value, that is the regular price of Guinness there. Deducted a star because the management knows this is of no value and won't offer anything else in exchange. Seems a bit deceptive to act like you're giving somebody a deal for checking in on Yelp when you're really not.
Waiter was very friendly and helpful.

Went here with the family and I would have to say it was ok. I had the steak salad and the steak was not high quality but just ok. Not sure what I was expecting from a steak salad butttttt I still expected better. 
A few in our group had the seafood including my husband and he said it was ok as well. 
The atmosphere is ok and the waitstaff was ok. I guess if your looking for some bar type seafood this place is good for that. I cannot say that I will be rushing back anytime soon but I also cannot say that there was really anything wrong with it. I guess I just expected more out of my steak salad than I got.
Wow we went in to see our favorite graveyard bartender Larry and found out he is no longer there. The service wasnt good. We won't be back
Great food! Terrible...terrible service. Fabian saw us twice within an hour. Same problem last time we were here unfortunately.

We called in for pick up and ordered the "Build your own (you choose 4)" which we choose (1) 2 order (1 lb) of peel & shrimp (2) Rockefeller oyster (3) calamari. We picked it up and when we got home they messed up our order. Instead of peel & shrimp we got fresh oyster . We called them back and they said come back and we will have your "1 lb peel and shrimp." We thought they will make this right this time. We got there and we checked if they get it together but again, people that work there are naturally idiots! We got 8 pieces of cocktail shrimp . We told them that first that is NOT what we ordered!  We specifically told them 2 orders (1 lb) of "peel & shrimp" & the guy (he wasn't wearing any name tag) was arguing and totally unprofessional! They messed up on our order the first time and second time we are willing to come back and hoping they will make it right but instead they just ruin our night. It is inappropriate and no respect whatsoever. Don't ever try this place because people that work in this place does not care... I hope karma get to this people.

Would love it if you started offering Fanny Bay or Kumomoto oysters.  Dare I ask for Shibumis?

Doug, the guy who prepares the food latenight, makes the best crab legs.  Had to go for them three nights in a row.  The five stars are for the late night staff.

Two of us ordered their current crab special for two which is absolutely fabulous.  I would recommend they keep it.  The crab was succulent, it also came with crab and cheese topped bread and a crab bisque.  We also tried the oysters and they were quite wonderful also.

My boyfriend and I like coming here for the clam chowder. You can get it in a bread bowl. And it's a lot cheaper than panera. It's open 24 hour and also serves breakfast. Great place to eat for cheap and works for hospitality hours.

$3.95 breakfast can't be beat. 

Got the chicken fried steak and though it' not Texas large, it's a decent size and good gravy. Better than some chicken fried steaks I've paid a lot more for. Eggs were cooked right, potatoes crisp outside and soft inside...

...basically comfort "normalicious" food (stealing that from Yelper Angela H's vocabulary). 

Yes, it's not the best breakfast I had- but it's solid and a much better alternative to a shitty night at a Denny's. It starts at 12am so stop by for your after drinking breakfast noms. Beats a lot of the graveyard specials in taste and price.

The customer service here is amazing. Tonight with a full house, we were taken care of by 3 different servers. All with polite manners. 

Only thing that's changed since my last review is the food. 

Ordered:
Mother Shucked with garlic fries
1 pound Dungeness crab

I have tried the Shuck burger and the mother shucker in the past and am quite familiar with the taste. Now, the flavor is just not the same. I've been giving them a go since I moved here in 2013, and there seems to be something different about the seasoning. 8 of 10 on the juicy rating, (well that's considering I get it medium rare). And for the Dungeness, tonight seemed a bit dry, maybe a bit over cooked. This has happened to us several times in the past 6 months. Not consistent,  so may just be different cooks. What I can say is, gotta try the garlic fries! 

Definitely love the way the crew treats their customers, and how attentive they were. But I'll give it another 6 months try before updating again, just to see if it's just me or a change in cooks that's making my tongue confused. Sorry shuck 3 stars for now, but I will be coming around.

I think this place is definitely a matter of opinion.  This place certainly is NOT great, but it's definitely NOT bad either.  It's very average.  The menu is definitely over priced, the portions were a decent size. I'm shocked for a seafood place that they don't have scallops.  I tried their lobster bisque and it was a bit thin, a little salty and it was just ok.  I would actually say that the same soup at red lobster was twice as good.  (and just fyi, there are plenty of things at red lobster that aren't that great either, but as far as soup goes, they win) 

The breading on everything wasn't too bad but a lot of the fried items were bland and definitely needed more seasoning in their breading/batter.  Their calamari was ok but I would've liked it to be crispier (just a matter of opinion is all)

All in all,     I probably won't be back, nothing here made me say yummm or oooh or wow etc.   and Hushpuppy is better and far cheaper

and I will give partial credit to our server, she was very nice from start to finish and made sure we were taken care of.  There was a small accident when our entrees came out though.  While setting them on the table, they were setting them down/moving so fast, that the ramekin of tarter sauce fell off upside down onto my dad.  Luckily my dad moved very quickly and caught it upside down in his hand.  No real harm done and she did apologize and got extra napkins and such, but a manager should always stop by just to apologize as well and or offer a dessert or take a drink or something off the check (nothing big but just a small peach offering so to speak, is always appreciated)  Again no real harm done though and all in all the dinner was good just not great and not for the price.

We drive by and there's a sign...oysters! Should we? Hmm it's open 24hr. Is it gonna be fresh? Is it busy enough? Yelp to the rescue!! 

As you enter through the double doors you see that they have a load of daily specials. Always love a deal but we're still not convinced. Once inside, we can see its a comfortable locals spot. We get chatting with the waitress, who was so welcoming, so we dove right in. 

Tried: tuna tartare, peel n eat shrimp, gumbo (amazing presentation), ceviche, clams, and oysters. 

Everything was great! Its smoke free with video gaming on a portion of the bar. They have full liquor, tv's, wine (1/2 price bottles that day) and a decent beer selection. 
I saw PBR on draft! Sold! 

It's definitely a very affordable and consistent seafood joint. Heard about their great breakfast, it's on the list....Glad I live so close, for my late night oyster crave...

Eh, it had it's good and bad qualities. In the mist of my bar hopping I came across this place. Keep in mind that I've actually never eaten crab before. Oh yes, this gets stupid.

When I first walked in I wasn't given a greeting, I'm assuming cause they probably thought I was some middle school kid that wandered in lost. The spiderman backpack I had probably didn't help. Oh well, my problem. 

I pop a squat up at the bar, away from some obnoxious other patrons. That's right, I knew they were obnoxious the first 5 seconds I walked in. Kinda sat their awkwardly for four minutes. The other two bartenders ignored me. Thought I was waiting for mommy to finish her beer perhaps? Most likely. Could have asked though, you big jerks!

 Finally a young lady came out and greeted me with a menu, I already had my ID ready (good job following the law!) and after a few minutes I ordered a beer and the crab bucket with a mix of the two types. One, cause I don't know the difference and decided if I'm going to fuck this up, I'm going to completely 100% fuck everything up!

They brought me out all the wrecking tools used to annihilate the crab legs, and I had no idea what to do. I played creeper and watched the guy a few seats down from me work his magic and then just tried to copy him. Could have I asked the waitress? Don't boddle me with your logic!

While it was good, I must say crab is not my thing. I'm one lazy ass bitch and sitting there for half an hour to get a handful of meat is not on my to-do list, but might be a good way to starve off the fat bastards we have on our planet. Seafood for everyone!

Best Tavern , food atmosphere friendly people Family oriented. Great staff. 
Ask for Victor. I love this place, like home.
Come here on Wednesdays when their sandwiches/wraps are BOGO. Friendly, attentive staff and wide variety of menu options. Their drink specials are a steal as well.

Good food, good service. Great menu for people who dig seafood. 
$1.00 oyster night on Thursday :)

Let me get you up to date -

They changed the menu. They are now giving less food and upped the prices. This is very sad. The food is still good, but I'm very disappointed on how they made the changes.
I like it, good costumer service, delicious food:) my Loui salad was perfect, my husband san which delicious!! The beers super cold.
The food was better than average. Would come back if I needed food late at night. The pieces were good and the staff was friendly.

5 stars for the surprisingly good seafood, super CHEAP prices for graveyard/HH, and the very friendly staff!

Drinks were heavy handed and kept coming!  Toss a couple bucks in the machine to keep yourself busy as well as the drinks :P

BTW, I asked whether they were KID FRIENDLY...they said YES!  Just not after 11pm...

One of the best places to eat late...look at these prices!

Oysters on the Half Shell ($1 ea after midnight!). These were pretty good, but even better at a cheap $1 bill each! Can't even buy em on the east coast for that cheap! 

Oysters Rockefeller ($1 ea after midnight!): Garlic, Spinach and Monterey Jack Cheese. Again, can't beat the price on these! Overall pretty good.

Peel and Eat Shrimp ($4.99 after midnight!): 1/2 lb boiled in a seasoned stock. These were served hot, and had lots of flavor and Cajun seasoning. This HAD to be way more than 1/2 lb though...there were tons of shrimp!   Tasty :D

Fish Tacos ($9.95 not sure of HH price): Grilled or Battered Cod, Roasted Red Pepper Dressing, Pico de Gallo and Seared Cabbage. Not bad! 

Waffle Fries ($2.50?). Lightly seasoned...good!  We used these as a starter until midnight hit!

The food is probably only a 4, but at those prices, everything tastes better LOL

Pics!  :

The hubby and I come here about once a week and we always leave happy and satisfied. The drinks are stiff and the food is good.  Really, what more can you ask for from a bar?  I usually order the crab Louie salad. The first time I ordered it, it was way too overdressed now I ask for the salad dressing on the side.  Problem solved. The seafood in the salad has always been really fresh and plentiful too! The last time we were there the hubby ordered the fish fry.  The fish was a very large portion and the batter was oh so yummy.  I have been recently ordering the snow crab and have never been disappointed in the freshness an quality of the crab.
This used to be my go to placed for some good crab legs. Service and food quality have gone down hill over the years.
Stay away. This place serves you 12 ounces of beer and charges you for 16 oz...

So I came here with my parents while I'm visiting them in Vegas. The location is easy to find with plenty of parking, but I wasn't impressed with Shucks Tavern. When you walk in, it is DARK. There's a sign that says seat yourself, but it really isn't noticeable when you first walk in. We sat right off the bar area in what I guess is the dining room area. Being from LA, I can't get over people smoking inside bars. I guess Vegas' law says you can smoke in the bar but not in the dining room. Um... the dining room is the same room as the bar so I don't know how you'd escape the smoke. Whatever. I ordered a strawberry daiquiri off the menu only to be told that their blender is broken. For our meals, I ordered fried shrimp with fries w/ steak fries. My mom got a shrimp po'boy w/ regular fries, and my dad got a combo shrimp plate w/ steak fries. Mine came out as ordered but I had to ask twice for lemon. Mom's came with steak fries, which she doesn't like. She wanted regular fries. And dad's came out missing the coconut shrimp (which is part of the platter) because they were "all out." Long story short, something was wrong with at least one thing on each of our plates. Hello?! The service here was really iffy. The food runner looked like he was scared of the customers and our server was full on eating a meal while we were waiting for our check. We probably won't be back because the food was nothing special and the service didn't impress.

I only come here for the alcohol. So I haven't really had the food here that is not the chicken tenders. Now the chicken tenders are top notch. Outside of that, the alcohol is a bit pricey unless it's happy hour. Even then, they need happy hour more often. Now back to the food part. 

I've been here a few times and mileage may vary. My first time, I was with co workers and we waited over an hour for our food. Granted we didn't leave because we were all drinking but if it wasn't for my co workers being there. I would of just left and get food elsewhere. The following times the service was much faster.

Great low price breakfast..

Friendly service and large plates go a long way here.. 

Never go back for dinner ever again..
The food was not good. We had 8 people and all ordered different and it was all bad.
Not happy.. we really wanted it to be good. 
Bummed.

Smoke-free equals lots of stars from me! That's the main idea of this paragraph. It can be hard to find an establishment that offers video-poker that is smoke-free and serves decent kibbles, but if that's what you're looking for, look no more. Shucks is the place for you.

(I don't play video poker, but I appreciate the plight of those that are trying to keep their health while doing a little gaming.)

Shucks is known for seafood, but I am not a huge seafood eater, so I will just say that my husband, who does, likes the snow crab legs, but did not like the oysters. The oysters are farm-raised. 

I have had two different entrees: mahi fish tacos and their Black and Bleu salad. I would definitely order the fish tacos again. The only minor complaint is that the tortillas are flour, and I love corn. The salad was not incredible. It is a good value because it comes with a nice portion of flat iron steak. However, the steak was dry and under seasoned, and the lettuce a bit wilted. If executed better, I am sure it would be delicious, but on the night I visited, it fell a bit short. 

The other great thing about Shucks is that they have some type of special every day of the week. Most notably, $2-3 drafts every Monday and Wednesday. Kids eat free on Sunday. There's more, but you'll just have to roll up to find out. It will be a fun surprise for you.

This is my local bar and could forever be my favorite bar no matter where life takes me here on out. All the bartenders and servers are excellent and they do not short change you on any of the pours. Food is excellent if you like seafood and they have generous food deals every day of the week. Bears fan? Look no further for Bears games -- I do not want to spoil the enjoyment for you, just check it out.

We love Shucks and the food, we used to like to go there and gamble while having dinner or lunch.  The reason i am giving only 3 stars is not because to the food.  We have attempted to go there 3 times in the last month, each time we go in the bar is full which is where we like to eat because we are big gamblers as well.  My problem is each time we have walked around the bar every machine is occupied and 5 out of 10 are with someone either talking to another person, playing on their cell phone, or eating and there is no money on the machine nor are they playing.  The bar tenders at most of the places we go to will not let us walk out and instead will ask someone not playing to please let us have the machine.  NOT SHUCKS they always watch is walk around then watch us walk out.  To bad you don't want the gamblers in i will not be attempting again their loss.

I recently craved oysters, so I hit up the neighborhood oyster bar just down the road.

The joint managed to achieve a casual ambiance that comes off as authentically relaxing and working-class, rather than hokey or contrived - an unusual feat both for an oyster bar and for Las Vegas.

We started with four appetizers: crawfish, crab & spinach dip, calamari, and mussels.
We ordered the crawfish out of season due purely to my friend's curiosity, and their presentation was in fact rather curious. I still don't understand why they served them in the hot water in which they were boiled. This only resulted in burning our fingers when we went to peel off the shells. The crawfish had an acceptable flavor and consistency though for being of Asian origin.

The crab & spinach dip is something I would order again. With plenty of Parmesan cheese, it was definitely a savory dish, and I could taste very little of the sweet crab flavor.
The calamari was passable, but barely so as the tempura batter lacked any seasoning, and they were fried at too low a temperature, which resulted in oily breading.

There was something wrong with the mussels, though I still can't put my finger on exactly what it was. They just smelled putrid, not unlike a rotting eggplant or tomato. They tasted perfectly fine though, and neither of us got sick, though it took a while for me to get that smell out of my nose.

Next, we moved on to what we came here for with an order of oysters Rockefeller (here known as "oysters New Orleans style" - there's another menu item here called "Oysters Rockefeller" made with spinach and pepper jack cheese). They were no match for Antoine's, but then again, they were pretty damned good. I'll be getting those again. Butter, lemon and Parmesan cheese were some of the main ingredients. They were perfectly seasoned and grilled.

My friend got the steak and crab, which was a flat iron cut with snow crab legs, mashed potatoes and vegetables. I got the lobster role. The steak was cooked perfectly medium as requested. It was a quality cut and not over-seasoned. The snow crab legs tasted fresh and had a rich sweet flavor. I'd definitely recommend getting crab legs here. The potatoes were well seasoned, good consistency, and had the skin in, as I prefer. The ratio of lobster meat to mayonnaise in my lobster roll definitely favored the lobster meat, but not so much that the sandwich ended up dry. I recommend it as well.

One of the best features of Shucks is its cost-value ratio. On Fridays at least, that appetizer special was unbeatable, even if we did strike out on a couple of them, and even the menu prices were a great value. For its ambiance, food quality and value, Shucks is definitely worth the trip.

Arrived around 6:10pm on a Saturday night, the hostess sat us down right away and promptly got our drinks. That was the best part of the experience.

Then, we waited for our server to order our dinner. And waited, and waited, and waited. 

15 minutes later, our server arrived so we could order. Crab cake appetizer to share, lobster Po Boy for the wife, and I ordered one of their signature burgers. Garlic fries with both of the sandwiches.

15 minutes later, the appetizer arrived.
Crab cakes were mediocre, at best. The presentation was nice, the Cole slaw was decent, but the crab cakes were over cooked.

15 minutes later, our dinners arrived.
The wife liked the bread of her Po Boy, but the sandwich was missing the tomatoes that should have been on it. She also liked the garlic fries. It was a good size serving, about half her plate, with a good ratio of garlic to fries.

My burger was supposed to have their "Shucks" sauce, but it was so dry, I couldn't tell if it had it or not. I got about half of the fries that my wife received, but, my fries had much more garlic. When I finished eating the fries that I could, there was a three inch mound of garlic left on the plate. Simply not edible, and I like garlic!

15 minutes later, we received our bill.
Of course it was wrong, the server had added an order of oysters from the table next to us, to our bill. 5 minutes later, we were able her about the error and she said that she was going to correct it. Then, they tried to deliver the order of oysters to us. 

Laughable at best. 

This is one of those combination gaming pubs/restaurants . Not crazy smokey, but noticeable when you walk in. 

The tell tale sign was there when we walked in; there were open seats at the bar, a little after 6 on a college football Saturday night.

It didn't seem to be too busy, but it took well over an hour to get some crab cakes, a sandwich and a burger. Might have been an off night, but I'm not willing to chance it again. This place deserves zero stars.
Great Service. Comfortably atmosphere. Was a little disappointed they didn't have clam chowder available, and the broccoli cheddar soup was kinda bland. The scallop sliders were delicious though.
Husband home from working in the PA woods for a few days and we have to hit his FAVORITE place for the best mussels known to man. 5.00 mussels Friday nights.
I was very impressed with the 2 for 1 burgers with endless fries! ... The oyesters are not bad either but not worth the price... Service was ok and you'll probably spend $10-15 on a meal.
Great for the price and awesome staff. Never a disappointment. Great drinks. Thursday is oyster shooter  day 2 bucks for a oyester shot. Great location.
I was happier her in my first visit. The second time, not so much. Our server sucked the second time around. I'll still retire for the coconut shrimp! It was amazing.

I mostly go here because the bartenders are really cool.  They really take care of you when it comes to service and making you feel at home.  The atmosphere makes me feel like I'm sitting in a garage but I find it cool.  I usually go for the seared Tuna which is great...  I've gotten the crab buckets a few times, I didnt get the oysters b/c the waitress couldnt tell me where they were from, I'm from Florida so I kinda take seafood seriously...  For late night snacks and drinks with friends I would definately check it out, its tucked away in the corner across the street from Smiths by the way

Great bar food here and small but decent selection of beer.  It's pretty smoky in here though. Not sure why they continue to allow children in even though they have a 21 and over sign. There are kids in there every time. They should remodel if they want to be a family friendly place and care about their guests.
Love their food and they have great bartenders!  We went in to have breakfast and sat at the bar to play, but wish they would not allow cigar smokers.

I was told this place had $1 oysters at midnight.  Since I'm allergic to shellfish, I don't really care, I came here for the company and not for the food.  For people like me, there are non-shellfish options such as fish, chicken wings, fries, burgers and alcohol!

We sat at the bar.  They have black jack/ keno machines, etc.  The bar tender was cool.

I got a Malibu Bay Breeze per Honny's recommendation as I perused through the menu. The waffle fries comes with ketchup and ranch dipping sauce...they were good.  It must have been the alcohol or I simply had a death wish because I ordered Rockefeller oysters when I didn't have Benadryl.  I remember liking them when I was little before I developed my allergies.  It seemed like a good idea at that moment until I ate 3 oysters and some of my friend's Cajun shrimps - and my arm, my face and my back started to itch and my stomach started to hurt...the only thing I was waiting on was the anaphylactic reaction.  Centennial Hills Hospital is only a few blocks away so I wasn't worried.  Good oysters though...spinach, cheese, oyster with a bit of hot sauce...mmmm...

In New England, you can get a dozen oysters for $12-13 at a very good restaurant.  Shucks' $1 oyster at midnight = $12 for a dozen from their Graveyard Menu...sounds like a good deal to me.  They're open 24/7 too and also on their Graveyard Menu: burger with fries for  $4, wings and fries for $4-8, chicken fingers and fries for $5-10, shrimps for $5 and clam strips for $4.  Late-night cheap eats!

Schucks Burger is a thumps up
Shrimp Po Boy is a thumbs up
Flat Iron Steak is a thumbs up
Never seem to have clam chowder anymore

Machines get a bad rep in this place! Sing up for the club to spin the wheel.

Yummy! This is where I go when I crave American-style seafood. They have affordable prices and big portions for the money. I love their oven bakes the best which are usually good for two people and are basically seafood (mussles, clams, lobster etc.), potatoes, corn baked together. I love the intermingling of flavors and the freshness and the size!

The deserts are also great as are the drinks. The 24 hour part is definitely a plus just in case I am craving some lobster at midnight (has happened before). 

I like the decor. It's simple, but effective. This place is rarely crowded, and seeing how I hate crowds, it's a major plus for me. The wait staff is very good.

I miss this place since I moved to SW part of the valley. I'd like to try the other Shucks closer to me, but this one on N. Durango is highly recommended.

Best late night oyster spot.

Food is always great, super awesome oysters along with friendly bar tenders. It bums me out we don't have a place like this here in So Cal, but then again that means i cant burn it out, right? 


I may be a little blind to what good oysters are, but it makes me smile and that's all that matters.

My boyfriend and i went there and had a pretty good meal. We were waiting for 2 gaming machines to come available at the bar. There was an elderly couple playing then they got up and sat at a table to eat their dinner. We sat at the machines they were playing and i moved a napkin from the top of the machine. From behind me i heard, excuse me, we are playing that machine. There was no money in it. I asked the bartender about this, and this is what pissed me off, she said "why did you want to play this certain machine?" I said we just wanted to sit together and play. The bartender stuck up for the older couple. You should not be able to hold a machine while you go off and have your dinner. BAD Bartender-bad customer service. We are new to vegas, but we are still paying customers. We had a great waiter, but what followed left a really bad taste in our mouths. Shame on you Bartender. This happened on 12-4 in the afternoon. Bartender needs a lesson on customer service.

Great fresh oysters, lobster roll and shrimp ceviche were on the menu when we settled into our table in the bar.   Great service, great food, and a big menu..fresh seafood, burgers wings, entrees , and dessert.   Great prices on wine and beer.

I love Shucks-- $1 oysters on Thursdays!! I 'll take 30- so good. =)

The oysters are so fresh here. Actually all of their seafood is fresh and good. The gumbo is really rich and tasty. Every night of the week they have specials and their breakfast is 3.95 for all items. 

The service is always good and this is a Cowboys bar. If you come on game day, good luck, it will be jammed packed.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!! Management sucks and so does the bartender Sean if you get him. They have good breakfast specials and that is it, their oysters and seafood aren't even fresh. Use to be a fan of this place but after the last time I will NEVER be back again.

came here for some late munching (or more like pigging out) and ordered oysters, linguine with clams, lamb chops with salad, and jumbo shrimp.  i'm not an oyster eater but i was told it was pretty good.  the linguine was definitely very very yummy but if you're on a diet, i'd say stay away from this pool of butter.  the lamb chops were average, not nearly as good as the ones we has at texas de brazil the night before, but the salad that came with it was pretty good.  altho i'm sure you're not going to order some lamb chops just for the side salad.  last but definitely not least, the jumbo shrimps.  they are jumbo alright... these "shrimps" are more like lobsters!  they tasted so good.  great texture, lightly seasoned so it's not overpowering, and it comes with a little tub of butter.  i had them w/o butter and they were delicious.  would definitely come back again on our next vegas trip!

Giving one star because the server was attentive and did remove the shrimp we sent back from our bill.
I read about this place on Buzzfeed, "10 best places to get crab". We ordered;
Snow crab, this was clearly frozen a long time. Very dried out with very little flavor
Dungeness crab, just meh.... Nothing special.
Peel & eat shrimp (hot). Way over cooked. 
Chicken tenders, fries and chowder. Tenders were over cooked as were fries. Chowder tasted like it came from a can and was so salty it couldn't be eaten.
I will never recommend this place, nor will I try it myself again.

My husband and I have been here many times. The service can be hit or miss, but the food has always been good. My husband is especially fond of the lobster rolls. I have also been here a few times with friends to grab some drinks. Prices are pretty average for the city.

My family comes here on a regular basis when in the mood for seafood. It's a great neighborhood joint with a super cozy feel. The service is always top notch and the food is consistently fresh. My kids love the popcorn shrimp kids meals, and having to help them finish a few times i can attest to the fact that they are quite tasty. I can't bring myself to ever order anything besides the Clambake. It includes 1lb of snow crab legs, 1/2 lb of dungeness crab legs, 1lb clams, corn, potatoes and sausage. I have not yet been successful in actually finishing it but it never stops me from trying. My 10 year old shares it with me on most occasions. As a matter of fact, this was her restaurant of choice to celebrate her most recent birthday. We had 11 guests in all and the service was seamless. I called in advance and they set aside an area for our large party. My Dad raved about the fish fry platter, so I might have to try that at some point. I'm also curious about the breakfast specials!

My bf and I were looking for a good place to go for breakfast besides Ihop and Denny's, this place fit the bill. They offered a decent selection of 10-12 meals with extra sides at the bottom of the menu for a couple dollars more. I had your typical breakfast meal (2 eggs, 3 slices of bacon, hash browns, and an english muffin)...  everything was cooked perfectly and tasted wonderful! Don't expect Claim Jumper portions but you will get a filling meal for only $3.95! The waitress was fantastic and had a great personality which is very rare these days! We will be coming back soon to try out the dinner menu and will definitely be recommending this place to people in the NW.

We are close enough to walk here.  It's been in the neighborhood for a long time.  Last year we came on Friday's several times for the $5 appetizers and really enjoyed them.  The same thing we are enjoying tonight!  The fried calamari was light and crispy, served with a pretty good dipping sauce, and the crab and artichoke dip was served pipping hot!  It had big chunks of crab inside.

I ordered the blackened Mahi Mahi fish taco's, it was a little disappointing, the fish had hardly any flavor and were small.  I have had better items from their menu.  The prices are good, the service is excellent, overall, it's a good place for some fairly decent seafood.

I can't even list any stars for this place tonight, but listed 1 since Yelp reviews require it. After ordering our first round of drinks (which a couple folks never even receiver theirs), we never saw our waiter again until someone from his staff went and got him an hour later.  I'm not really sure how you ignore s table of 12, but maybe he didn't like tips....just terrible service overall.

Service was very slow. Had to search for our server to get a condoment.
The Tuna Wrap was great. Very fresh and large portion.

Hands down some of the best seafood I've ever had! They had such a great variety and big portions! Great bang for your buck! Also They even brought my daughter out a piece of AMAZING chocolate cake for her birthday! It's a must try!!

Music is always good - love the classic rock playlist.  Fish is mostly good for almost every dish on menu.  Most is fresh which is hard to filings in Vegas.  Marty bartender is awesome.  He came from Shucks on Eastern & Serene.  Tons of TVs.  Good local vibe.  My favorite dish is the blackened chicken tacos with their signature salsa.

Came here to meet up with friends. We just wanted to eat, drink and catch up. Sorry to say I don't know our servers name, but he knew we were there to talk and enjoy  the company.  We ordered round after round of appetizers over a three hour period and he was great.  The oysters were so good, we ending up getting three dozen by the end of the night. Most places like to turn tables quickly, but they were patient and courteous with us. We asked for tortilla chips for the dip because one of our group could not eat the flour chips, which have a great spice sprinkle, with the amazing crab dip, and their response was immediate.  The shrimp ceviche was fresh and flavorful. Mussels had a fantastic broth. Thank you for an amazing night.

The night staff is super friendly. My co-workers and I enjoy going after work. The breakfast is pretty average and so are the prices. The chicken fingers are average as well. The day staff is a little grumpy but It is our night time in the morning. There are several bars to choose from and this one is not on the top of the list.
I like the friendly and personable staff, their Menu, and the fact that Classic Rock and Roll is played as you enjoy your meal and company.

For a little offsite bar, I actually find their oyster and seafood selection to be excellent.  

Some odd years ago, I fell in love with the concept of oysters.  While Vegas is absolutely nowhere near the beach, their selection is pretty tasty and reasonably priced.  They also serve a great selection of seasoned seafood.  Their appetizer selection is solid, and their drinks are most definitely not watered down (their Bloody Marys are stout), but if you want to pretend that you're at some little seaside hole in the wall and just munch on shrimp and oysters, then this is most definitely your place.

I'm more surprised that I haven't reviewed this place already.  I go over there fairly regularly when I feel the need for some reasonable, off-Strip seafood that isn't sushi.  One of the nicer aspects is the fact that they really do have a wide variety of seasonings to cover your meal in, and I'm a sucker for Old Bay seasoning.  Their sandwich fare is also excellent.

Like I said, it's a little bar/restaurant place.  I like the fact that it isn't smoky, the menu is pretty diverse, and the staff are nice  My only real downside is that it is a little far from my side of town but really, if that's the worst thing, then I can manage.

If you are a shrimp and oyster fan, then go nuts here.

Okay place when you're in the mood for seafood and don't feel like driving to the strip. Although we've never hung out at the bar, it does look very enjoyable to have a nice conversation while sipping on a long island iced tea.

When we do visit, we enjoy the fish sandwich and anything crab they sell. And don't forget to get the criss-cut fries...

One of the better seafood restaurants in the northwest part of town. It's was a buy busy and took about 15 minutes to receive our drink order, but the waitress was consistently checking in on us and was very polite. Great place we will definitely be back!

Pros:  The $3.95 breakfast
The selection is limited, but the options are good.  I really liked the sausage patty croissant sandwich that comes with hash browns.
The portions are not huge, but I like that.  It's a good breakfast for the price, and you don't walk out feeling so full that you can't move.

Cons:  We've been here half a dozen times, and have never run into any kind of a drink special.  For just a local, no frills, tavern kind of bar the drink prices are a little high.    

I might come back for some cheap country fried steak, but I don't think I'll be drinking here anymore.  There are just too many better options in this neighborhood.

Was my favorite place for years , now I'm beyond disappointed with their food and service . First .. I frequented a few times a week because I loved the iced tea . Fresh brewed and was so good . Now it's on the gun and doesn't even taste like tea. So gross ! So instead of saving money you are losing money from those of us who don't drink soda. Water is free . Portion sizes have gone down a lot . If I have to pay for 3 orders of chicken just to get a normal size amount on my nachos (and I'm not a huge eater ) then I think it's time to find a new place . 15 years of consistently being good to changing things monthly . Sad ! Oysters up in price and down in quality. whatever you are doing isn't working . Bring back your old service and products .
Brought my son here to watch the NBA Finals and for the wings and tenders! We had wonderful service from Jonnae! Great food and cold beer! See you soon!

Been here a couple of times, they have always found us a place and the food has never been bad. OK we are in the desert and know that nothing is caught here, but that aside for a good value off strip meal they are hard to beat

I had the Shucks fish fry. It was great! My only complaint was that I could have eaten more of the fish. I wasn't too find of the coleslaw, but Im not a fan of that in general. The service is also great, and my baby loved the clam chowder.

We love shucks. My husband and I come here every Wednesday morning for breakfast and sometimes my mom and I come for dinner. Their food is great. Joe is their best waiter by far. Great service and friendly.
Cheap, delicious oysters and they have deals on their wine. YUM!

Used to be a Cowboy Bar with a crazy atmosphere filled with knowledgable fans. I guess they couldn't survive through all the Romo injuries either, because the place has died out tremendously now. Hence the 3star rating. However if you want a local bar that has surprisingly good to very good seafood & gaming, this is your place.

Crab legs here are simply delicious. I love this place, it hasn't failed me. & they're 24 hours! If you want a crab legs and oysters and a nice beer this the place. They even have seafood benedicts! I always go for the raw oysters and dungeness king crab legs with potatoes and corn.  Making my mouth water writing this lol

I'm from Chicago which means it's hard to find a restaurant in a different state that'll meet your taste buds but this restaurant here is definitely the best seafood restaurant I've been to and the service is great!

I love seafood therefore I love Shucks. Great fresh seafood priced non-Strip. To those negative reviewers here I offer them some sage advice. Don't go to a seafood joint for burgers or steaks. For god sakes this place is known for its great seafood. If you love seafood you'll love Shucks.
a good place to catch a Chicago Bears game and food and service is pretty good as well.
Great place for breakfast. Friendly staff and cheap prices with good portions.
I love clam chowder in the sourdough bowl ,they make very good food and doing good service,  we'll be back

Went to Shucks for the express purpose of having oysters on the half shell. I ordered a half dozen. I lived in New Orleans and great Gulf oysters are available there year-round. What a disappointment at Shucks! The oysters were small and spindly and tasteless. One was so small I had trouble finding it in its half-shell.

I followed with the seafood bisque which was excellent but eat fast; it's best piping hot.

Realize that the two stars are for the quality of the oysters not the tavern. I first ordered a Heineken which was served in an ultra cold glass. It was most welcome. The bartender was very friendly and my waiter was attentive and friendly. The tavern itself was not smoky.

There are four TVs placed in such a way that only a few can see them well. There was only one broadcasting a live baseball game, the others, sports history  (I watched rerun of Super Bowl XVII, Balt (34) vs SF (31), still exciting). All-in-all, the tavern is a pleasant place (early Sunday evening) and well run. It was just the oysters that piqued me.

After going to Shucks I'm wondering whether a restaurant can advertise itself as an oyster bar year-round in a desert city. Oysters are mostly seasonal unless one lives close to the source (such as New Orleans or Houston) so we here in the middle of the desert may not be able to get quality oysters certain times of the year. Just thinkin' out loud here.

Love this place! Come here regularly with some buddies to catch up and get a few drinks at the bar. Food is bomb, staff is friendly, and prices are fair. Would recommend this place to anyone looking to relax at a great bar and grub on some delicious food.
Favorite oyster bar in town. Love the food and staff. Very convenient and a++ a Bears bar

Agree with the John Taffer comment, I think we encountered the dumbest and laziest bar staff in Vegas. A crowded bar with a lot of unhappy people. So sad we just got up and left

Don't waste your time or money.

Our whole family has been coming here for years.
Sometimes with the kids and sometimes without. We took our granddaughters there today for lunch because their mom is in the hospital across the street. We walked in, sat at a table, and after about 10 minutes of waiting for menus and the girls telling us how excited they were for their sliders, and happy to see them smile after such a stressful beginning to the New Year, a waitress walked up and said kids weren't allowed in there. Fine....you changed your rules. But someone could have approached us when we first came in and not 10 minutes later. Smooth move people. We are definitely former customers - there are about 12 of us that used to frequent there. The way we were treated on such a stressful day definitely proved that this establishment does not deserve our money. We will be talking about this to everyone we know.

Bad service, and so so food. 
Overpriced for what you are getting and I pay to have good service too which never happened

I ordered a one pound burger It was the biggest burger I've ever seen
I ate the whole thing very yummy service was ok

So our first time coming here was a pretty bad experience. My husband, and brother in law, and myself were in the mood for some seafood, and decided to give this place a try after seeing some of the good reviews on yelp. 
When we first walked in we werent really greeted, so we just found an open table (that wasn't covered in old dishes that hadn't been bussed yet). About 15 minutes later we had a servicer come take our drink orders. After about another 15 minutes we were able to order. My husband ordered a crab bucket, his brother a shrimp bucket, and I Ordered a shrimp poboy. We also got two appetizers the calamari and the clam strips. 
The calamari was burnt to a crisp, like crack your jaw and slice up the inside of your mouth burnt crisp. And the clam strips were more like fat little clam chunks, I've never seen them cut up that way. And they were very tough. Unlike the calamari they were at least edible, unfortunately there were only like 4 clam strips on the plate. All together the appetizers were very disappointing. 
By this time we've long been out of water. And couldn't seem to catch the attention of the 2 servers that were rushing around past our table. Finally when our food was brought to us (maybe other 15-20 minutes had passed) we asked the server who had brought the food for some refills, and tried to place an order for a drink. She kind of stared for a few seconds then repeated the drink order and said alright no problem and seemed to be off to put the drink order in and bring refills. We never saw her or our drinks the rest of the night. 
The food we ordered was ok. The portions for the shrimp and crab buckets were very small. Both meals came out in small bowls, with an empty bucket to throw the shells away in.. so I guess that's what the bucket part is about. Which is very misleading.
All in all it was not a good experience. I'm not sure if we'll be coming back here. It's a shame too because we really wanted to like it since it's so close to our house.

WORST SERVICE. Stopped here on a friday morning between 2-3am, craving for some oysters, it was just in the neighborhood.. i have been here before (at an earlier time of the night) and i liked their food. Its not spectacular but it can still satisfy one's cravings. We were asking the bartender (only guy in there) what dishes do they have for oysters except for raw. He threw us the menu and said, "thats why theres the menu" i have never been treated rudely as a customer like that! Right then and there we left the place! Didnt get the guy's name but WOULD NOT recommend this place, very disrespectful and rude staff running this place someone like him shouldnt be working there or anywhere!

Another night of Monday Night Football with friends and this night we decided to try Shuck's, a place I had been to 6-7 years ago on a late night and recall having enjoyed their food.  We settled in at a table that was not entirely satisfying because the view of the TV screens were a bit awkward.  Too small, too far, blind spots... eh, not great for MNF.  Nevertheless, we are hungry, games have started, and staff were nice so we decide to stick around.  Despite being a sub-par venue for game-watching this particular night, it was still an enjoyable evening.

I find Shuck's to be quite unique in its offerings.  It's not an uppity oyster bar, but it is an oyster bar.  The setting is casual, almost Joe's Crab Shack-ish, but more laid back and better menu.  It has a long list of seafood menu, including buckets of variety of steamed items such as crabs, clams, crawfish, etc.  Fried seafood entrees, variety of seafood soups, wide selection of seafood-based apps,  clam bakes, and pastas, not to mention the requisite variety of oyster dishes and even non-seafood sandwiches, make for an extensive menu.  Happy hour was over so there wasn't any great deals in place, but I find their prices to be quite a bargain to begin with so I think it's worthwhile anytime.  

I did not taste others' dishes, but myself had the crab & spinach dip and beer battered coconut shrimp basket.  The dip was especially good, with meaty chunks of crabs amply mixed in.  The shrimp was also very good, not too bready and full of sweet, coconut flavor.  Fries that came with it was pretty good, nothing spectacular.  I did try a bit of my brother's fish 'n chips, and that was quite good as well, with crispy and light breading.  Solid 4 stars for the food, especially considering the reasonable prices.

I'd like to come here more often and try to knock off a considerable amount of items on the menu that has some very interesting dishes.  Friendly service, casual atmosphere, and good prices make it a definite spot for having a few with your buddies, in spite of the TV ergonomics that could use some work.

Table-for-1 Factor:  There is a large, long bar where you can, and many did, sit by yourself and watch the game.  In fact, it might be preferable since the good TV screens are at the bar.

It was our first time here. I had the fish and chips, which were fantastic. Nice and crisp served with a house made tarter sauce - also very good. My husband had the shrimp combo platter. This platter comes with 4 coconut shrimp, 4 hand breaded shrimp and 4oz. Popcorn shrimp. He enjoyed the popcorn shrimp the most. The coconut shrimp was a little bland and the hand breaded was tough and very fishy tasting. On Sunday's they have a 2 for $20 deal on all of their seafood entrees and 1/2 price bottles of wine. Overall it's a great atmosphere and well definitely be back in the future.
Truly the best seafood restaurant in Las Vegas.Fresh ,delectable and the price is reasonable!
This place is great..it's clean and the food is amazing ...the best coconut shrimp I have ever had.. my boyfriend had the taco sampler and it was delicious..
We waited at least 30 mints to get our appetizer and then when you came the food came right after. The stake was raw and the shrimp was really oily. Never going back
Often we get poor service, but keep coming back for the fish fry. You get a HUGE fillet of fried fish with fries and slaw for $11. I never leave hungry or dissatisfied with my food.

I like this place. Both locations. All is good. ALWAYS. Not top quality fish but for what it's worth it's good. The staff is friendly and always happy to help. I go with friends, I go with family. No problem bringing the kids. It's always a pleasure.

Favorite night to go here is for the Monday night special buffalo Chicken strips and always order fries with them. It is a great place at night not a lot of people and you can get whatever table you want. Its a great locals place. 
The food we have tried here is good. Worth checking out.

The first time I went here about a year ago the food was ok. Had the lobster finger appetizer and they were pretty good. 
So, last night when I went I was so disappointed when I ordered the lobster fingers again and they weren't that great. Overlooked, over breaded, dry, and chewy. 
Then I got the pan roast with clams. On the menu it says that there is also shrimp, crab, scallops, and white fish in the bowl. There was 1, ONE, scallop, 2 shrimp, 2 tiny pieces of white fish and NO, crab!!!!  For $18.95!!!!  What a ripoff!!  
Also this place is a borderline dive bar. It reeks!!!  I mean literally the place smells disgusting!!  There is no barrier between the people smoking at the bar and the tables where you eat. And that smell hits you as soon as you walk in the door.  And this place is also so loud I was starting to get a headache!!  And I'm hard of hearing!!  Do not go if you want to speak to the person you are going with!!  It's that loud. Big screen TVs everywhere and I swear they had the volume turned up on every single one of them. They weren't all tuned to the same station but they were all tuned to some kind of sports!!!  
Oyster Bar?  No!!  This is a sports bar that you can get some substandard food that resembles seafood. 
I won't be back!!!

Jaqueline is the best server. We first met her when she was a bus girl 2014 She was doing all the work while our server was tending to other quests. There was one time she did all the work and we gave her the tip because the server personality
was not on duty for us but it was to his other tables. I know I wrote about that incident. Nevertheless she became a server probably about 16 months ago. We have been coming in the day time and we look for her but I have not wrote about it because I could not remember her name.
I did call up there one time and told the Mgr. about her nd again I could not remember her name. However this time we got her name and looking forward to her serving us again. Her performance and personality is awesome. 
We ordered the Crab & Spinach dip always awesome. First time ordering the wings 
{Monday's  are  Wings and Chicken fingers} Special We got the Wings Hawaiian 
and they were extremely good. I thought the sauce was a little to spicy but my husband loved it. She let us taste the sauce before ordering it on the wings I opt to sauce on side. There blue cheese is soo good. I had the fried oysters {12} of them hubby had the Dungeness Crab and then he ordered the snow crab.
Everything was excellent. Nice service good food this was the perfect day.
Thank You Jaqueline 
Hope to see you soon

I like Shucks a lot for the no smoking and Carina is an awesome bartender/ waitress always friendly and attentive.  Then there's the food primarily seafood but great pasta, burgers and fish and chips.  I'm glad there's no more paint night, couldn't get into the place before.  It's great for late night dinner.

Does this place ever disappoint?  Not so far for me!

This time I began with a dozen cold and very delicious oysters on the half shell and a side Caesar Salad that was fresh, cool, and enhanced by a surprisingly good zesty Caesar Dressing.  This was followed by a generous portion of nice and flaky fresh Parmesan Halibut with drinkable Lemon Butter Sauce that was paired with tasty moist Rice Pilaf.  Meanwhile my dining companions enjoyed Fish & Chips with colossal Onion Rings, and a Crab Bucket containing equal parts of Dungeness Crab and Snow Crab, along with great Roasted Red Potatoes.

We again enjoyed fine service and an overall five-star dining experience!

This place is AWSOME!!!
The food is delicious!!! Next best thing then  Actually eating off at the wharf in San Francisco. This place I would recommend any day of the week.
Looking forward to coming back soon.

What I usually order is the 2 1/2 lb snow crab bucket ($5 off on Saturdays), dozen half shell oysters ($1 oysters on Thursdays) and their borracho oyster shooters ($2 oyster shooters on Thursdays)... Oh sooooo good! The crab legs are lightly seasoned and always warm, the oysters are always fresh. You have to order the fried cheesecake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream for dessert. Delicious! It is definitely one of my favorite spots to go to!

Taste: -1
Creativity/Authenticity: 2
Atmosphere: 2
Service: 4
Bang for your buck: 3.5

Are you serious how is this place still open??!! what are you people eating here? Should have stuck with my first instincts and not stopped here; but i love oysters and never been to this spot so my curiosity spiked and went in... bad idea first off having only one type of oyster does not make you an oyster bar. Second got the clam chowder and the fish tacos Eeeek me thinks not is right!!! the clam chowder was ok but the fish taco WTF!! first off how do you mess up fish tacos? well other than the cooked cabbage and frozen fish this is the worst fish taco I have ever had. Break down the fish was def frozen and tasted like plastic, the shrimp taco was also frozen and tasted like plastic and to top it off why would you put the deep fried fish on top of the cabbage? im guessing they let my tacos sit for a while because when i got my tacos bam cooked cabbage nice and soggy just the way no one likes em. The only reason this place even got one star was the service the waiter offered to replace our tacos and when we said we didnt want anything he even took it off the bill, good job thank you

I'm conflicted. Cigarette smoke, crap beer selection, ho hum atmosphere and great seafood... What?!? Wish the restaurant had better separation from the bar, so you don't walk out smelling like an ashtray. Half pound of Dungeness was great, though likely not enough to get me to come back.

This is one of my favorite places for seafood. They have really tasty $5 appetizers like crab cocktail and crab and spinach dip and calamari and the shrimp combo platter is outstanding with the pineapple dip it comes with. You can pretty much watch a game from any table you are at. They also have super cheap breakfasts although I've never been.

Worst Bears bar I've ever been to.
Place is filled with smoke.
Food is average.   Service was not friendly.
Neither were the bears fans.

Love this place... 

Great happy hour specials and the two guys running the bar and kitchen are awesome. They never try to push you to order anything extra, they don't force you to hurry.. They are very laid back , attentive.. Never charged me for any extras or messed up our food.

You cannot beat their $1 oysters and their burger combo ( fries, cheese and mushrooms included) for under 5 bucks. 

My brother tried the seafood omelette, and was impressed with the taste and the price. 

The only thing is that they don't have the best beer specials, however that is easy to overlook with all the other great things this place has to offer.

We are going to come back every chance we get.. I'm looking forward to trying their regular menu.

This has to one of the worst places I ever ate, gumbo has absolutely no flavor it taste like water. The oysters where obviously pre shucked and refrigerated with the worst seafood taste ever. The shrimp cocktail looked so dry we sent it back. Had the Fish n chips for first time in years and well I guess it's gonna be years again before I give them another shot. The fries are very small and pathetic. My friend said the shrimp po boy was ok but still couldn't get the second half down. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone

Love this place since seafood and Las Vegas are normally hard to combine. Since I am from the NW (part of the country) and near the ocean, I thought the portions were a bit small for the prices. Creative menu and drinks, some of them I have never heard of and enjoyed tremendously. We had the clam bake for two that was just enough for one of us (we love seafood and grew up with it) and I had a pasta seafood dish. Tasty. Atmosphere was nice although the occasional drunk from across the bar made conversation a bit rough at times. Seat yourself, you choose your booths! Would go back anytime but probably when I got paid again since we left after spending $130 for two.

I have been going to Shucks for quite some time now.  I am pretty dissappionted in the one star reviews on here.  There is a pretty big group of us that frequent the place, all of us being in F&B so we're pretty picky.  Being in the business we all get off pretty late and tend to get there near graveyard.  Mickey will start us off & Larry keeps us there.  The reason we still go there, after SEVERAL years, is the customer service.  Larry makes us feel at home & pays attention to the small details that make the difference.  I am the a manager of a restaurant in a hotel and Larry has always stood out as what I would want in a great employee.  AND we order the $3.95 breakfast specials....  Maybe the difference in our experience is we all know how to treat people that are serving us & working their butts off, with respect!  
Save your one star reviews...  This place is a gem!!
The only 24 hour bar close to my house. The food here is great, prompt, clean, and great service.

I've been to Shuck's on three separate occasions in the last few weeks. Each time I have had a salad. 

The first time I had the shrimp Caesar. It was plentiful for the price, the dressing was delicious and the lettuce was fresh. The second and third time I stayed consistent with a black & bleu which is a steak salad wth Caesar dressing and bleu cheese. I would never think the flavors would go together but it's splendid combination. The steak was perfectly cooked as well. 

They have excellent drink specials and prices are on point. The atmosphere is like any other bar in town. Nondescript and dark, but the food more than makes up for that.

I came in on a Friday around 5:00 P.M.
We sat down in the bar area immediately. It was probably 10 minutes before we put in our drink orders and then another 10 before we got our first round and the wait times only got worse from there.
At one point there ran out of glasses.

My mother-in-law is visiting from Hong Kong and looooooves raw oysters.  When I saw that Shucks had $1 oysters on Thursdays, I knew that I had to take her here.  My husband and I had treated her to Joe's Stone Crab the weekend prior, where she devoured really expensive, albeit delicious, raw oysters.  So, obviously the $1 oysters weren't going to even compare.  

The oysters on the half shell were quite small, but perhaps I need to come on a non $1 each night, to see the true quality.  I also ordered a cup of the seafood bisque, and it was OK.  My in-laws ordered the clam chowder and they seemed to enjoy it.  By the end of lunch, the two of us ate 3 dozen raw oysters, and although they weren't the best I have ever tasted, it was nice knowing that we didn't break the bank to get our fill.  

The service is friendly, but it is a little too smoky for my asthmatic lungs. We sat in the non-smoking section, however that invisible wall does not prevent the smoke from seeping into my air space.  If I wasn't so sensitive to the cigarette smoke, I would definitely return.  It is a fun atmosphere, and a great neighborhood bar for sport lovers and seafood fans.

I love coming here for breakfast. I would like to consider myself a regular. It's inexpensive & never have to wait to be seated like most breakfast places. The staff is super friendly. It is a bar but I come here with my family on weekend mornings, totally don't even realize I am at a bar. It's decorated in Chicago sports gear! So today, I noticed a new menu & the churro waffle is to die for. You don't even need syrup! Love it.

I've been wanting to try this place for a few years and this weekend I decided to stop in and check it out. I love oysters so I was pretty excited- I was a bit surprised by the inside but still excited. I grabbed a smaller table by the bar and anxiously looked through the menu. It was just a drink menu but I picked out my drink and was looking forward to the lunch menu but no one greeted me. No one came to my table. No one served me at all. They looked at me but didn't acknowledge me in any way. So I sat there. And sat there. And sat there some more. It wasn't busy there was several dirty tables that needed attending to but they weren't busy cleaning any of them. I saw at least 5 servers/bartenders and not one came to take my order. It was a major disappointment.

This is a great place to grab some steamers and a brew.  They also have some standard seafood fare like fish and chips, and clam strips, but their soups are pretty above par as well.  I've never been disappointed coming here for eats and the 24/7 angle is great for night owls like me. Hoot!
